loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is married and cares for five family members. She attended school through senior high.

Adjoa sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a trader.

Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

She will use this loan to increase her stock of goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business she plans to reinvest in her business and expand her capital base.

loans.use: Adjoa will use the loan to increase her stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: Celia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Celia del Socorro V., tiene la edad de 37 años habita en el sector de buenos aires ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales actualmente estudian y le ayudan cuando hay producción, el esposo de doña Celia trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar. La señora de dedica a la agricultura y va cuatro días de la semana a vender al mercado de la capital Managua, ella comenzó su negocio de lo mismo que cultiva, pero eso solo lo hacia cuando sale la cosecha; después de un tiempo decidió comprar frutas y verduras que con sus propios esfuerzos y de su esposo ha logrado establecer un poco su negocio. Con la ayuda de Afodenic que durante cuatro préstamos la ha apoyado, la señora se siente contenta porque su producción la vende a mejor precio, por los insumos que le aplica con cada préstamo que hace a nutra institución
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia del Socorro V. is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires located in the municipality of Ticuantepe along with her husband and two children who are currently in school and who also help her with her work. Celia's husband works as a security guard in a private home to help her with household expenses. She works in agriculture and goes four days a week to sell in the market in the capital city of Managua. She started her business by selling what she herself grows but only when she produces products to harvest. After a while she decided to buy fruits and vegetables and with her own effort, and that of her husband, has managed to somewhat establish her business. With the help of Afodenic, that has supported her with four loans, Celia feels happy as she can sell her products at a better price because the supplies that she buys with each loan help to nourish her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and insecticides for crops

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta, a member of the Gratitud Village Bank, is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. A dental technician with an office in her home where she makes and fits false teeth, she is also studying stomatology (the science dealing with the mouth and its diseases) at a local university.  Modesta is requesting a loan to buy materials to make more false teeth, and her dream is to save up for her graduation to open her own practice with modern facilities. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy materials to make false teeth

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. sells cosmetics in Broyinbima, near Elmina. She attended school through junior high. She is married and has two children. Josephine's husband is a trader.

Josephine has been selling cosmetics since 2004. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

She is requesting a loan so she can buy more cosmetics to sell and meet the increased demand from her clients. She will use the increased profits to reinvest back into her business so she can increase her income and provide her children with quality education.

A few samples of Josephine's cosmetics are pictured.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Née le 28 janvier 1970 à Lomé, madame W. Martine est une fille célibataire avec deux (2) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de boisson locale qu’elle-même prépare avec du sorgho, de l’eau et avec du bois de chauffe. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1993 et a beaucoup de clients qui sont généralement des cultivateurs et des menuisiers.
Toutefois cette boisson est appréciée par la plupart des gens surtout en période de fête. 
Elle sollicite  ce premier crédit pour acheter deux (2) sacs de sorgho et 5 fagots de bois de chauffe.
texts.en:
Born on January 28, 1970 in Lomé, Mrs. Martine W. is a single mother of two. She sells a local drink that she makes herself from sorghum and water with the aid of firewood. She has been doing this since 1993 and has a lot of customers, mainly farmers and carpenters.Nevertheless, most people enjoy this drink, especially during festive periods. She is requesting a first-time loan to buy two bags of sorghum and five bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereal and firewood

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George B. has a business where he sells and rents bicycles in Elmina. George attended school through junior high. He is married and has four children. His wife is a trader.

George has been selling and renting bicycles since 2006. He is responsible for paying utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.

With this loan, he will buy more bicycles and parts to improve the efficiency of his business. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to grow his savings so he can buy a piece of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles and parts

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Madame W. Adjoa est née le 31 décembre 1978 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de friperie et de pagne. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local de Hédzranawoé et au grand marché de Lomé. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 2004 lui procure beaucoup de revenu.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter demi ballot de friperie et 12 pièces de pagne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjoa W. was born on December 31, 1978 in Lomé. She is married and has two children. Her main business is selling used clothing and pagnes (colorful African cloth). She gets her supplies from the local market in Hédzranawoé and Lomé’s main market. The business, which she began in 2004, generates considerable income for her. This first-time loan she is requesting will enable her to buy a half-bundle of used clothing and 12 pieces of “pagne" cloth.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing and "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a single parent and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high.

Comfort sells ladies clothing, artificial hair peices and other female items at Tetermu near Elmina. She has been in this business since 2006. Comfort uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.

She is requesting this loan so she can buy more women's clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest in her business. This will allow her to increase her income and provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is married and cares for six family members. She has attended school through the primary level.

Georgina sells bread, which she bakes herself at Tetermu near Elmina. She has been in this business since 1991. Her husband is a mason. Georgina uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

Georgina will use the loan to buy more flour, margarine and other ingredients to sell in her bake shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Militza

texts.en: Militza is a member of the Gratitud Village Bank. She is 34 years old and married with one son. She and her husband have a timber-selling business called “Sergio.” Militza sells sticks, beams and mainstays to different companies (e.g. mines). She buys the lumber from different local communities. Militza needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy more lumber. Militza’s dreams are to expand her business, to send her son to a good college, and to have a comfortable home. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Militza es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud. Militza es casada, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Militza junto a su esposo tiene una maderera llamada Sergio, Militza vende palos, postes, puntales a las diferentes empresas como minas, sus productos los adquiere en las diferentes comunidades de la región. Militza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera. Los sueños de Militza son ampliar sus negocios, su hijo estudie en una buena universidad y tener una casa con todas las comodidades.

loans.use: Buy lumber

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.en:
Horimena C. is a young, single mother of two children. At this point in her life she lives in extreme poverty. She is doing everything she can to survive and to feed her children. It seems as though sending her children to college and having her own house aren't even possible. Her only goal is to make enough to feed her children and herself.

Horimena came to Esperanza International to try and receive a loan so she could start her own business. After many meetings and workshops, Horimena is ready to take out her first loan and start earning a steady income. She plans on starting her own business selling used clothing in her area. Though it is hard to even talk about her dreams for her children, she did say that she is excited to have her own business.

Her first goal is to grow her business so she can earn income to pay for her children's education. She said one day she does want to own a house, but she knows a lot of hard work lays ahead of her. She is ready to take the first step to a better life, and is hoping that this is the start of a better future for her whole family!

loans.use: Buying used clothing to mend and sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, a member of the Gratitud Village Bank, is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. Sabina sells prepared meals from a mobile cart on a street near the Grau Lot Market, working from 6 a.m. until late at night, often assisted by her daughters.  Sabina is now requesting a loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar. Her dreams are to improve her business and to have her own home.  
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, 49 years old and married with one son, is a member of the Dos Mil (“two thousand”) Village Bank. She travels to different regional markets two to three times per week to sell dry goods (flour, rice, sugar) and condiments as well as purchase grains and cheese which she resells in the markets of Ayacucho. Teresa also dries potatoes, buying potatoes from local farmers, then boiling, peeling, and chopping them and laying them in the sun to dry.

She is now requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar. Teresa’s dreams are to improve her business and have her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina, a member of the Dos Mil (Two Thousand) Village Bank, is 48 years old and married with five children. Selling potatoes from a stand in the Las Americas market, she also travels to regional fairs to sell clothing and buy grains.

Justina is now requesting a loan to buy more potatoes to sell, and her dreams are to expand her business, proviD. her children with a good education, and remain healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Capacitadas Group

texts.en:
Adargisa G. is a very hard working mother of four children. She and her husband live in extreme poverty. They don't have sufficient income to provide for all their children.

Adargisa applied for an Esperanza International loan. She has attended many meetings and workshops to prepare to start her own business. She plans on starting a very small bakery where she will sell bread. She hopes and plans to grow the business into a thriving bakery where she sells all types of baked goods.

Adargisa said her children are what drive her to succeed. She wants to earn enough money to support their education. She believes that requesting this loan is the right step for her, and hopes that having her own business is what will pull her and her loved ones out of poverty.

Adargisa and her fellow group members are ready for their first loans. They are excited about this opportunity and starting their very own businesses!

loans.use: Buy products for small bakery

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, a member of the Dos Mil (“Two Thousand”) Village Bank, is 64 years old and married with eight children. Leaving on Mondays and returning on Thursdays, Catalina travels to the Carhuanca market once a week to sell vegetables, bread and hardware items and to buy leather, cochinilla (a local cactus used to make cosmetics) and tara tree pods (used to tan leather) to bring back to Ayacucho to sell.

She is now requesting a loan to buy door lock mechanisms and padlocks, which she will sell at the Carhuanca market. Catalina’s dream is to improve her business. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy door locks and padlocks.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Dos Mil (“Two Thousand”) Village Bank. Ana is 29 years old and married with three children. She sells Avon and Esika brand cosmetics by catalog; most of her customers are friends, family members and colleagues. Ana also works as a secretary at a local institution. Ana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy lipstick and perfume. Ana’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build her own house and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil. Ana es casada, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Ana vende cosméticos por catálogos, de dos líneas como Esika, Avon, sus productos ofrece a amigos, familiares y colegas, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Ana trabaja en una institución como secretaria. Ana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de labiales, colonias. Los sueños de Ana son comprar un terreno y construir su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy lipstick and perfume

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
Raquel M., a member of this group loan and the hardworking mother of two children, is doing everything possible, along with her husband, to feed those children, but at the moment they are not earning sufficient money to ether educate them or feed everyone in the house. The family is currently totally dependent on the money Raquel's husband earns while Raquel stays at home to take care of their children.

Raquel came to Esperanza International after learning about it through a friend, and after several meetings and workshops she has decided to start a small business selling used clothing out of her house, where she can still watch over the kids. She feels that having her own business could really help out the family, and hopefully someday pull them out of the poverty they are in. Raquel is therefore excited about requesting the loan and starting the business, dreaming that one day she will have a big business and be able to send her children to college.

She knows this is just the first step, and there is still a lot of work ahead. Raquel is ready for this new challenge, and she and her family are very appreciative of this possibly life-changing opportunity!!

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Aleteia Group

texts.en: Rosalie has been in business since 2003. She used to be a teacher. After she had kidney surgery in 2001, she decided to change her career. She then began selling soft drinks. She started with a very small and limited business -- two crates of soft drinks. But with her courage and determination, and the profit generated by her business, Rosalie worked harder and managed her business more efficiently to increase her stock. Rosalie has been a faithful client of HOPE (Kiva's Field Partner) since August 2007. She has paid back regularly and completely since receiving her first loan. With her next loan, Rosalie is planning to purchase a freezer and to diversify her business by selling jewelry. Rosalie is 49 years old. She is divorced and the mother of four children. In addition to providing for her children, she also takes care of her niece. Rosalie likes her business, and she spends most of her time talking to her different clients.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand freezer and to diversify her business by starting to sell jewelry

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael A. is a 38-year-old married woman with two children, a boy and a girl, who are both currently in the basic school. 

Rachael trades in textile goods such as ladies’ ready-made clothing. She has run this business for four years and is now convinced she is experienced enough to expand it. She carries her goods to the market and houses to sell. 

According to Rachael, an increase in working capital will enable her to buy textile materials in bulk that she can take to nearby towns and markets to sell to be able to earn a bigger income. She belongs to the “Elshadai Group” in her community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to be able to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk.

loans.name: Hakibatu

texts.en:
Hakibatu, 29, is married with three children, two of whom are in school and the youngest is still breastfeeding. 

Hakibatu enjoys trading. She sells groundnut – fresh, roasted and in paste form in the local market. She has been selling for four years and through this, has been supporting her husband and their family. 

Groundnut is a seasonal commodity which falls in price when in season. Hakibatu says it is advisable to make bulk purchases during its season when the price is low, store the product and sell it later on when it gains in price. 

She wants a loan to help her realize this dream. Hakibatu belongs to the “Insha Alla” (God will do) group in her community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to be able to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.en: Bidalia is hoping to receive her very first loan from Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner). She is the mother of one very young child, and lives with her husband. She and her husband live in a very poor area in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. Each day she and her husband do whatever it takes to survive, but neither has a consistent income to provide for the family. Bidalia decided to do something about that and applied for a loan. She is hoping to start a business selling food, such as rice, beans, and fruit. She hopes that one day she will be able to grow the business and have her very own grocery store. She and her husband are going to run this business together, and they are both hopeful that this is going to change their lives. This is the first step for her and her family, and she is ready to take it!

loans.use: Buying food products

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac G. is a 45-year-old sign writer and taxi driver. Isaac is married with three kids; two are still in school. 

For the past 25 years, Isaac has been in the business of screen printing – banners, handkerchiefs, t-shirts, etc., and also writing signboards for the people in his community. According to him, he is the pioneer in his community as far as sign writing is concerned and has trained a number of artists in his town and nearby towns. 

Isaac says he has to travel to the city where he will have access to the developing machine (a device used to copy or transfer paper designs onto the screen) and also buy the materials he will need (mesh, white wood glue, print paste, potassium dichromate, etc). Isaac desires to acquire his own developing machine, which will save him the trouble of traveling to have his screens developed. He says he can also develop for other screen printers for a fee. 

He wants a loan to buy this device and also some of the materials he works with. Isaac belongs to the group called “Victory Trust Group” which is made up of only five members. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To expand his printing business.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon A.–Adjei is 26 years old and not yet married. He is in the business of photography. 

He has a small studio where he works and also travels to places to capture videos and pictures of clients who ask for his services. He uses materials such as cameras, film, glass to frame pictures, etc.

Gideon says he has been in this business for only one year. However, he has made a lot of economic gains through this venture. He says he wants a loan to help him expand and decorate his studio, and also buy the materials he uses to work. 

Gideon belongs to the “Victory Group” which is made up of only five members. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To expand his photography business

loans.name: Avenir Group

texts.en: Fidele K. sells cartons of eggs. He has to go out to deliver eggs to his clients and to look for new clients everyday. It is hard work, but he likes it. He has been in this business since 1995. Fidele fell sick in 1997 and was hospitalized.  He lost most of his clients and his business closed, as there was no one to continue running it. In 1998, after his recovery, Fidele re-launched his business with $100 of capital. His business was too small and limited in size. Gradually and with the profit generated by his business, Fidele has increased his stock to 40 cartons of eggs. Last July he joined one of Hope’s groups named “Avenir,” meaning “Future” in English, and through the loan Fidele’s business has been strengthened. (Hope is Kiva's Field Partner.) With his next loan, Fidele plans to deliver eggs to clients four days per week instead of three. He wants to build a henhouse so that he can have variety of chicken products to sell to his customers. Fidele is 52 years old. He is married and the father of seven children, who are between the ages of 2 and 21.

loans.use: To build a henhouse so he can have variety of chicken products to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rompiendos Obstaculos Group

texts.en: Being a single mother is never an easy thing, and it is especially difficult when the mother doesn't have a job and has 4 children. This is the situation that Maria V. faces each day. She is living in extreme poverty, and her children have to work just so the whole family can eat. Nobody in the family has a steady income, and the whole family is just living day to day. Marie decided she wanted to change her situation, so she came to Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner) asking for a loan so she can start her very own business. She is planning on starting a small business selling used clothing. She is a very good seamstress, so she wanted to do something where she could use her talents. She is one of the rare women in her situation because she is still able to dream. She dreams of sending all 4 of her children to college someday, and she knew that if she wanted that dream to come true she would have to change her life. She feels that having her own business is the way to realize that dream. She is a hard worker and ready to take on this challenge. She is going to be a success someday, and her whole family is going to benefit from it!!

loans.use: To buy used clothing and start a business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali M. is a 35-year-old married man with four children. All of his children are currently in school. 

M. is one of the few wholesale provision shop owners in his community. He has run this business for four years. M. buys his goods from Kumasi, a city, to stock his shop. 

Since many provision shop owners in his community buy from him, he wants more working capital to buy goods in bulk to be able to meet the increasing demand of his customers. M. belongs to a group called “Peace” in his community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk such as cartons of milk, bags of sugar, evaporated milk, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia A. is 26 years old. She is married with two children who are both in school. 

Eugenia runs a provision shop in her community. She has been in this business for two years. She says she buys her goods from cities where the prices are quite affordable. 

Eugenia wants to expand her shop to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Eugenia belongs to a group called “Peace” in her community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk such as boxes of assorted biscuits, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Damata

texts.en:
Damata H. is a 58-year-old married woman with five children. The youngest is still in the basic school. 

For the past two years, Damata has been producing palm oil in her community. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts. She buys the palm nuts or fruits from surrounding villages, which are about five miles away. 

Damata desires to buy palm fruits in bulk on a single trip to cut down on transportation costs. She says in this way, she can produce the oil in large quantities and transport it to other markets. 

The name of her group is “Gyese wobre” (unless you suffer). In this group, the members guarantee one another as collateral.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Abudul

texts.en:
Abdul W., 33, is married and a father of six children. The eldest five are all in school. 

Abdul is a palm oil producer in his town and has been in this business for fourteen years. He says it is through this business that he provides for his family and covers other expenses. He is the chairman of the palm oil producers in the community. 

According to Abdul, they are able to make good sales when the commodity becomes scarce in the system. He therefore wants to buy palm fruits in large quantity when it is plentiful and falls in price. Then he can prepare the oil, store it and sell it later when its price has risen. In this way, his profit margin will increase and can meet all his family expenses.

Abdul belongs to the “Dichem” group where the group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Rompiendo Barreras Group

texts.en: Sandra F. is a single women who has two children whom she takes care of all by herself. Unfortunately, where she is from it is very common for the dads to leave their families. So now she is alone to try and take care of her young children. The hardest part is that she does not have a steady income and has to do all sorts of things to provide food for her kids. She recently came to Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner) to seek a loan so she could start her own small business and start earning an income. She plans on selling small food products in her area, such as rice, salt, bread, and other small items. She is confident in herself that she can grow her business and hopes to someday have her own grocery story. She said she wants nothing more than to provide a good life for her kids because she loves them more than anything else. She is a great mother and knows this is her opportunity to change her life, and also the lives of her children. She and the other 14 people in this group are all excited about this opportunity, and ready to take this first step!!

loans.use: Buying food products

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Sabana Grande, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad, estudiantes de primaria, su esposo es agricultor, la Sra. Rosa vende horneados como: perrerreque, rosquillas, desde hace cinco años esta en las venta lo cual inicio con fondos propios, con estos préstamo que le ha otorgado Afodenic ha logrado mantenerse en el mercado de la competencia, este es su segunda solicitud la cual va invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de sus ricas rosquillas, y ofertar a proveedores como supermercados, para crecer. A largo plazo quiere construir otro horno para lograr mejor desempeño en la elaboración de sus productos, también desea ayudar a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 42-years-old and lives in a neighborhood called Sabana Grande in the capital of Managua. She has two children who are 6 and 14, who are in primary school. Her husband is a farmer. Señora Rosa has sold baked goods like perrerreque and rosquillas (types of pastries) for five years. She started with her own funds. With the loans that Afodenic has offered her, she has managed to support herself in the market with the competition. This is her second request, which she is going to invest in supplies to make her delicious rosquillas, which she will offer to providers like supermarkets so her business can grow. In the long term, she wants to build another oven to better make her products. She also hopes to help her children with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries)

loans.name: Noel Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor de nombre Noel Ernesto Meléndez F. su edad es de 48 años, su estado civil es acompañado, este señor tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes: su hijo varón tiene la edad de 14 maños y cursa el 2 año de secundaria, una niña de 3 años que no estudia, un varón de 24 que no estudia y todos sus hijos dependen de el, en sus deseos esta darle un terreno a sus hijos  para que puedan construir una casa y no tengan que pasar necesidades para  el día de mañana en sus propósitos esta el mantener siempre activo su negocio por lo difícil que se encuentra la situación en el país.


La actividad económica a la que Don Noel se dedica es una pulpería en lo que vende los productos de: golosinas, licor, sardinas, sopas y otros, el inicia por cuenta propia e inicia vendiendo hot dog, emparedado, y refrescos y con la ayuda de un préstamo que había realzado anteriormente con  la Fundación León 2000 y es entonces que decide incrementar su negocio y empezó con abastecer un estante y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita abastecer mas sus estantes de  diferentes productos y quiere realizar la compra de azúcar, aceite y gaseosa por lo que se avecinan los días festivos ya que estos son los productos que mas se venden para esta temporada y agradece trabajar siempre con fundación león 2000 y otras organizaciones que han contribuido a su negocio.
texts.en:
Noel Ernesto Meléndez F. is 48 years old and in a civil union. He has three dependent children: a 14-year-old son in his second year of high school, a 3-year-old daughter not yet in school, and a 24-year-old son no longer a student. Noel's dream is to provide land for his children to build a house on, so they will not have to worry about the future. This is the reason he works hard at his business, despite the difficult economic situation in his country. Noel has a small general store that sells sweets, liquor, sardines, soup, etc. With the help of a loan from Fundación León 2000, he began his business by selling hot dogs, sandwiches, and soft drinks. To meet his customers' demand, he decided to create a permanent shop and sell more items. Noel will use this loan as working capital that he will invest in obtaining a variety of merchandise. He will stock up on the most popular products for the holiday season, including sugar, cooking oil, and soft drinks. Noel is grateful to be able to work with Fundación León 2000 and the other organizations that have contributed to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha Beatriz Pérez Méndez tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es acompañada, esta Joven tiene 3 hijos su hijo mayor de 19 años cursa recientemente el 3 año de secundaria, su otro hijo de 18 años trabaja en el lavado de carros y su hijo menor de 11 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora taxista, sus sueños son de establecer su negocio en su casa de  habitación y en sus propósitos esta darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que es una de las prioridades por la ella lucha ya que desea dejarle a sus hijos un lugar que sea de su propiedad.


Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa como lo es: pantalones, camisetas, camisas para varón y ropa interior, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 15 años, ella inicia con un negocio de auto lavado y decide que necesita mas ingresos para su familia y entonces que decide por cuenta propia realizar la venta de ropa mixta para mujer y varón y mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento que  este destinado para capital de trabajo ya que se avecina los días festivos y tiene que ofrecer variedad de producto  en lo que efectuara las compras en Managua por lo que necesita movilizarse para efectuar estas gestiones
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz Pérez Méndez is 38 years old, and she has a partner. This young women has 3 children. Her oldest son is 19, and recently began the 3rd year of secondary school. Her other son is 18 years old, and he works in a car wash. Her youngest son is 11 years old and is in grade 4 at primary school. Her partner works as a taxi driver. Her dream is to establish her business in her house, and she proposes to improve her house, which is one of the priorities of why she struggles now, as she wants to leave her children a place that will be their property. Her economy activity involves selling clothes, such as: trousers, blouses, men's shirts, and underwear. She has had this business for 15 years. She began with a car wash business and decided that she needed more for her family, so she decided with her own money to begin selling mixed clothes for men and women. Now she would like to obtain finance that is destined to be working capital, as the festive days are now approaching and she needs to offer a variety of products. She will make the purchases in Managua, for which she needs to be mobile to achieve these negotiations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Briceida Urania

texts.es:
Briceida Urania Roíz González tiene la edad de 62 años, sus estado civil es soltera esta señora no tiene hijos, sus deseos son  permanecer siempre con su trabajo por lo que necesita brindarle ayuda económica ya que le brinda ayuda a su hermana y en sus deseos esta que Dios le preste mas vida para mantener a su familia ya que esta necesita de sus ingresos en sus propósitos esta el proporcionarle mejoras a su casa y así podrá brindarles a su familiares una casa con las debidas condiciones.



El tiempo que tiene que de poseer el negocio es de 5 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada, Doña Briceida inicia por cuenta propia por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo y empieza con la con la venta de pantalones, short su negocio estaba en su casa de habitación pero debido a los diferentes factores del clima como el polvo la ropa se le dañaba y ella no podía venderla y entonces sus vecinos ya sabían de su oficio y estos acudían a su casa y ella les mostraba la ropa de un bolso mas tarde decide realizar la venta de sus productos de manera ambulante ya que así mantiene en movimiento su mercadería, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será para la compra ya que lo realiza en Managua ya que así le resulta mas factible  y podrá proveerse de mas mercadería como lo es: camiseta, chaquetas y pantalones para suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Briceida Urania R. G. is 62 years of age, she is single and she does not have children. Her dreams are to keep on with her work in order to provide financial support to her sister. And her wish is that God will grant her more life to support her family because they are dependent on her income. She plans on making improvements to her house so that she can provide her family with a home in adequate condition.

She has been running her business for 5 years, her business being the sales of used clothing. Briceida says that she started out by herself from a need of employment and she started out by selling pants, and shorts. Her business was run from her house given many different factors, especially from the weather that covered everything in dust, damaging the clothes and making them unsellable. Her neighbours knew about her business and started to come to her house and she used to show them the clothing she kept in a bag. Later she decided to starte selling her products door to door just to keep her merchandise flowing. This loan will be used as working capital that will be invested in purchases thatshe makes in Managua. It will be more profitable for her and she will be able to purchase more merchandise, such as: t-shirts, jackets and pants to be able to supply the demand of her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Celia Cruz

texts.es:
Su nombre es Celia Cruz Martínez  su edad es de 34 años, su estado civil es casada esta señora tiene 2 hijas mujeres, su hija tiene la edad de 15 años y cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria y su otra hija de 8 años de edad que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como vendedor de bolsas plásticas y las distribuye en las diferentes pulperías, en sus metas esta aumentar su negocio en sus deseos esta el mantener activo su negocio ya que por medio de este es que ha logrado obtener los ingresos que le genera a su familia y en sus propósitos esta  el darle mejoras a su casa de habitación para que sus hijas puedan tener un lugar digno donde vivir.



El tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 9 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de bolsas plásticas,  además de este negocio tiene uno mas pequeño como lo es la venta de golosinas y refrescos ella inicia este negocio por que su esposo trabajaba en lugar donde vendían  bolsas plásticas y el negocio se traslada a otro lugar y así como el decide independizarse e instala su negocio en  su casa de habitación y es su esposa quien es la encargada de este negocio, el financiamiento es para capita de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de mas de sus productos ya que los productos que mas vende es la bolsa de pocicle, las de gabacha pequeña y pajillas para asi ofrecer lo que el cliente necesita.
texts.en:
This is Celia Cruz Martínez, she is 34 years old and married. She has 2 daughters; her 15 year-old daughter recently finished her 4th year of secondary school and her other daughter, who is 8 years old, is in the 4th grade of primary school. Her husband works as a salesmen, selling plastic bags which he distributes to different convenience stores. Among her goals is to increase her business and her dream is to keep her business alive since this is how she has been able to get income for her family. Another goal is to make some home improvements so that her daughters can have a decent place to live. She has been in the business of selling plastic bags for 9 years. Additionally, she has a smaller business selling candy and soft drinks. She started up her business when the company where her husband worked selling plastic bags moved to another location and she decided to go on her own and set up in her home. Her husband is in charge of the business. This loan is for working capital so she can buy more of the goods which sell the most, such as small plastic bags (commonly used to serve soft drinks or juice) and straws and in this way be able to give clients what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Felipa Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Felipa Esperanza Juárez quien tiene la edad de 62 años, su estado civil es acompañada, tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 35 años graduado en licenciado en ciencias y alimentos, el menor de 28 años que se desempeña como ingeniero civil y su cónyuge labora como conductor de un taxi, sus propósitos son de acondicionar su establecimiento, sus deseos son de mantener su negocio activo debido a la situación inestable por la que esta pasando el país actualmente.


El tiempo al que ha dedicado a su negocio es de 13 años, la actividad económica a la que ella se dedica es la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta por lo que inicia con la venta de galletas y golosinas y mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento con la fundación León 2000 la cual le brinda la mano para que incrementara su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y abastecer la demanda de clientes que a diario va creciendo, desea comprar productos como pan, huevo, azúcar y jugo ya que estos productos que mas vende a diarioa.
texts.en:
This is Felipa Esperanza Juárez. She is 62 años and lives with her partner. She has two children; the oldest is 35 and has a degree in food sciences; the youngest is 28 and works as a civil engineer. Her common-law husband works as a taxi driver. Her goal is to make improvements to her business and her wish is to keep the business going through the current uncertain economy in the country. She has been in business for 13 years selling basic goods such as rice, sugar, oil and beans. She started off just selling cookies and candy and later on got a loan from Fundación León 2000 which gave her a helping hand to increase her business. This loan is for working capital to meet the demand of customers, which grows daily. She would like to buy goods such as bread, eggs, sugar and juice since these are what sell the most.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Cariñosas Group

texts.es: El grupo las "Cariñosas " esta representado por la señora Sofia quien se dedica al comercio como una mayoría D. las socias(os) del grupo, se dedican a la compra y venta D. abarrrote, cosmeticos, productos D. limpieza y a la elavoracion D. pan alguanas trabajan en la costura D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio domestico en casas privadas. en general el grupo esta compuesto por gente trabajadora, cumplida y sobretodo emprendedora ya que cada una quiere ver crecer sus pequeños negocios y asi solventar mas el ingreso D. sus familias para que sus hijos tengan una mejor educacion. El Financiamiento esta destinado a la ampliacion D. sus puestos D. venta, compra D. productos, insumos y material D. trabajo, alguna D. las socias invertira en la compra D. un puesto D. venta para independizarce. Las socias(os) ya tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios por lo que an demostrado mucha capacidad y responsabilidad en su trabajo con la Fundacion Agrocapital en anteriores financiamientos.
texts.en:
The "Cariñosas" group is represented by Sofia, who works in sales as do most of the members of the group. Some buy and sell groceries and cleaning products, other make bread and some work as seamstresses or as domestic workers. The group is generally maD. up of hard-working, reliable people, who above all are entreprenuers who want to see their small businesses grow and to be able to add more to their family income so that their children can have a better education. Their loans will be used to expand their sales premises or to buy products, supplies and working materials. Some of the members will invest in sales stands so they can become self-sufficient. The members have experience with group loans and have shown their capability and responsibility through prior loans with Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Coca Cola Group

texts.es: El Grupo "Coca Cola" esta representado por la señora Maria Luisa, ella posee una pequeña tienda D. barrio en la cual venD. dulces, abarrotes y productos en general, mas D. la mitad del grupo se dedica a la agricultura o a la cria D. vacas, chanchos y pescados, algunos tienen pequeños puestos D. venta en el mercado central. Son gente emprendedora y con ganas D. progresar ellas(os) ya se encuentran cumpliendo su tercer ciclo en la Fundacion Agrocapital, por lo que conocen el trabajo en grupos solidarios. En el periodo D. tiempo que trabajaron con la Fundacion han demostrado puntualidad y esmero en los pagos y cumplimiento con la Intitucion y a su mismo grupo. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. productos a la venta, asi como para la compra D. Insumos, Herramientas y materiales para sus diferentes actividades en especial para la epoca naviD.ña donD. se incrementa la venta D. los diferentes productos y animales.
texts.en:
The "Coca Cola" group is repesented by Maria Luisa. She owns a small neighborhood store where she sells candy, groceries and basic goods. More than half of the group works in agriculture or raise cattle, pigs or fish. Some have small stands in the central market. They are hard-working people with a desire to get ahead. They are completing their third cycle with Fundacion Agrocapital and are familiar with group loans. During the time they have worked with Fundacion they have shown punctuality and great care in meeting their payments with this institution and with the group. The purpose of this loan is to increase their inventory as well as to buy supplies, tools, and materials for their different activities, particularly for the Christmas season when sales increase for their different products and animals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Norma Justina

texts.es:
La microempresaria Norma A. Montalván tiene 71 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, 6 de ellos viven en sus propias casas y 1 de ellos aun convive en la casa con 3 nietos los cuales estudian. Doña Norma tiene una pulpería desde hace más de 20 años, donde vende gramos básicos, carbón en bolsas, pollo, gaseosas y otros productos de consumo diario en los hogares costeños.

En el sector donde habita la microempresaria A. es bastante conocida por el tiempo de tener este negocio y por la forma amable que trata a sus clientes, además los niños les gustan ir a comprar a este negocio ya que les ofrece caramelos a los mismos.

Al igual que otras pulperías doña Norma necesita un financiamiento sobre lo siguiente:

3 Cajillas de gaseosas a US$ 20.00 cada una, 80 libras de pollo a US$ 1.45 cada libra, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 56.00 cada quintal, 1 quintal de frijoles a US$ 55.00 cada quintal, 3 quintales de harina a US$ 48.00 cada quintal, 1 bidón de aceite a US$ 3.00 cada bidon, 10 sacos de carbón a US$ 3.00 cada saco, 2 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30.00 cada quintal y 3 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 30.00 cada caja.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Norma A. Montalván is 71 years old. She has seven older children, six of whom live in their own houses and one who still lives in her house with three grandchildren who are in school. Norma has owned a store for more than twenty years where she sells stamps, bags of coal, chicken, sodas and other products consumed daily in the homes of people who live on the coast. In the area where entrepreneur A. lives, she is quite well-known due to the time she's had this business and because of her amiable way of treating customers. In addition, children like to go to this business to buy since she offers them caramels. Similar to other stores, Norma needs financing to cover the following: 3 boxes of sodas at US$ 20 each, 80 pounds of chicken at US$ 1.45 per pound, 200 pounds of American rice at US$ 56 per hundred pound, 100 pounds of beans at US$ 50 per hundred pound, 300 pounds of flour at US$ 48 per hundred pound, 1 drum of oil at US$ 3 per drum, 10 bags of coal at US$ 3 per bag, 200 pounds of sugar at US$ 30 per hundred pound, and 3 boxes of 3-minute soup at US$ 30 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 boxes of soda, 80 pounds of chicken, 200 pounds of American rice, 100 pounds of beans, 300 pounds of flour, 1 drum of oil, 10 bags of coal, 200 pounds of sugar,  3 boxes of 3-minute soup.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the "Generosidad" (Generosity) Village Bank.  Vilma is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Vilma runs a general store from her home, located in the Yuracc Yuracc neighborhood. She works at the store every day from 8am to 7pm.  Vilma needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy oil, rice and milk.  Vilma dreams of owning her own home and that her children will graduate with professional degrees. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. 
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Yuracc Yuracc en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, arroz, leche. 
Vilma sueña con tener una casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy oil, rice and milk for her little store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Generosidad (“Generosity”) Village Bank. She is 43 years old and is married with four children. Sonia is involved in several businesses and works, depending on market demand, in different areas. She travels to regional villages and buys vegetables and grains from local producers. She resells her wares at the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. She also has a market stall in the city of Huanta.

Sonia also produces firewood: she buys the trees from villagers and transports the wood to the city of Lima. Sonia needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy vegetables. Sonia dreams that her children will graduate with professional degrees, of having her own investment capital, and of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. Sonia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Sonia realiza diferentes negocios dependiendo de la demanda, Sonia viaja a los diferentes pueblos de la región y compra de los productores, verduras, cereales, sus ventas los realiza en un puesto propio del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, también tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad de Huanta. Además Sonia manda hacer leña, compra árboles en los pueblos y luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Lima. Sonia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras. Sonia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener capital propio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Tania Doris

texts.en:
Tania is a member of the "Generosidad" (Generosity) Village Bank. She is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband; they are currently expecting their first child. Tania and her husband bake bread in her in-laws’ oven in the Santa Elena neighborhood. The couple has 6 employees, four of whom work at night and two of whom work during the day. The couple uses their car to transport the bread to different neighborhood stores to sell.

Tania needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy flour and lard. Tania dreams of owning her own bakery, of buying another larger car, and of expanding the business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. Tania es conviviente, tiene 24 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Tania junto a su esposo se dedican a L. elaboración D. panes, actividad que realizan en el horno D. sus suegros que se ubica en el barrio D. Santa Elena, cuentan con L. ayuda D. 6 personas, 4 personas durante L. noche y 2 durante el día, sus productos los comercializan en las diferentes tiendas D. su barrio, para lo cual cuentan con un carro.

Tania necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. harina, manteca. Tania sueña con tener una panadería propia, comprar otro carro granD. y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy flour and lard

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a member of the "Generosidad" (Generosity) Village Bank. Herminia has a farm, located four hours from the city of Ayacucho, where she grows avocados, lemons, tomatoes and cucumbers. She sells her produce in the cities of Andahuaylas and Ayacucho. Herminia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy medicine and to pay her farm workers. Herminia’s dreams are to improve her business, for her children to go to school, and to have a stable location from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. Herminia es casada, tiene 39 años y 6 hijos, Herminia se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos de pampas que se ubica a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde produce limón, palta, tomate, pepinillo, sus productos los vende en las ciudades de Andahuaylas y Ayacucho. Herminia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de remedios y pago de los peones.

Los sueños de Herminia son mejorar su negocio, sus hijos estudien y tener un puesto estable para vender sus productos.

loans.use: Buy medicine and pay farm workers

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a member of the "Generosidad" (Generosity) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and married with five children. Guillerma sells prepared meals in Ayacucho’s Abastos Market. She starts cooking at 3:00 each morning and then sells her meals until midday. Her daughters help her with the business.

Guillerma needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sacks of rice, oil, and pasta. Guillerma’s dreams are that she will be able to work very hard so that her children have everything they need and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Guillerma es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. Guillerma es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Guillerma vende comida en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Guillerma comienza a cocinar a las 3 de la mañana y luego vende hasta el mediodía, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas.

Guillerma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideos por sacos. Los sueños Guillermina son trabajar mucho para que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice, oil and pasta

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza, a 42-year-old single mother of three children and a member of the Generosidad (“Generosity”) Village Bank, sells prepared meals in the Nery Garcia market, her specialty being traditional Peruvian soups such as mondongo (tripe stew). Esperanza also buys grains which she sends to Lima for a friend to sell.

She is now requesting a loan to buy dried potatoes, wheat and corn. Esperanza dreams that her children will graduate with professional degrees and that she will continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy dried potatoes, wheat and corn.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in the Compañía community, forty minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho.

Irene has a store in her home where she sells dry goods, vegetables and fruits as well as a small restaurant, which she just opened last week. Her daughter helps her with both businesses. Irene needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy rice, sugar, oil, and soap. Irene dreams of expanding her business and improving her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Irene es casada, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos, Irene vive en la comunidad D. Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Irene tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas y además tiene un pequeño restaurante negocio que inicio hace 1 semana, cuenta con la ayuda D. su hija para atención D. ambos negocios.

Irene necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite y jabón. Los sueños D. Irene son que su negocio crezca, mejorar su restaurante.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, and soap

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She and her family are artisans who make beautiful weavings using looms. She owns four looms, which she, her husband, and their children use. They sell the weavings in the city of Cuzco, and sometimes in the city of Ayacucho. Victoria needs a loan of 1250 soles to buy wool, dye, and firewood. Victoria dreams of improving her business, of building her house, and of having a store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Victoria es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Victoria junto a su familia son artesanos y realizan bellos tejidos en telares, tiene 4 telares en los que trabajan ella, su esposo y sus hijos, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad del cuzco y en algunas oportunidades en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, tinte y leña. Victoria sueña con mejorar su negocio, construir su casa y tener una tienda.

loans.use: Buy wool, dye, and firewood

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.en:
Zaragoza is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. Zaragoza is 62 years old and married with eight children. Zaragoza has a store in her house, located in the Mariscal Caceres neighborhood of Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables, and liquor. She works every day with the help of her son.

Zaragoza also has income from renting out her house. Zaragoza needs a loan of 900 soles to buy rice, sugar, and toothpaste. She dreams that her children will overcome the obstacles that face them in life, dreams of improving her business, and of saving for old age.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Zaragoza es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Zaragoza es casada, tiene 62 años y 8 hijos, Zaragoza tiene una tienda en su casa ubicado en la Asoc. Mariscal Cáceres, en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas, licores, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hijo. Además Zaragoza alquila su casa.

Zaragoza necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, crema dental. Zaragoza sueña con que sus hijos se superen, mejorar su negocio y ahorrar para su vejez.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and toothpaste

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is 36 and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Julia is an artisan and makes loom weavings such as tapestries from her home in the Santa Ana artisans’ neighborhood. She has three employees, and sells her products in the city of Cuzco.

Julia needs a loan of 1750 soles to buy wool and dye. Julia dreams that her children will graduate with professional degrees, of expanding her business, and of buying a car so her son can start to work as a taxi driver.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Julia es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Julia es artesana y realiza tejidos en telar como tapices, individuales, actividad que realiza en su casa ubicada en el barrio artesanal de Santa Ana, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 3 personas, sus productos los vende en la ciudad del Cuzco.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas, tintes. Julia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y comprar un carro para que su hijo trabaje.

loans.use: Buy wool and dye

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is married and has four children. She travels to local markets twice per week to buy cheese, grains, and animals, which she then brings back to the city of Ayacucho to sell or sends to the tropical forest with her sister to sell. Zenaida also raises pigs at home.

Zenaida needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy cheese and grains. Zenaida’s dreams are to educate her children so they can graduate with professional degrees and to improve her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Zenaida es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Zenaida viaja a las ferias dos veces por semana, en donde compra cereales, quesos y animales, que luego lo comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, algunas oportunidades envía a la selva ayacuchana con su hermana. Además Zenaida se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, actividad que realiza en su casa.

Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales, quesos. Los sueños de Zenaida son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Buy cheese and grains

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Gladys P. H., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, como ser granos basicos, harina, manteca, mantequilla, refrescos, churros, embutidos, jabones, azucar, tortillas, rasuradoras, baterias, sopas, avena etc, soy casada y medre de dos hijos, me he dedicado a trabajar independiente desde hace mucho tiempo, tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para cubrir con los gastos de nuestro hogar, en estos momentos necesito un credito para poder hacer crecer mi negocio el cual es mi unica fuente de ingresos, en estos tiempos es muy dificil conseguir trabajos.
texts.en:
Hi. My name is Gladys P. H.. I am dedicated to selling popular products such as basic grains, flour, lard, butter, refreshments, sausages, ham, sugar, tortillas, razors, batteries, soups, oats, etc. I am married and a mother to two children. I have been dedicated to working independently for a long time. I receive help from my husband to cover the bills. At this time, I need a loan in order to grow my business which is my only source of income. Currently, it is difficult to find work.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Iris Azucena

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Iris C. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, soy casada y tengo 3 hijos, cuento con un pequeño negocio propio tambien vendo golosinas en mi pulperia, como ser baleadas, enchiladas, tacos, ya que la gente que viene a comprar siempre se queda comiendo algo, mi negocio esta en mi casa de habitacion asi no descuido mi hogar ni mi familia, en estos momentos necesito un credito para salir adelante con mi negocio ya que por problemas personales tuvo una caida y deseo inyectarle capital para volver a tenerlo como antes. gracias.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Iris C.. I am dedicated to selling popular consumer products. I am married and have three children. I rely on my own small business. Also, I sell candy from my shop, as well as baleadas (a Honduran dish), enchiladas, and tacos since the people who come to shop also stay to eat something. My business is in my home so that I do not have to neglect my house or my family. Currently, I need a loan to get ahead with my business since, due to personal problems, it experienced a downturn, and I wish to inject capital to return the business to its former state. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Felicita G. C., tengo 40 años de edad, tengo un negocio de ropa nueva y una parte del negocio es de ropa usada, la cual la vendo en mi casa de habitacion, esto me ayuda a no descuidar mi hogar y estar al 100% en mi negocio, en este momento necesito un credito para poder comprar mucha ropa ya que en esta epoca de navidad las ventas son muy buenas, y la ropa la tengo que comprar por pedidos. gracias a este credito voy a poder hacer crecer mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hi. My names is Felicita G. C.. I am 40 years old. I have a new and used clothing business, which I sell from my home. This helps me not to neglect my house and to give 100% to my business. Currently, I need a loan in order to be able to buy a lot of clothing since, in this holiday season, sales are good. The clothing that I have to buy is for orders. Thanks to this loan, I am going to be able to grow my business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ligia Argentina

texts.es:
La joven madre Ligia Argentina González H. tiene 26 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas menores de edad, vive sola y desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos de variados estilos y marcas y de ropa de hombres, mujeres y niños.

Esta actividad le ha permitido poder mantener a sus dos pequeñas hijas ya que el padre de ambas se encuentra fuera del país y las abandono, por lo que este negocio es el único ingreso que tiene esta microempresaria. Según  la joven señora González la ventaja de este negocio es que para que este producto pierda su valor se requiere mucho tiempo y las ventas en épocas de fin de año son buenas por lo que le permite tener buenas ganancias.

Además que el producto que no pueda vender en fin de año lo puede vender para el inicio de las clases principalmente a niños y niñas. Esta solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de:

10 pares de zapatos de cuero de hombre a US$ 13 cada par, 10 pares de zapatos blancos de niña a US$ 8 cada par, 10 pares de sandalias de mujer a US$ 9 cada par, 10 pares de sandalias de niños a US$ 5 cada par, 10 pares de zapatos Roy de niños a US$ 12 cada par, 10 vestidos de niñas a US$ 5 cada vestido y 10 pantalones Blue jeans de hombres a US$ 8 cada pantalón.
texts.en:
Young mother Ligia Argentina González H. is 27 years old, is a single mother and has two young daughters. She lives alone and for three years has been dedicated to selling shoes of various styles and brands, as well as clothing for men, women and children. This job has allowed her to be able to take care of her two small daughters since their father left the country and abandoned them. This business is the only income that this small businesswoman has. According to young Ms. González, the advantage of this business is that for this product to lose its value it requires a lot of time and sales at the end of the year are good which allows her to have good earnings. In addition, products that she cannot sell at the end of the year, she can sell at the start of classes, mainly to children. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of: 10 pairs of leather men's shoes at US$ 13 per pair, 10 pairs of white girl's shoes at US$ 8 per pair, 10 pairs of women's sandals at US$ 9 per pair, 10 pairs of children's sandals at US$ 5 per pair, 10 pairs of Roy children's shoes at US$ 12 per pair, 10 girls dresses at US$ 5 per dress and 10 pairs of men's blue jeans at US$ 8 per pair.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 pairs of leather men's shoes, 10 pairs of white girl's shoes, 10 pairs of women's sandals, 10 pairs of children's sandals, 10 pairs of Roy children's shoes, 10 girls dresses and 10 pairs of men's blue jeans.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 47 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con quienes vive. Es un hombre muy trabajador dedicado al cultivo de naranjales,  lo cual es una actividad que  practica por  30 años,  desde que se casó, labor que le agrada realizar por el contacto con la naturaleza, además las naranjas son frutas muy vendidas  en los mercados  e infaltables dentro de su comunidad. Lo difícil es poder  ocuparse de su  producción,  ya que durante el florecimiento tiene que  cuidar  los frutos de todo árbol y para ello necesita abonos. Lorenzo va en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y hasta hoy no ha tenido problemas en  realizar sus pagos correspondientes. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá  trampas para insectos  que  amenazan con  destruir los frutos que con tanto esfuerzo logra obtener.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 47 years old, is married and lives with his four children. He is a very hard-worker, and works cultivating an orange grove, an activity which he has practiced for 30 years ever since he married. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature, and also because oranges sell very well in the markets and are valued within his community. The challenge is to manage their cultivation, as during the flowering he has to care for the fruit of all the trees and for this he needs fertilizer. Lorenzo is in his fourth loan cycle from MFP, and has not had any problems in making his repayments to date. With the loan he is seeking he will acquire traps for the insects that threaten to destroy the fruit that he has worked so hard to cultivate. These traps will cost S/. 1000.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase traps for the insects which threaten his crop

loans.name: Grupo Miramesi Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotras somos el grupo Miramesi, esta es nuestra primera operacion en solicitud de creditos, nosotras formamos este grupo para poder salir adelante con nuestros negocios, yo Lidia G. soy la coordinadora del grupo tengo 33 años de edad y me dedico a la venta de lociones, cremas y otros productos de uso diario para damas, esta mercaderia es muy vendida ya que todas las mujeres usamos cremas, lociones etc, y en esta temporada tengo muchos pedidos, asi que necesito el credito para comprar un lote grande de producto y poder cubrir con todas las necesidades de mis clientes.
la Sra. Amalia R. ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, dicha pulperia es muy visitada por todos los que vivimos en esa zona ya que es la unica cercana en nuestra colonia,  la Sra. Elvira F. ella tiene 54 años de edad ella tambien se dedica a la venta de lociones y cremas, las cuales las vende de forma ambulante en nuestra colonia. cabe mensionar que con el esfuerzo que hemos realizado todas hemos logrado darle a nuestras familias el sustento tanto como alimenticio, salud y en procesos educativos, tenemos muchos años de conocernos.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the Miramesi group and this is is our first loan request. We formed this group in order to move forward with our businesses. I am Lidia G., the coordinator of the group. I am 33 years old and work selling lotions, creams and other daily skincare products for women. This merchandise sells very well as all women use creams and lotions. At this time of year I have many orders, and so I need credit in order to buy a large batch of product to cover the needs of my customers. Amalia R. works selling a range of popular products. Her grocery store is used by everyone who lives nearby as it is the only store in our neighbourhood. Elvira F. is 54 years old and she also works selling lotions and creams door-to-door in our neighbourhood. I finish by mentioning that with the hard work that each of us has put in we have been able to provide our families with sustenance, in terms of nutrition, health and education. We have known each other for many years.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio tiene 40 años, está separado de su pareja, vive con su único hijo mayor de edad. Es agricultor, se dedica al cultivo de  café, actividad que  viene realizando por  30 años, además es una actividad que le agrada hacer  porque le gusta vivir  junto a la naturaleza, y disfrutar del fruto de su trabajo al ver sus plantaciones de café, producto que por cierto es muy rentable,  por la gran demanda  y el costo  alto que tiene de  venta. Sin embargo, lo difícil es cultivar, estos productos deben llevar un adecuado procedimiento, hasta tener el producto terminado. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Lucio  invertirá en la compra de  plantas de café para aumentar sus  hectáreas de terrenos.
texts.en:
Lucio is 40 years old, is separated from his partner and lives with his only son, who is grown up. He is a farmer and works cultivating coffee, an activity he has practiced for 30 years. He enjoys his work because he likes living close to nature and seeing the fruits of his labor in his coffee plantation. Coffee is a very profitable crop thanks to strong demand and a high sale price. Nevertheless, the challenge is in the cultivation, these crops need to have an adequate development through to harvest. This is Lucio's first loan with MFP. He will invest in the purchase of coffee plants to increase the hectares of his terrain.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants to increase his production

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 44 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con quienes vive. El es agricultor, se dedica al cultivo de café, lo que viene realizando por  35 años, siendo la única actividad que sabe realizar, es lo que más le agrada, no hay nada mejor para Luis que estar en contacto con la naturaleza  y con  los frutos de  su trabajo que ve florecer  año tras año. Además, el café es uno de los productos más rentables, por su alto costo en los mercados y por los comerciantes que solicitan grandes cantidades de café por temporada. Lo difícil es tener que  lavar y secar los granos de café  para luego venderlos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita hará un vivero para sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old, married and has four children living with him. He is a farmer and raises coffee, something he has done for 35 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Luis, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the fruits of his labor grow year after year. In addition, coffee is one of the most profitable crops due to its high price in the market and the fact that merchants request large quantities of coffee during the season. What is difficult is having to wash and dry the coffee beans so they can be sold. This is his first loan with MFP. With the money he is requesting he will build a nursery for his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prepare a nursery for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos con quienes vive. Se dedica a la bodeguita que  pudo abrir hace 10 años en su casa, le agrada  trabajar vendiendo diversos productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de la zona, los cuales cuentan solo con la tienda de doña Margarita, lo cual hace rentable su negocio por no tener competencia. Lo difícil es traer los productos a su tienda  porque se encuentra alejada de la ciudad, y para realizar sus comprar tiene incluso que caminar varios kilómetros. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Margarita  invertirá el dinero en la compra de víveres para su tiendita, ya que es lo más necesitan en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Margarita is 48 years old, married and has 7 children who live with her. She has a small grocery store in her home which she was able to open 10 years ago. She likes her work selling various basic goods to the residents of her neighborhood, who have only one store, that of Margarita. Because she has no competition, her business is very profitable. What is difficult is having to bring products to her store because they can only be found far away from the city and in order to buy them she has to walk several kilometers. This is her first loan with MFP. Margarita will invest the money to buy goods for her store which her community needs most.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.name: Rosa Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene una tiendita a la cual le esta invirtiendo mucho tiempo, esfuerzo y dedicación, demostrando responsabilidad.
Ella esta solicitando este credito para invertir mas en su negocio y asi lograr incrementar  las ventas del negocio atrayendo mas clientela por la variedad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa has a small store in which she is investing a lot of time and effort, demonstrating responsibility. She is asking for a loan to invest more in her business and in this way increase her sales by attracting more customers through having a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana es enfermera de una institución médica reconocida de la ciudad, su trabajo y la experiencia han hecho de ella una persona muy responsable y que se esfuerza para realizar sus metas.
Ahora esta solicitando este credito para terminar de construir un cuarto en planta alta de su casa y lograr mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Susana is a nurse at a well-known medical institute in the city. Her work and her experience have made her a very responsible person and one who works hard to reach her goals. She is asking for a loan to finish building a room on the upper floor of her house so as to have a more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room on the upper floor of her home.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot tiene 24 años, convive hace cinco años con su pareja con quien tiene una hija de 5 años. Se dedica al cultivo de café y plátanos, actividad que realiza por más de 10 años junto a sus familiares, siendo así, la actividad que más le agrada porque desde joven le agradó sembrar las plantaciones de café y cosecharlas. Gracias a que el café es uno de los productos de mayor demanda en la selva,  a pesar de las costosas inversiones que se realiza  por la compra de abonos, y lo dificultoso que es  tener que sembrar y adecuar la tierra de cultivo para su adecuado crecimiento y producción, es rentable. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Margot  invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos  para sus terrenos cultivables, para lo cual invertirá un monto de 800 soles.
texts.en:
Margot is 24 years old. She and her partner have lived together for the past 5 years and have a 5 year-old daughter. Margot grows coffee and bananas for a living, an activity she has been involved in for more than 10 years together with her family.
