texts.ru: Нурова Ханифа проживает в городе Вахдат. Домохозяйка , замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Имеет корову, молоко которой продает. Хочет получить кредит и купить еще одну дойную корову. Таким образом количество получаемого молока увеличится и она сможет получить больший доход от его продажи. Этьим  ее жизнь станет легче. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hanifa N. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is married, has three children and is a housewife. She has a secondary education. She practices animal husbandry, and sells the milk her cow gives. She would like to use a loan to buy another dairy cow. This will increase milk production so she can sell more and make a higher income. This will make her life easier. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
Abdurasul K. is a 33 year old married man with two children and parents under his care. Abdurasul is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment.

He knew many people who purchased cattle and this motivated him to start his own business twelve years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well. At the day of our visit Abdurasul was gone to the market so his mother, who helps him with his business, is pictured above.

Abdurasul now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) to purchase additional cattle to sell. More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing. He is offering to repay the loan in twelve months. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon M. is 36 years old. He learned his profession as a cattle farmer from his father when he was young. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progress more and more.

In addition to the animals, he also runs a taxi driving service in his free time. With his previous loans, he purchased two more cattle. He has already sold them and purchased two young calves, which he is rearing to sell. Today he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD), which he's promising to repay within twelve months. From the profit of his business, Umedjon wants to be able to educate his children at the university in the future. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchasing cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Husanboy

texts.en:
Husanboy N. is a 42 year old man who breeds calves and sells dairy products to local people and dairy factories. He is married and has two children.

The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life made him recognize from a very young age the value of work. For about ten years he has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, and then fattening and selling them. Raising livestock is the main financial income source in his family. Thus Husanboy wakes up early every morning to feed his calves and cow with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market when they grown enough.

Husanboy's main goal is to provide an education for his children. With this purpose in mind, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) to buy calves in order to expand his business. Let's support this hard-working man and hold our hands out to help him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Yokub

texts.en:
At 44 years of age, Yokub N. is married and has five children. His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle. This business requires lots of travel because he needs to go to remote areas where these animals cost less. This necessitates considerable financial means. The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household.

To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD), which will serve to buy more cattle to expand his business. This will allow him to effectively meet the needs of his household.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Джалматова Майрам проживает в городе Вахдат. Является знаменитой портнихой в своем кишлаке. Занимается данными услугами уже 35 лет. Возраст 58 лет имеет двоих детей. Кредит планирует использовать для покупки швейной машинки. Она хочет нанять помошницу  и поэтому ей необходима дополнительная машинка. Таким образом она увеличит объем готовой продукции , да еще и создаст новое рабочее место. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mairam J. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is one of the well known seamstresses of her village. She has been providing these services for the past 35 years. She is 58 years old and has two children. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine. She wants to hire an assistant, so she needs an extra machine. This way she can increase output, as well as providing employment. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing maching

loans.name: Bahrillo

texts.en:
Bahrillo N. is a 44 year old man and loving father of three adorable children, one daughter and two sons. His daughter is a university student and his sons are schoolboys. This is the reason Bahrillo tries very hard to provide for all their needs while they are studying.

Bahrillo has been selling livestock and dairy products, together with his wife, as a primary business since 1996. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. At the same time, he is running a taxi driving business in his free time.

Bahrillo wants to buy two cows for 3000 Somoni ($900 USD). He wants to earn more income so he can provide his children with a good education and improve their lives. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Be an important part of the growth of Bahrillo’s business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.en:
Muharam Z. is 35 years old. She is married with two children. Muharam sells office and school supplies. Her trading place is located in the central market and has a wide range of goods. The majority of her customers are schoolchildren. In comparison with other big stores selling office supplies, Muharam’s prices are lower and more attractive.

Muharam's husband is a farmer and as it is known that farming has the seasonal nature. There are periods when Muharam's business is the main source of income. Muharam repaid her previous loan ahead of schedule and now she wants to take another loan due to the high demand for her goods. She requests 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for the term of 10 months to purchase office supplies to sell. Muharam has been a client of IMON for several years with a positive credit history. She promises to repay this loan in a timely manner and thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Зайдуллоева Марзия проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужеи , имеет семерых детей. Возраст 51 год. Занимается земледелием. Сама со своими детьми , сеет пшеницу. Получаемый урожай продает на рынке. Получает неплохой доход. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы. Погасить кредит сможет в течении  10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Marziya Z. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. She practices agriculture. She and her children plant wheat together. Then she sells the harvest at the market, receiving a small profit. She would like to use a loan to buy wheat seed. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Файзуллаева Зухро проживает в городе Вахдат, в одном из отдаленном кишлаке. Работает учителем средней школе №33. Кроме этого уже 3 года занимается земледелием. Замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Кредит планирует использовать на сельское хозяйство. Закупить семена пшеницы. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zuhro F. lives in one of the distant villages of Vahdat. She works as a teacher at the secondary school number 33. Besides teaching, she has been practicing agriculture for 3 years. Zuhro is married and has a child. She plans to use this loan to purchase wheat seeds for her agricultural business. She will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat seeds

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
“God has been good to me considering that I am already a widow but still able to raise all my 5 children alone without a partner”, says Elena C., from the  Calinan District, Davao City. She has joined other entrepreneurial poor in the CEV program.

She invests in hog raising. With the help and support of her eldest son she able to run the business. From the profits she earns from her business, Elena is able to provide for the needs of her children. 

Elena is requesting another loan of $450 from CEV to purchase additional piglets and feed. “ With my first loan, I have already received good returns from my business which I really hope will help us uplift our lives” she says. "Now that I’m an active member of CEV, I enjoy receiving  the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage they offer” she added.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Хайдаров Аваз житель Варзобского района. Недавно женился . Свадьбу сыграли во дворе у родителей. Живет у родителей.  Имеет высшее образование. По профессии экономист.Работает водителем микроавтобуса марки "Тангем".Планируемый кредит хочет использовать для ремонта микроавтобуса. Погасить кредит погасит в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Avaz H. lives in the Varzob district. Recently married, he lives at his parents’ home, where his wedding was also held. He has a higher education and is an economist by profession; however, he works as a driver for a Tangem shuttle bus. Avaz wants to use this loan to repair his shuttle bus. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shuttle bus repair

loans.name: Hajran Imtiaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Hajran baji is 34 years old and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 30 years. Hajran baji is a seamstress. She charges $2 to $3 per suit stitching. Her husband is I. A., a ticket checker in a local bus. He also has ten years of experience in wholesale work. He buys wheat and rice wholesale and sells to the required customers. Hajran baji is applying for a loan to buy wheat and rice for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Amna baji wants a loan to buy clothes and colored thread for her decorative embroidery business. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zubaida baji wants a loan to repair her motorbikes for her motorbike rental business. Farhana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice wholesale; embroidery materials; an auto-rickshaw; and clothes to resell; and to repair motorbikes

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh A. is a 32 year old man who raises cows and sells dairy products to local people and factories. He is married and has two sons. As he grew up in a farming family from the beginning of his life, Farrukh has learned how to raise, breed, and sell dairy cows and other livestock.

Farrukh would like to expand his business and purchase additional cows for $1,200 USD. The purpose of the loan is to expand his business and improve the life of his family. He is working for this aim very hard and hopes that this loan will help him and make his financial income more stable.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Flordelita

texts.en:
“Like most mothers do, I keep  worrying about how  our limited income could suffice for our family daily expenses, says Flordelita B., 50-year old mother, store owner and a resident of Catalunan Grande, Davao City. She had been looking for an opportunity to earn bigger income for her family until she found herself joining other mothers in the CEV program.

Flordelita sells canned goods and other items catering to all her neighbors and friends. With the help of her husband, she has easily established her own business where she gets the additional money to spend for her family needs. She is requesting a loan of $175 from CEV to purchase goods and other items for her store.

Flordelita joined CEV because she likes the program. Being part of CEV gives her access to credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Ulukberdi

texts.en:
Ulukberdi is 34 years of age and lives with his wife and two children. He is a livestock breeder who has sheep that he breeds and grazes every morning. He has been doing this for the past seven years and considers it very profitable. He takes his livestock to the pastures every morning for nourishment. After caring for them for several months, he then takes them to be sold. This phase is complicated due to transportation issues. Because he does not own his own vehicle, he must adjust to the schedules and prices that are offered to him. He also sporadically ventures into agriculture, but he does not do this full-time because he believes that times have changed considerably for it to be a satisfactory occupation.

Ulukberdi’s two children are his reason for continuing his efforts as a livestock breeder and farmer. Today, he wishes to invest in the improvement of sheep, which is more profitable in the markets.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Суфанкулов Ахмадджон житель города  Вахдат. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет троих детей. анимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует на рынке продуктами питания.Этому бизнесу уже 3 года.  Имеет столик . Хочет увеличить торговую точку и товарооборот. Для этого он решил получить кредит . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ahmadjon S. lives in Vahdat. He is 45, married, and has three children. He works in sales. He sells food in the market. He has been doing this business for three years. He has a little stand. He wants a bigger shop and more sales. To get this, he has decided to take out a loan. He can pay off the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Mr. Vy Khut Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loan group consists of nine people who live in Trapeang Thum Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mr. Vy K. is the Village Bank president and a farmer. His crops generate an income that is too small for his family to live on, so he has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business. His wife, Mrs. Suon Neang, helps him on their farm. Mr. Vy K. and his wife have four children, two of whom are in construction while the other two attend a local school.

All the members of this group have applied for end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start cow-breeding business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Edullanates is a 45-year old mother of 2 children and a resident of Catalunan Grande, Davao City. Her husband is  a jitney driver and her children are still attending school. Their limited income could not address all her family needs.

Mary started raising pigs as well as chickens in 1996 and supplies some of the meat retailers in the town market. Her earnings from this business have greatly helped her stretch the family income.She is requesting an additional loan of $150 from CEV to purchase more chicks, piglets and feed for her poultry.  

Mary wanted to expand her poultry and hog-raising project to augment  her income. Now she is enjoying the credit assistance, trainings as well as insurance coverage CEV offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional number of chicks, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Lai Sroeun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lai Sroeun Chaem leads a group of four borrowers all of whom live in Phteah Khpos Village in Kampong Cham Province. She has a half-hectar plot of land on which to cultivate rice and earn a living. But she is not able to grow rice now because she does not have enough seeds to plant. To solve with this problem, she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to make her field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Thuch Sorn, works as a security guard. Mrs. Lai Sroeun Chaem is 34 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest, who is three years old, stays at home.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi S. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has three children. She works raising and feeding animals with the goal of later selling them. This activity created in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding.

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable little daughter. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of twelve months to buy small cattle and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Хаитова Зульфия проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Женат , имеет пятерых детей. Обеспечивает семью путем работы в сельском хозяйстве. Имеет землю . Засеивает ее различными культурами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить качественные семена пшеницы. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zulfiya H. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is married and has five children. She provides for her family by working in agriculture. She has some land. She sows various crops. She wants to take out a loan to buy high-quality wheat seeds. She can pay off the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheat seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fabrics, threads and shoes.

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Soun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Kandal Lue Village in Kandal Province have applied for a group loan that they will use for different purposes. Mrs. Mach S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the productivity of her field. Her husband, Mr. Yong Yeth, helps her on her farm. They have fO. children who are all attending the local school.

This request consists of two end-of-term loans, with the rest being monthly payment loans. The two borrowers with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. These loans are AMK’s main product because they are most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Садуллоев Лутфулло житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 29 лет. холост . Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы. Это поможет своевременно засеить землю и получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Lutfullo S. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 29 and single. He works on a community farm. He plans to take out a loan to buy wheat seed. It will help him sow his field and reap a good-quality crop. He plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheat seed.

loans.name: Mr. Sovan Mee Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan is being requested by fourteen people who live in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. Mr. Sovan M. has been chosen group leader by the members. He is a motorbike taxi driver who is not able to earn enough income to support his family. This is the case even though he also farms a small piece of land on which he grows rice. On this farm, the main problem he faces is poor quality land which needs fertilizer. That is why Mr. Sovan M. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and make his land more productive. His wife, Mrs. Eng Rotha, is a housewife who takes good care of their family and is an excellent cook. Mr. Sovan M. and his wife have six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Three attend a local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en: The leader of this group of four people is Mrs. Khunthea M., who lives Preak Thei Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Khunthea M. is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by applying for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell to her customers. By doing this, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She is a 43-year-old widow with five children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one attends a local school.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to meet customer demand

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Hor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan is being requested by fourteen people who live in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Mom H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Because she now has a lot of customers who are buying large amounts of her products, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell to meet their demand. She is a 48-year-old widow with four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while her youngest, who is only five years old, stays at home.

This request includes some end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Mara Ken Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who live in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province have applied for this loan, which they will use for different purposes. Mrs. Mara K. is the village bank president and will use her portion of the loan to expand a pig-breeding business that is doing well. She is also a garment worker. Her husband, Mr. Chon Loehak, is a motorbike taxi driver and also helps her with her business when he has spare time. Mrs. Mara K. is 21 years old and the mother of two children who are one and three years old.

One member of this group has an end-of-term loan; the rest have monthly payment loans. The member with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To expand a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Lay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The group loan will benefit twenty-two people who live I. Veal Thlan Village I. Kandal Province. Mrs. Sokha L. has been elected village bank president by the members. She owns a small store where she earns a living by selling rice soup. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy ingredients to cook her delicious soup for her consumers. She is applying for this loan so that she can buy those ingredients. Her husband, Mr. Mom Vann, is a journalist. Mrs. Sokha L. is 30 years old and the mother of a one-year-old child.

This applicatiO. includes seven end-of-term loans; the rest have monthly-payment loans. The first group of borrowers are not required to pay any principal O. the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments O. time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% O. Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to cook rice soup for her consumers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a new business selling bread.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin S. leads a loan group with five members, all of whom live in Kvav village in Takeo Province. She works as a basket maker and her husband also works, but they do not earn enough income to support their family. That is why Mrs. Rin S. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow and start a cow-breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 27 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the third is too young to work or study.

Three members of this group have end-of-term loans, while the rest of have monthly-payment loans. The people in the first group are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are very beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy a cow and start a cow-breeding business.

loans.name: Geoffy

texts.en:
“I am always bothered about how am I going to manage our family finances especially sinceI have 2 children who are still studying ”, says Geoffy M., 35-year old mother and food stall owner from Tibungco District, Davao City.
She is requesting a loan from CEV of $125 to purchase food ingredients as well as materials for her small food stall. Her husband has been helping her run the business which they hope will have them bigger earnings for their family. 

In an interview Geoffy said, “Our participation in the CEV program has helped both of us to work hand-in-hand to grow our investment”. She further states,  “ Now that we have joined CEV, we have easy access to the credit assistance, trainings and insurance benefits they offer”.

loans.use: To purchase additional  ingredients and food materials

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced and has one son who is 17 years old. She owns a kiosk at Julana Market located in Pavlograd city. The kiosk is located at a good place where many people come by. This gives her a competitive advantage. Her primary goods are hats. Having big variety always attracts customers.

Ludmila has been working in this business for 8 years. In the beginning she left her previous employment because her employer did not pay her salary. She started small and was able to develop her business little by little. Finally she build her own kiosk which is the main source of income in the family. Her son just entered the college this year and Ludmila manages to cover his tuition.

Ludmila would like to get a loan of 1,500 UAH to purchase winter hats. She is hoping that increased sales activity will help her to generate more income so she can continue to pay her son's college tuition.

loans.use: to purchase winter hats for re-sale

loans.name: Paok

texts.en: Mr. Paok N. lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he makes a living by cultivating rice. His wife, Mrs. Kuth Ly, is a motorbike taxi driver. Even though they both work, they can not support their family well. That is why Mr. Paok N. has decided to apply for a loan to buy ducklings to start a duck-breeding business. He will also use a portion of the loan to buy food for the ducklings. He is 44 years old and he and his wife have six children, three of whom are employed in garment factories. The other three are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To start a duck-breeding business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel R. is 41 years old. He is married and the father of five children. He is a carpenter. He makes and repairs home and office furniture (e.g. tables, chairs, beds, wardrobes, etc.)

He is applying for a loan of two hundred thousand Rwandan francs (200,000 Rwf) which will enable him to add to his stock of wood. This will enable him to satisfy demand easily. Mr R. encounters some difficulties with not being able to satisfy demand for his goods and with customers who delay payment.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company s.a. He says that once he gets this loan he will make profit and pay the school fees of his children and improve the welfare of the family.

He is seen by the community as a hard-working and a trustworthy man. He wants to see his business flourish and have a positive social impact on the neighborhood. For instance he feels happy when he sees that he has hired four employees so far.

loans.use: To increase his stock of wood

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Bunthoeun S. is a 41-year-old widow with six children who all live in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. One of her children is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Mrs. Bunthoeun S. is a fishmonger in the local market but this business is not as lucrative as it once was, so she is seeking a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Khnar

texts.en: Mrs. Khnar S. lives in Kvav village in Takeo Province. She is a Khmer cake seller who earns a small income to support her family from this business. Her husband, Mr. Meas Chanthon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice; he is also a basketmaker. Even taken together, the couple's incomes are so little that they cannot support their family. Thus, Mrs. Khnar S. decided to seek a loan to buy ducklings and food to start breeding ducks. By starting this business, she hopes to earn additional income and to provide a better life for her family. Mrs. Khnar S. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy ducklings to start a duck breeding business

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mrs. Soem M. is 41 years old and lives in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ouk Ren, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from the farm, Mrs. Soem M. also sells water lilies, but their income is still very low, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to thereby increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Soem M. has five children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Robier

texts.en:
Robier is a 40-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Robier owns a restaurant and a wood-fired bakery. He sells sandwiches and "mankoucheh". A "mankoucheh" looks like a folded pizza; the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Robier requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Masjmoua in order to purchase flour and raw materials. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Robier expects from the loan that it will help him improve his capital in the shop. He is very knowledgeable in the restaurant business. He plans in the future to expand his business.

loans.use: Robier needs the loan to purchase flour and raw materials

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Mrs. Un D. is a basketmaker who lives in Kvav village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Heim Lorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he grows rice. Since their incomes cannot support the family through the high inflation in Cambodia, Mrs. Un D. is requesting a loan to buy some ducklings and duck food for breeding. By starting her poultry business, she hopes to earn additional income and improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Un D. is a 41-year-old mother of seven children: one of her children is employed in a garment factory, two are coconut sellers, two are enrolled in the local school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some ducklings for breeding

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
“ For a long time I’ve been dreaming about a good and a bright future for my children”, says Flora L., who is 47years old and married with 5 children.  She is from Matina, Davao City. By sending all of her children to college she believes that there will be a future ahead of them after school.

Flora has a retail store  that sprouted from very modest beginnings. She is a new client of CEV and is determined to succeed in her business. She is requesting a $125 loan from CEV to purchase additional goods to be displayed in her store. She plans to utilize her loan for additional stock to augment her income. 

Now that she is a member of CEV, Flora enjoys receiving the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage that the organization provides.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en: Mrs. Sinuon H. is 39-year-old fishmonger who lives in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeung Moeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. On his farm, he has only one old buffalo of his own, so he usually pays a lot of money to hire a plowing team. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sinuon H. is seeking a loan to buy a buffalo to add to the old one to help plow the field. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to help plow the rice field

loans.name: G. Dhedhey

texts.fr:
Née le 13 septembre 1971 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, madame G. G. Dhedhey est une femme mariée et son mari est militaire.  Elle a quatre (4) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé, au petit magasin sur un chemin avec beaucoup de poussière et en face d’une mosquée. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2003.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de se préparer pour bien vendre pendant les périodes de fête de fin d’année ; ainsi elle achètera 10 sacs de riz, 10 cartons de tomates, 10 bidons d’huile, et 20 cartons d’eau.
texts.en:
Born on September 13, 1971 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Mrs. G. Dhedhey G. is a married woman whose husband is a soldier. She has four children. She sells food staples in the north Lomé neighborhood of Agoè, in a small shop on a very dusty street, opposite a mosque. She has been doing this since 2003. This first-time loan that she is requesting will enable her to prepare for brisk sales during the end-of-year holiday period. She will buy 10 bags of rice, 10 cases of tomatoes, 10 drums of oil and 20 cases of water.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food staples

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is an 18-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. Afif is an employee in a furniture gallery. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to repair his car. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, Afif plans to own his private business.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea N. is a farmer in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this farm, she also sells water lilies in the local market. Due to rampant inflation, she has been unable to earn enough money to support her family. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a cattle breeding business. She hopes thereby to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Phea N. is a 51 year old widow with four children: one is a waitress in the restaurant, one helps on the farm, and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cattle-breeding business

loans.name: Nor Mohammad

texts.en:
Nor Mohammad is married and lives in his nuclear family. He works in agriculture. He has been working here for more than 6 years because the business was left to him by his father. After the death of his father, he took responsibility for his family and he continued the business. Therefore he needs to expand his business.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for a term of 18 months to complete his stock and buy more seeds for his land so that he can plant all his lands and make a good profit to send wheat to be sold at the bazaar and continue his business with more success and make a better future for his family.

Nor Mohammad is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to say that he is going to be improving his business and make a better commerce in the future. He would like to thank lenders around the world for supporting this process of small loans in his country.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, etc. for his land

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 37-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. Ammar is a contractor. He learned the business since he was a child. He does tiling, painting, and sanitary work. Ammar has requested a loan of 900 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car. This is his third loan and he always pays on schedule.

His future plan is to open a shop and sell sanitary products.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap N. is 39 years old and lives in Kdol village in Takeo Province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Aum Lo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Despite their hard work, rampant inflation has made it difficult for them to improve their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap N. is seeking a loan to buy lumber to contribute to building a house for her family. She has five children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy lumber to contribute to building a new house

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita E. lives in Barangay Paz, Libertad, Antique. She is 35 years of age and married to Mr. Danilo E.. She was blessed with 5 children. Margarita worked as a housemaid in Manila for almost 3 years to send her children to school. Her husband had no permanent job, so her family was very poor during that time.

Her dream is to have a business buying dried fish and selling it in the market of Pandan. She plans to purchase a pump boat for her husband to use in fishing. She also plans to have a motorcycle to use when buying and selling the fish. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and find stable jobs someday.

She joined ASHI because she wants to have a business with the support of her husband to earn more for the expenses and needs of the family. This is also a way to change their way of living. She desires a loan amounting to P5,000.00 for this business.

loans.use: To fund a fish vending business

loans.name: Angie Rose

texts.en:
Angie Rose is a 20 year old woman aspiring to help her family by starting up a buy and sell business. While living with her parents, she wants to help her brothers and sisters finish their educations. Her husband is working as a driver in the nearby province. They have a two-month-old son named Earl Lawrence.

Angie had joined ASHI to support her husband as well as her family. Her loan will be used to purchase curtains, pillow cases, and beauty products so that she can have an income that sustains her daily needs.

Through her membership in ASHI, she dreams of having a stable business that will help her and her husband acquire their own house, help her family, and give a bright future to Earl Lawrence.

loans.use: Buy products for resell

loans.name: Petrina

texts.en:
Mrs. Petrina is a 56-year-old woman with a small store in her home. She sells assorted vegetables and dried food products to sustain the daily needs of the family. Together with her husband, she maintains the business.

She joined ASHI for additional capital for the purchase of assorted vegetables and one hog to be reared. Both she and her husband wanted to save for the future to answer their financial needs, help their children, and live comfortably by having a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase of dried fish, vegetables, and hog

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 56-year-old woman who has a buy and sell business. She sells different kinds of vegetables and fruits at nearby markets in Sibalom, Antique, five days a week earning a daily net income of Php120.00 (approximately US$2.00). With various challenges she has overcome in her life, she learned that one should be courageous in facing problems. She has moved from different places and found Antique to be her home where she could start up her business.

She was approved to borrow her first loan amounting P5,000.00 payable for 1 year.

She joined ASHI to help her sister’s family in the nearby barangay and save for the future since she is living alone. Through industry and discipline, she dreams of expanding the buy and sell business with additional capital to purchase a variety of stock to be sold to her customers. She wants to save to own a house and lot in the future, and to share and help in the community.

loans.use: Buy and sell vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Mr. Ean K. is 51 years old and lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. His wife, Mrs. Koeut Hum, is a construction worker. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn insufficient income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Ean K. is seeking a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business; he plans to use the remainder of the loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. He is married and has four children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Viboth

texts.en: Mr. Viboth H. is a villager in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this farm, he wants to use his motorbike to transport goods and passengers. Thus, he is seeking a loan to buy a cart for this purpose. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Chhan Chrep, is employed in a garment factory. Mr. Viboth H. is 27 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cart to be pulled by his motorbike

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Nanay Flordeliza I. is a resident of Brgy. Poblacion Norte, Sitio Igcaputol, Tobias Fornier Antique. She is married to Ricardo I. and has two children. Currently, Nanay “Flor” is busy with her small business buying and selling tobacco just to earn the means of living every day. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center. 

Nanay Flor came from a very poor family; she was the sixth of ten children. She was the luckiest among her siblings to attend school because of her determination. Nanay Flor believes that education can lift you from poverty, and that’s why she is now a Day Care teacher who teaches the children to read and write.

Nanay Flor manages her obligation as a teacher and is a very good member of ASHI. She performs well in her business; when she has enough capital, she adds more business in order to gain more income. She hopes to share this with her children and grandchildren. 

Nanay Flor got married at the age of 19, a marriage arranged by her parents. She did not want to marry, but she had no choice but to accept it in respect to her parents. Nanay Flor strives very hard so that what she experienced will not be experienced by her children and grandchildren in the future.

loans.use: Buy and sell tobacco

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanty K. is a 23-year-old who makes a living growing mushrooms to sell. She has much experiences with this business, having been in it since 2001. She currently has an income of US$ 5 per day to cover her whole family's expenses, and especially for her two young children whom she wants to attend school.

Her husband, Mr. Sokkom Shan, 26, is a mushroom grower who works together with his wife. Chanty hopes to enlarge her business and she would like to apply for a US$ 700 loan to buy more seeds to grow mushrooms again.

They live in Kompong Tom Province. Mrs. Chanty's mother and her child are in the photo as Chanty was not available that day.

loans.use: to buy more seeds to grow mushrooms again

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
A loving and truthful wife, Bernardita O. G. is a new member of Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) of Antique South West Branch of Igcaputol Center 38. She has experienced a miserable life because her parents are very poor and less educated. Because of her bloodline, being native or indigenous people, her capacity was always under estimated. She works hard under the sun in order to provide her family's daily needs. 

She was blessed with six children, but unfortunately one child died at the age of 18. Due to their painful and miserable life, she was forced to work hard in order to have an income for their food.  When her son died, she really felt hopeless. However, she needed to move on and was forced to apply for a loan in one of the institutions with a higher interest just to cope with the financial needs of her family. But it seems that they were abused by the financial institution; many of her group mates had missed their payment and their savings was used to pay the unpaid balance. 

When ASHI encouraged her to take the opportunity to have a loan she was hesitant at first because of her bad experience. When one member of their area received a loan, she understood the advantage of joining the institution. She was encouraged to form a group and avail the chance of having capital. She had a proposal for Php5,000.00 to be used for a boat and fish net for fishing. She is looking forward to the utmost support.

loans.use: Fish Net & Fish Vending

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline O. is a 40-year-old member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. Antique Southwest Branch, Antique Area, Philippines. She is the mother of five children and a wife who is really helping her husband just to sustain the daily needs of the family situated at the very poor Sitio of Poblacion Norte, where all families are excluded in terms of opportunities.

She is married to a native man who worked as a “sacada”, a hired laborer on the sugarcane plantation. He works almost 24 hours a day just to save for his family. Being the wife of a laborer is so difficult because a daily income can not sustain even three meals and the education of her children. Evangeline believes that education is a key to change people’s lives, and she does not want to let her children experience what she has experienced.

Evangeline has many dreams to achieve despite the many criticisms she has encountered because of their miserable situation. This situation sometimes leads her into depression and she worries that there is no hope to rise from poverty. Only when ASHI arrived looking for the poor who want to get out of poverty, she smiled in accepting the new opportunity to have capital to start up a small business. She would like to buy a boat, to be used by her husband, and a sari-sari store for her. The amount of Php5,000.00 is a big amount for her to invest to achieve her dreams. The principles and teaching in compulsory group training is her way to move forward.

loans.use: Fishing supplies and products for retail

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
At a young age, Marilyn Palacios experienced many painful moments. She came from a struggling family and was not able to enjoy her childhood days playing games with her peers. Instead, she worked very had to provide income for food for her family. Because of this situation, she decided to get married, but her husband was also poor.

Marilyn Palacios I. lives at Sitio Igcaputol, Poblacion Norte, Tobias Fornier and is blessed with five children. They live in a small house made of nipa shingles with some parts covered by empty sacks of fertilizer and cement. It is uncomfortable for them, especially when rains and typhoons come. They are trying their best to survive even though sometimes they cannot eat rice for a day. Her children are malnourished due to insufficient nutrient intake that results in sickness. 

After the meeting of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. she wished to join and start a business. But her neighbors don’t want to join her because of their miserable situation. When ASHI staff motivated her to join, she was very thankful, full of tears and passion to have a small amount of capital to start making her dreams come true. She saw a bright future as she looked forward to the challenge of starting a business with a fish net and a boat to be used by her husband. An amount of Php5, 000.00 is sufficient for them to start anew with dignity and to achieve the respect of their neighborhood.

loans.use: Fish Net and Fish Vending

loans.name: Mrs. Sarun Nop Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of seventeen members is located in Angk Ta Nu village in Takeo Province. All the members plan to use their loan proceeds for different purposes. Mrs. Sarun N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is beautician who does makeup for wedding ceremonies. Since her business is going well, she wants to use her proceeds to buy additional cosmetic products. Her husband, Mr. Kat Sao, is a farmer. Mrs. Sarun N. is 29 years old and the mother of four children, three of whO. are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Nanay Letty came from a very poor family in which she experienced having nothing to eat, as well as eating ground corn instead of rice, and bamboo shoots as their main dish. Nanay Letty does not want to experience again what she experienced before, and that’s why she works very hard to give her best for the family and to change the level of their means of living. 

She is a positive thinker who strives very hard for the education of her children, so that they can find stable jobs and move out of poverty.

Nanay Letty dreams of owning a fishing boat with a motor engine, but because of a lack of financial support, she cannot get it. That  is why she is asking people who are concerned to provide capital to finance this business. ASHI is a great help to her in developing her skills in dealing with other people, not only in their community. She wants to do what is best for her family, and that is why she performs very well.

loans.use: Fishing

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who earns a little rice revenue from her farm. Aside from this plantation, she sells water lilies. She is a 47-year-old widow with four children: one is employed in a garment factory, two are construction workers, and the youngest one is attending the local school. Even though Mrs. Sokha K.’s family members have different businesses, they cannot support their household well. Thus, Mrs. Sokha K. is seeking a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and thus provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for breeding

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl S., or nanay Sheryl, is a good follower and good leader of her local Center. She is a resident of Brgy. Poblacion Norte, Sitio Igcaputol,Tobias, Fornier, Antique. She is married to Adriano S. and has two children. Currently, nanay Sheryl is the center chief of ASHI in her center. She meets her obligations well and encourages the group to join ASHI. A Sari-sari store is her means of making a living, and her loan from ASHI was used to finance this business for the children's future. 

Nanay Sheryl came from a very poor family and her sisters were adopted by other people. Her parents believed that it would be easier for them to provide foods if they were fewer. Fortunately, she found a responsible husband who provides for their financial needs. She wants what is best for her family and that is why she works very hard and inspires her children to go to school so that they can find stable jobs for the future. 

She dreams that some day her small store will become a mini-grocery where the people in the sitio will conveniently find their needs. To make her dreams come true, she needs a big capital loan. She is asking for a lender who could help her to achieve all her dreams in life.

loans.use: Variety store & food vending

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: Originaire de Porto-Novo, dame I. Fatima est née le 11 mai 1976 et  s'est mariée avec monsieur ZANMENOU Clodoue. Elle a à charge deux enfants, tous scolarisés et trois domestiques qu'elle paie  à la fin de chaque mois. Elle prepare de la pate,du piron, de l'akassa et frit la viande de pouletset des poissons ,qu'elle vend au bord d'une voie. Suite aux travaux de reamenagement sur cette voie,et cette dernière etant devenue praticable, dame I. s'est fait connaitre de tous. ainsi donc pour satisfaire toute sa clientèle, elle a sollicité un nouveau pret.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. Originally from Porto-Novo, Fatima I. was born on May 11, 1976 and is married to Cloudou Zanmenou. She has 2 children in school and 3 household helpers that she pays at the end of each month. She makes akassa (snacks of pate, the staple carbohyrate of Benin), chicken, and fish that she sells on the side of the road. With this loan, Fatima would like to buy more stocks of corn, meat, and fish.

Translated from French by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 packages of meat, 3 cartons of fish, and 2 bags of rice

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta D. is a resident of Brgy. Poblacion Norte, Sitio Igcaputol, Tobias, Fornier, Antique, and is married to Roberto D.. They were blessed with eight children, but only seven are still living. Antonieta, or nanay "Anto", currently has a small sari-sari store that augments her family's daily needs. With a small capital investment from ASHI, she managed to invest in her business in order not to be a problem for her loan group or for the center. 

Nanay “Anto” is the deputy center chief of her center. She is a very good member as well as a leader to her co-members. She is always willing to support the center chief for the goodness of the center. Nanay “Anto” is a very industrious woman because she does not want her past experiences to be experienced by her children or grandchildren. She came from a very poor family, and that is why she works hard to get out of poverty. She is also dedicated and determined to fulfill her responsibility as a member and as a resident of their Brgy. She performs very well so that, through ASHI, she can achieve all of her aspirations and dreams in life.

In the end, Nanay “Anto” will be a successful businesswoman if she has enough capital to be used in her small Sari-sari store. She believes that if she achieves her dreams, then she will help others to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana E. is 22 years old and married to ,Jimmy Roquero, who has no stable job to support their lovely daughter named Joanna Roquero. They live in a small dilapidated house made of nipa shingles and bamboo.  They lack money even though there are only three in the family. Rosana works as a laundrywoman in the town and earns Php150.00 a day, just enough to buy a kilo of rice and a piece of fish as their daily food. She cannot meet the needs of her daughter especially in times of sickness. This is why she joined Ahon Sa Hirap:  to get capital to start a business. 

She wants her husband to support her in her project of hog fattening and opening a sari-sari store. She needs Php5,000.00 (USD $125) to start this project as the way to achieve her dreams.  She dreams of sending her daughter to college and having a stable source of income. She wants to end her hard times of being an “ita” or native without opportunities.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Rose Annilyn

texts.en:
Rose Annilyn H., 32 years old, is a new ASHI member as of Oct. 29, 2008.  She lives in Bagumbayan, San Jose, Antique, Philippines with her husband and three children.  She and her husband, Mr. Marlon H., have only an elementary level education.  They come from very poor families.  They realize that their lack of education has led to their poverty, and they want a better life for their children.  

They decided to join ASHI to get capital for their business, which is selling fish. They have requested Php 5,000.00 (USD $125).  They will invest this capital in their own pump boat.

loans.use: To buy a pump boat for their fish selling business.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Mrs. Saret N. is a basket maker in Prey Chuor village in Takeo Province. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more raw material to make more baskets and use some of the money to buy chickens to start a chicken-breeding business. She hopes thereby to increase her income and provide a better life for her children. Her husband, Mr. Chum Aun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. She is 47 years old and the mother of five children: two are laborers while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy material to make baskets and buy chickens to start a chicken-breeding business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is a new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Antique Southwest Branch. She has had a very difficult life, growing up without enough food to eat.  She was forced to help her parents at a young age. Instead of playing with other children, she worked very hard under the sun to earn income for her family's food. She attended school only up to Grade 2.  Because of her many absences and insufficient school materials, she stopped studying and cannot read or write.  As an adult, she has worked as a housemaid.

She and her husband are blessed with a baby girl. They live in a very small dilapidated “nipa hut”.  At first, her husband didn't want to join ASHI because they were afraid of the weekly responsibility, but the development officer convinced them to join. Teresita found the training very difficult because of her illiteracy, but she was very happy when the staff taught her to write her signature. 

Presently, she is very proud to be an ASHI member.  She hopes that the institution can help her achieve her greatest dream:  to send her daughter to school through college and to establish a habitable house. She aspires to have a loan of Php 5,000.00 (USD $125) to finance their boat, which will be used by her husband in fishing.

loans.use: To finance a fishing boat

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 31-year-old woman with a dream to help her family get out of poverty.  Though various challenges come to her life, she believes that through industry, courage and determination, she and her family can achieve their aspirations. Their house is situated in the midst of rice fields where she lives with her husband Mario, a laborer. They are blessed with one 10-year-old daughter, Jennifer, who has cerebral palsy.

Her current situation and her vision for the future have been the motivation for Ruth to join ASHI. She wanted to help her husband by earning an additional income which can support their financial needs. She plans to buy 2 hogs and construct a pig pen near their house, so she can stay at home to tend to Jennifer’s needs as well as earn income for the family.

Ruth and her husband dream of having a piggery in the near future.  They want to have a stable business so they can support and sustain Jennifer’s needs aside from the love they are giving to her.

loans.use: Hog Fattening

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en: Mrs. Saroem T. lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Long Bros, is a construction worker. Since his work site is far from the house, he pays a lot for transportation. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Saroem T. is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband. She is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's transportation

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Nanay Janeth is one of the members of ASHI from group 2 of Paz center 29. She is from Tarlac and married to Jimmy E. of Brgy. Paz, Liberated, Antique. They are blessed with two children, Joshua and Jan Avegail. She is 33 years of age. Mang Jimmy was formerly employed in one of the piggeries in Bulacan owned by Lito Co. After four years in Bulacan, they decided to move to Antique to start a new life and to have their own business. They wanted to use and practice what Mang Jimmy learned while they were in Bulacan. But challenge came when Mang Jimmy was hospitalized. He was hit on the back by a falling coconut. Nanay Janeth was forced to find a job to support the family. She went to Manila and worked as caregiver for an elderly man, earning a salary of two thousand pesos a month. After six months, Mang Jimmy was fit to work again so they started their business. 

They joined ASHI to have capital for fishing. Their first loan was used to purchase fishing material. With just a manual, simple way of catching fish, they were able to sustain their family's basic needs. 

Their dream in life is to send their children to school through college and to have a sustainable business. They want to build a big Bangka for fishing and a piggery. Nanay Janeth also wants to help their relatives and friends and those marginalized and less fortunate people who dream of a better life. She wants to extend their business by buying dried fish in Antique and delivering it to her sister in Tarlac, who has a stall in the market.

loans.use: Fishing

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Before she met her husband, Rosalia Javier R. was a factory worker. She has also worked as a sales representative and as a housemaid. Her husband is very dedicated and determined to work hard to support his family.

She is thankful to ASHI for her first loan of PHP 5,000 (USD $125).  With that loan, she bought one hog as a starting point to a piggery.  She also wants to have a store where she can display and sell products like vegetables they harvest from their farm.

loans.use: Hog Fattening

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is a strong and determined woman who joined ASHI on Oct. 29, 2008.  Since her family was so poor, she only reached Grade 1 in school and cannot read.  This limits her ability to join any organization or group in the community.  Despite her lack of education, she is very industrious and has a vision of a better education for her child.  

Marilyn wakes up early in the morning with her husband to go to the slaughterhouse to slaughter hogs and cattle.
She is applying for her first loan of Php 5,000.00 (USD $125) which she will use to purchase meat to sell in their village.

loans.use: Meat Vending

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
April Joy G. is 20 years old; she lives with her partner and their child.  She decided to join ASHI because she wants to start married life with some income-generating activity to finance the needs of the family.  At present they are still living with her parents. They aim to have their own house and have a stable life for their children and for the whole family. 

She repaid her first loan last Nov. 12, 2008, which she used as starting capital for her food-selling business in the village in Bagumbayan, San Jose, Antique. Philippines.

loans.use: Food Vending

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeun K., 50, is a fisherman who depends on fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake where he can catch around 20 kg per day. He is married to Mrs. Thon E, 49 years old, who makes a living selling fish that her husband catches.

Thon has seven children, three of whom are married; her two daughters are working in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. As another source of income, Khoeun requests a loan of US$ 600 to purchase oxen to sell for a profit. The borrowers live in Kompong Tom Province.(Mr. Khoeun's wife is pictured, because he was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase oxen to re-sell

loans.name: Floravie

texts.en:
Floravie C. is 26 years old. She joined ASHI October 29, 2008.  She is married to Mr. Vincent C., who works in the public school as maintenance staff, and they have three children.

She joined ASHI because she wanted to have her own business, since her husband's income is not enough to sustain the daily needs of their family. She will use her loan of Php 5,000.00 (USD $125) in the retail and vending of rice and charcoal.

She and her husband aim to use ASHI loans to develop a stable business so they can support the education of their children and have their own home.

loans.use: Rice Retailing & Charcoal Retailing

loans.name: Marie-Claire

texts.fr: Née le 22/08/1965 à Cotonou dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin,Dame K. Marie-Claire est mariée à GBEDAN Pierre agent de transit à BETREXCO,mère de quatre enfants,elle s'est dépuis près de 20 ans spécialisée dans la distributionde vente de boissns fraiche devant le Port Autonome de Cotonou, dame Marie-Claire tout les soires fris de l'igname et le beigné d'haricot; Aujourd'hui,face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèl, elle procède à la demande de son quatrième prèt.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. Born on August 22, 1965 in Cotonou in Benin South Peninsula County, Marie-Claire K. married Pierre Gbedan, a transit agent at BETREXCO, a boating transportation company. She has 4 children and has sold cold drinks for almost 20 years in front of the Cotonou Port. Marie-Claire also sells igname (a potato-like traditional food) and beans. She is now asking for her fourth loan to stock up on drinks and ignames.

Translated from French by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 14 crates of drinks and 3 bags of ignames (a potato-like traditional food)

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Mr. Kheng C. is a farmer in Ta Dokpong village in Takeo Province. He owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Kim Sok Kim, is a veterinarian in the village. Although they have separate businesses, even together they still cannot support their household well. Thus, Mr. Kheng C. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. He is 44 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilyn Oliva G. is 35 years old and an ASHI member at PAZ center 29.  She is a native of Barangay Paz, Libertad, Antique. She is married to Raymond Urbina G. and they are blessed with one child named Mike G.. 
Before she met her husband, she was working in a shoe factory in Marikina City. She went to Manila to earn money to help her family in Bicol. After several years, the factory closed because of mismanagement. So they decided to go back to her husband's home and leave the crowded city of Manila. 
The couple had difficulty in the province because nobody trusted them. But through ASHI, she received free training and she and her husband started a small piggery in the backyard. She believes that joining ASHI is the way to success. 
She now wants to expand her business with a variety store so that they have daily income for everyday expenses.  She dreams that her child will finish his studies and find a good job in the future.

loans.use: Hog Fattening

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Mrs. Juleta S. B. is 70 years old and lives in Brgy. Paz, Libertad, Antique. She was married to Mr. Iluminado B. who died 5 years ago. They were blessed with 3 children. They started with nothing because they both came from poor families. Despite their economic status, the couple wanted to raise their children for a better future.  She is very thankful that her children are kind and responsible in their studies. With God's blessing and their industry and determination, two of her children have already finished their studies. 

At the age of 70, without a partner in life, she runs a small sari-sari store to earn income to provide for her needs. She does not want to depend on her children because they have their own family needs. As long as she is strong she won’t give up because of her dreams for her grandchildren. 

She felt a little doubt about joining ASHI because of her age. But the institution trusted her and she became a member. She dreams of helping not only herself but also her entire family, especially her grandchildren. She hopes that someday her small sari-sari store will be a grocery store. She wants to borrow PHP 5,000.00 (USD $125) to sustain her business.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna Arevallo, 40 years old, married and the  mother of 3 children is a new CEV client from Matina, Davao City.  She wants to expand her business but needs assistance to market her products. 

People come to her for new sandals. She makes as well as sells them in her town as a way to address all her family needs. She borrowed capital from her parents to start up her business. The sandals sell for 100-120 pesos from which she able to earn 50-60 pesos profit per pair. 

Edna needs an additional $125 of capital to expand her business. She will use the money to purchase additional materials for making sandals. 

Edna wants to own a stall in the market in Davao City. Now that she has joined CEV, she has access to the credit assistance, trainings and insurance benefits CEV offers.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making sandals

loans.name: N. Jean

texts.fr: Né vers 1964 à Dangbo, sieur K. N. Jean est père de deux enfants Luc-Martin agé de 20 ans est etudiant, et José-Mario agé de 16ans en classe de 1èreD, il est mécanicien de formation et a lui-même son garage. Pour couvrir ses differentes charges liées  à sa petire famille il a crée ce petit commerce. vu la demande regulière de sa clientèle il a sollicité son prémier pret.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. Born around 1964 in Dangbo, N. Jean Kodgo is the father of two children, Luc-Martin who is a 20 year-old student, and Jose-Mario, a 16 year-old in high school. He is a mechanic and has his own garage. To supplement his family’s small income, he has decided to apply for a loan in order to sell rechargeable phone cards.

Translated from French by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rechargeable cell phone cards

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man S. is a mushroom farmer who lives in Prey Chuor village in Takeo Province. However, she faces an obstacle in that she does not have enough money to re-seed the farm. Thus, she is seeking a loan to buy seeds to grow mushrooms, thereby increasing her income and improving her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Pel Sok, is a construction worker. Mrs. Man S. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are laborers while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy seeds to grow mushrooms

loans.name: Sidikatou

texts.en:
Sidikatou M. is 37 years old and married to Imorou Bagoudou. She has 3 children in school. She sells onions that she buys from vendors in the north of Benin and elsewhere. She currently has a small store in the Slaughterhouse Market, and is the sole vendor to supply large quantities of onions. She seeks this loan to better serve her clients.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. 

Agée de 37ans, dame M. Sidikatou est mariée à BAGOUDOU Imorou, elle est mere de 03 enfants,tous scolarisés elle vend de l'oignon qu'elle achète aupres des commerçants venu du nord et ailleurs. Actuellement disposant d'une boutique dans le marché de l'abattoir et actuellement la seule à fournir de l'oignon en grande quantité,elle a sollicité le renouvellement de son pret pour servir à mieux ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 40 baskets of 40 onions

loans.name: Vonn

texts.en:
Mr. Vonn K. is 43 years old. He has Khmer musical instruments to furnish to his clients for wedding parties and also is a motorcycle taxi driver. His wife, Mrs. Sok Shat, 43, is a rice farmer who has seven children; one is married, and two of her daughters are working for a garment factory, both get a salary of US$ 150 per month.

Vonn hopes to have a cow to make his wife's business easier, hence he has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Riel (US$ 250) to purchase a cow and music instruments. They live in Kompong Tom Province.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and music instrument

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mr. Ra K. is a 25-year-old farmer who lives in Sam Nor Kmao village in Takeo Province. He farms with his wife, Mrs. Touch Sokun, who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Inflationhas become so prevalent that they earn less and less income from the farm, so now Ra K. is going to become an ice-cream seller.
