Thus, Mr. Ra K. is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike and an icebox for his new business. He hopes to increase his family's income and thereby improve their living conditions through this loan. He is the father of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and an icebox to sell ice cream

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Mrs. Vy Rin is a 21-year-old rice farmer in Kvav village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Bros Pao, sells secondhand batteries. Because his business is doing well, he wants to expand. To this end, Mrs. Vy Rin is seeking a loan to buy more secondhand batteries that he can repair and resell. They hope thereby to increase their income and improve their living conditions. The couple does not currently have any children.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand batteries for resale

loans.name: Pierette

texts.en:
Married to Maurice Noutai and the mother of two children in school, Pierette Noutai was born on June 25, 1971 in Porto-Novo in the south of Benin. Pierette has sold her wares in the Degakon intersection for the last six years. She specializes in beauty products, liquor, and assorted products such as milk and spaghetti. She would like to buy more liquor and cartons of cream to satisfy the coming holiday demand.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Mariée à NOUATIN Maurice et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisé, Dame NOUTAÏ Pierrette est néé le 25 juin 1971 à Porto-Novo au Sud du Bénin dans le département de l'Ouémé, Dame Pierrette pour écouler ses produits s'est depuits près de six ans installée au carrefour de Dégakon pour la vente de ses articles , Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vents des produits de beautés, des liqueurs et des articles divers tels que le lait,les spaguettis,,, Dame pierrette ayant quelques problèmes financière à réçu de sa ses clients des commandes pour les fêtes de fin d'année;ainsi, elle demande son premier crédit.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 boxes of liquor and 2 cartons of pommade

loans.name: Floresa

texts.en:
Floresa C. who lives happily with her loving and industrious husband and five good children, has been engaged in the hog raising business for four years now.  This business is her way of helping her husband in providing for the needs of their family.  
	
In order to realize her plan of growing her business, Floresa requests  a loan of $125. She will use a portion of this money to buy at least 2-3 piglets and then sell these in the market after a few months.  Some of her loan will also be used to buy hog feed and the materials to build a bigger pen so that she can raise more hogs.  With the expected increased income, she knows that she will be able to support the education of her five children. 

With the help of her husband, Floresa,  who never gets tired and considers her family as her source of strength and inspiration, believes that they will eventually be uplifted from poverty.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Sardarn M.nawaz Group

texts.en:
Sardarn baji is the wife of M. N. and resides in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 50 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son works in a poultry form and prepares chicken feed. The next is a delivery man and delivers fruits and vegetables from one place to another. Her youngest son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Sardaran baji’s husband runs a tea stall in the community. People come to him to take tea. He charges Pak. rupees 5 for each cup of tea. Sardarn baji makes embroidered dresses at home and sells them in clothing shops and earns profit. She is applying for a loan to buy material (tea and sugar and milk) for her husband’s tea shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Zahooran baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Kaneez baji wants a loan to buy clothes to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband's tea stall

loans.name: Roukayath

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. 


Born around 1969 in Plateau County in South Benin, Roukayath O. married Casmir Effouyemi and has 3 children in school. She specializes in beauty products and assorted products in the PK10 neighborhood where she has her storefront. She has seen her client demand increase enough to merit a loan to buy more beauty products. 


Née vers 1969 au Sud du Bénin dans le département du Plateau, Dame O. Roukayath est mariée à EFFOUYEMI Casmir et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Spécialisée dans la distribution des produits de beautés et de quelques articles divers, elle dispose aujourd'hui d'une kiosque au PK10 où elle passe la journée derrière son étalage. Ayant reçu plusieurs commandes de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour renforcer son capital et pour honorer la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. Born around 1969 in Plateau County in South Benin, Roukayathest O. married Casmir Effouyemi and has 3 children in school. She specializes in beauty products and assorted products in the PK10 neighborhood where she has her storefront. She makes an average of $20-$27 per day, and has seen her client demand increase enough to merit a loan to buy more beauty products. Née vers 1969 au Sud du Bénin dans le département du Plateau, Dame O. Roukayathest à EFFOUYEMI Casmir,mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, spécialisée dans la distribution des produits de beautés et quelques articles divers,elle dispose aujourd'hui d'une kioque au PK10 où ellle passe la journée derrière son étalage, Elle faire en moyenne par jour un chiffre d'affaire de 15000 à 20000 francs CFA,Ayant réçu plusieurs commande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour renforcer son capital et pour honnorer la demande de ses clients.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pommade and 3 cartons of soap

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza Bernadino, married and with two children, learned by herself how to become a good entrepreneur simply by risking her money for a sari-sari business (a community based variety store).  She chose to engage in this kind of business so she can still have time to keep the house clean, cook for her children and do the other household chores when there are no customers.  Her store is usually open from 6:30 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening.   
	
Flordeliza is borrowing $125 as additional working capital because she wants to buy more products like soft drinks, canned goods (meat loaf, corn beef, sardines), cooking oil, sugar, coffee and milk which are in great demand in her community.  She knows that with a variety of products to sell her income will increase and she can then support the education of her children.  At the moment, her eldest is already in college.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Born around 1963 in Mono County in South Benin, Chantal S. married Fidel Dade and is the mother of 5 children. She specializes in the sale of artisanal products such as baskets, brooms, and fans. She also sells more assorted products. She is seeking her third loan to stock up on products and fulfill the growing demand of her consumers.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Née vers 1963dans le Mono au Sud du Bénin,Dame S. Chantal est mariée à DADE Fidèl,mère de cinq enfants, elle s'est spécialisée dans la distribution des produits artisanals tèl que : les paniers ,les éventailles,les ballaie,,,;elle dispose également d'une boutique de vente de produits divers,Dame Chantal pour mieux gérer son activité consacre les wweekend à l'activité du marché et les autrs jours à célui de la boutique de maison qu'est la vente des produits artisanales,Pour renforcer son activité et faire face à la vente de fin d'année; elle sollicite son troisième crédit.

loans.use: Purchase of baskets and shelves

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Mrs. Oum P., 45, farms rice as well as raising pigs at her home for income. She has four children, all are single and live in Kompong Tom Province. Her husband, Mr. Sem Him, 47, is a local chef. He cooks for wedding parties or ceremonies at his customer's house with much experience, earning approximately US$ 5 per day.

Oum is seeking a US$ 250 loan to purchase a cow for plowing her farmland. (Oum's husband is pictured, because Oum was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase a cow for plowing

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en:
M. Sadiq lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 3 children. He is a doctor and he works part-time in his shop. He has a drug store. When he graduated from university, he opened the drug store and by this time, he has found some good numbers of customers but he wants to expand his business, therefore he needs a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 18 months to invest in more drugs for his shop and enlarge his shop to make his business stronger and support his family and make a better future for his children.

He is happy with this loan process. He would like to thank everybody who helps with this process of small loans in Afghanistan. He wants to thank Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership with this process of small loans.

loans.use: To invest in more drugs for his shop

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Mrs. Cerila T. F., is 60 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a Social Security System pensioner who is still working at the Local Government Unit as a casual municipal driver in order for them to have a sustainable living. 

Cerila's little sari-sari store (a community-based variety store)  started in the early years of their marriage. She also sells gasoline in bottles.
    
For more than a year, Cerila has been member of Paglaum MPC. She is very cooperative and helpful to her co-group members. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative because she likes the programs and services that she receives as a member. She is now requesting a loan of $300.This loan is intended for purchasing additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Cerila's ambitions and dreams for  her children have already been fulfilled as of this moment.  What she wants is to have a comfortable life,  to make her sari-sari store much more convenient and to be able to give good service to her neighbors and customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Tadogbe was born in 1961. He is married and is the father of two children, Philomène and Hubert, both in school. He buys bags of corn at the Houegbo Market to resell them in his neighborhood of Avotrou. To grow his capacity, he would like a loan to purchase more bags of corn.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Monsieur TADOGBE Joseph est né en 1961 à so- ava, marié et père de deux enfants, philomène et hubert tous deux scolarisés, il achete des sacs de mais au marché HOUEGBO pour les revendre à son domicile à avotrou.Pour accroitre sa capacité de stockage et couvrir toutes les demandes de sa clientèles il a sollicité notre concours.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of corn

loans.name: Shabana M.asghar Group

texts.en:
Shabana baji is a 35-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. A., and he is a wholesaler. He buys fruit wholesale and sells it to different fruit shops. He has been in this business for the past 8 years.

Shabana baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons are in 3rd standard. Her daughter is in kindergarten. Shabana baji has a clothes-sewing business. She charges US$ 2 per item stitched. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she will be able to sew more clothes and earn more profit.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Najma baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Riffat baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, married and with two children, learned by herself how to become a good entrepreneur simply by risking her money for a sari-sari store business (a community based variety store).  She chose to engage in this kind of business so she can still have time to keep their house clean, cook for her children and do the other household chores while there is no customer.  Her store is usually open from 6:30 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening.  She usually earns a weekly income of Php1, 0000.00. 
	
She is borrowing Php5,000 as additional working capital because she wants to buy more products like soft drinks, canned goods (meat loaf, corn beef, sardines), cooking oil, sugar, coffee and milk which are very in demand in their community.  She knows that with a variety of products to sell her income will increase and she can then support the education of their children.  At the moment, her eldest is already in college,

	According to her, clean way of living, hard work in doing whatever endeavor will result to prosperity.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Thouch

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouch P., 46, is a farmer as well as raising pigs from her home and lives in Chouksach commune, Kompong Tom Province. She cares for six children; one is married and five are still single. Her husband, Mr. Cheang Ching, is 41 years old. He is a farmer and also raises pigs with his wife.

Thouch hopes to have more piglets in her pigpen. She would like to ask for a US$ 400 loan to buy piglets to raise. The loan will increase her income to sustain her family's food.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Gilmar

texts.en:
To fulfill his dream of becoming independent, Gilmar S., at his young age of 22, decided to open his own electronic shop in his community.  He is still single but is planning to get married in the future. 

Gilmar repairs different kinds of appliances such as televisions, radios, cassette and compact disc players and other gadgets.  He always gives his best to satisfy the needs of his customers. However, his income is not enough to meet his monthly expenses including the monthly rental for his shop.  

To increase his income, he realized that he needs to buy the necessary equipment so that his customers will never have to go to other electronic shops just because he does not have the required equipment for repairing their appliances.  He believes that a loan of  $100 is enough to buy such equipment.  

Gilmar is hoping that through his dedication, hard work and perseverance, his electronic repair shop will succeed.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Melène

texts.en:
Melène W. D. D. was born on April 15, 1980 and is married to Houeto Mesmin. They have 2 children, Rodrigue, 10 years old and in the 5th graD., and Rufine, 5 years old and in kindergarten. Melène sells beauty products such as pomades, perfumes, and soaps in a little store in front of her home. She would like to purchase more soaps and pomades to satisfy her customers.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Dame W. D. D. Melène est née le 15 avril 1980, elle est mariée à monsieur mesmin HOUETO. D. cette union est sortie deux enfants Rodrigue 10 ans et en classe D. C M2 et Rufine en classe D. CI,tous à sa charge. Elle vend des produits D. beauté( pommades, lotins parfuns et des savons) dans une petite barraque construite devant son domicile. Face à la demanD. faite par ces clients, D. certains produits qu'elle n'en pas, elle s'est trouvée dans l'obligation D. faire recoursà notre institutions.

loans.use: Purchase of 8 dozen packages of soap and cartons of pomade

loans.name: Haroon

texts.en:
Haroon is a 30-year-old man who lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a car parts shop. He is a very hard worker and experienced man who has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, but now the location of his business has changed. He feels his business is little weak so he wants to enlarge this business to attract his customers back.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to enlarge his shop and complete some of his necessity materials to further his business with more success and make his business like it was in the past. He is sure that he can do it.

Haroon wants to thank everyone who helps this process and he would like to thank lenders around the world. He really appreciates this process of small loans in Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership so as to have another shop in the future.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Life is not easy for Gina L. who is engaged in a food and meat vending business.  Her daily menus are the following:  vegetables, fish, pork meat and other common delicacies.  She is married to a typical rice farmer with 9 children. Their village is relatively small where farming is the typical source of income.
		
Since her costumers like the taste of the food she sells, Gina is planning to diversify her business by cooking different types of “merienda” (the local term for snack) such as rice cakes, noodles, spaghetti and other pasta recipes. However, she does not have enough capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan of $125 to accomplish this. Moreover, in order increase her income, she also plans to have her own restaurant in their village someday.

The responsibility of raising their children and supporting their daily needs bring inspiration to Gina and her husband to work very hard.  They plan to send all their children to school and have them finish a college education.  They believe that it is the only inheritance that they can give to their children.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is very active in her community of Barangay Antagan 2nd Tumauini, Isabela.  She is serving as a Barangay Health Worker and Barangay Nutrition Scholar.  She is 29 years old and married to Jojit, a farmer and a machine operator.  They have three healthy children: John Wesley, 6 years old, a preschool student in a daycare center; Jonash, 4 years old and Mary Joy, 3 years old.  They have a happy family despite their poor life situation. 
	
Native snack vending is her main source of income.  She sells different kinds of native rice cakes and other food which are easy to prepare and very affordable.  Aside from vending, Gina is also engaged in making handicrafts. However, her income from her business is not enough to support all the needs of their family.  This is the reason why she is asking for a loan of $125. She is planning to use her loan to sell other commodities like vegetables.  She also wants to develop her skills in handicraft making so she can produce more products that she can sell.

Gina is thankful for all the financial support that the MFI is giving to her not only in improving her business but also for empowering and uplifting their lives.  

For Gina, patience and entrusting everything to God are the basic steps to achieve a successful life.

loans.use: additional capital for her vegetable vending business

loans.name: Klara

texts.en:
Klara is a small entrepreneur from Beregovo. She owns a business selling retail items like crystal, souvenirs, plastic flowers, etc. in the local marketplace called “Progress”. She has been in business for 5 years. Her net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas a month.

Klara is a serious and prudent business owner. Her perseverance, together with lending services from Nadiya Ukraine, has enabled her to gradually expand her business. Klara’s working capital has grown to 15,000 Grivnas now. Klara’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet her customers' needs have helped her keep a loyal clientele.

Klara is requesting a loan of 2,500 Grivnas to purchase an assortment of retail items in bulk to sell this holiday season. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Klara as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana sells household items in the local central market. She lives and runs her small business in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Tatyana decided to launch her first start-up over 8 years ago. Her business has been growing since then. Today she has about 50,000 Grivnas invested in her business. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnas a month. 

Reflecting on how everything started, Tatyana confesses she is very happy she took the risk and ventured into the unknown, starting her own business. Looking back, she sees all her failures and successes and feels sure all her efforts were invested in the right cause. 

Today Tatyana would love to get another small loan of 1,500 Grivnas to increase her assortment of inventory and continue expanding her business. She is hoping to repay her loan in one month.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married with one kid. This is an average family in Ordzhonikidze, however, Roman is a unique entrepreneur. He has been selling clothing and footwear in the central city market for about 3 years, running his own small venture successfully. The secret of his success is simple: he not only tries to let his buyers know the benefits of his products, but also gives them a sense of a relationship which brings clients back again and again. 

Presently, Roman has over 32,000 Grivnas of turnover capital. His monthly net profit is over 3,400 Grivnas. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is at with his venture. Roman is seeking a loan to re-stock merchandise in his kiosk for the upcoming winter season. He always says he is ready to excel to please his customers. We believe the way Roman makes his clients feel will determine his further success by encouraging new customers to buy from him.  

This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna has been running her small enterprise for about three years. Low income and desire to survive in Vinogradovo, which is a small town in Western Ukraine, motivated her to launch this venture and start selling textiles and fancy goods in a local mall. Ganna doesn’t face high competition which definitely benefits her sales. Presently, she has 45,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her monthly income is about 4,000 Grivnas.

Ganna’s business has benefited a lot from additional financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. Moreover, the favorable location of her small outlet only added to success of her trade. Ganna is very determined and hard-working. She is single and can devote much time to her enterprise. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional stock. She is hoping to repay this short-term express loan in a month.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Cada día se ocupa de la crianza de animales, y cuando se acerca la época de siembra cultiva  los productos de su zona, entonces, a la agricultura también le dedica el tiempo requerido. Son 4 años que realiza esta labor con la que se siente muy satisfecha porque le ha permitido fortalecer la economía de su familia en momentos difíciles, cuando no alcanzaba el dinero. Referente a los animales que cría, Alicia vende su carne, principalmente de oveja, llevándola a los pueblos más alejados de su localidad. De esa manera solventa la educación de sus hijos. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP y desde el primer momento no deja de cumplir con sus cuotas. Este dinero será invertido en preparación de su tierra de cultivo de papa con sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Alicia is married, and she lives with her husband and three children. She spends every day raising animals, and during the planting season she also grows local crops. Alicia has been doing this work for four years, and she's very satisfied because it allows her to strengthen her family's economic situation during hard times when money is scarce. Alicia sells the animals that she raises, primarily sheep, for their meat. She brings them to the most remote villages in the region. In this way she pays for her children's education. This is the third time that Alicia has asked for a loan with MFP and from the beginning she's never stopped working toward repayments. This money will be invested in preparing her fields with fertilizer in time for potato planting.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer to prepare her fields

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 43 años, vive con sus hijos. Ella es agricultora desde que tiene uso de razón, sus padres le enseñaron todos los conocimientos sobre esta labor que le sirven actualmente para desempeñarse en la agricultura, por ello está constante actividad, siembra trigo, papa y quinua. Una vez que termina de cosechar lleva sus productos para venderlos en el mercado principal de su ciudad, aunque los costos de transporte son elevados, Elizabeth consigue obtener las ganancias que le permiten sostener a su familia. Es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo a MFP, los que le han ayudado bastante para mejorar su economía. Esta vez invertirá en la compra de abono, y también con una parte quiere reparar parte de su casa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old, and lives with her children. She has been a farmer for as long as she can remember. Her parents taught her everything they knew about farming, and their knowledge helps her carry out her work. Elizabeth works constantly, planting wheat, potato, and quinua grains. As soon as she finishes the harvest Elizabeth brings her products to sell in the main market of the city, though transportation costs have increased. Elizabeth earns enough to sustain her family. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and her experiences have helped her significantly, enabling her to improve her economic situation. This time Elizabeth will invest in fertilizer, and also repair part of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. DesD. hace más D. 15 años trabaja en sus tierras D. cultivo, sembrando todo tipo D. productos D. su zona, también se dedica a la crianza D. animales, para los cuales prepara  cada día alimento concentrado. Sus cosechas las lleva a la feria comercial D. su ciudad para luego venderlas, generalmente son los granos D. maíz. Año tras año trabaja con mucha dedicación para que pueda tener una buena producción, D. esta manera obtiene con su trabajo, lo necesario para los gastos D. su hogar. Es la quinta vez que Julia está solicitando un préstamo en MFP. Julia solicita este dinero para invertir en la compra D. abono para sus tierras D. cultivo, ya  ha  hecho los surcos, solo falta depositar el abono y la semilla.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old, and she lives with her husband and children. She's been working as a farmer for more than 15 years, planting all types of local products. Julia also raises animals, preparing concentrated food for them every day. She brings her harvests, such as corn, to the commercial market in her city in order to sell them. Year after year Julia works with a tremendous amount of dedication so that she can have a good harvest and earn enough to cover the costs of keeping a home. This is the fifth time that Julia has asked for a loan with MFP. Julia would like this money to invest in fertilizer for her fields. She has already plowed and now she only needs to spread the fertilizer and plant the seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Liverata

texts.es: Liverata vive junto a su esposo. Ha trabajado casi toda su vida en las tareas del campo, cada día se esfuerza en alimentar a sus animales que tiene en su establo, así como en esta época de siembra, en preparar la tierra, empieza desde las primeras horas de la mañana y termina cuando anochece, todo este trabajo intenso es un gran esfuerzo físico que Liverata no escatima para poder seguir adelante. Principalmente cultiva quinua y trigo de los cuales cuando coseche podrá llevarlos al mercado a vender y verá la ganancias de su trabajo. Sabe de los riesgos que lleva el dedicarse a la agricultura, como los bajos precios de los productos, o los inesperados cambios climáticos, pero sigue adelante. Es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, y está muy satisfecha de ser clienta de esta institución. Con este dinero comprará sacos de abono, ya que en esta época de siembra está preparando sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Liverata lives with her husband. She's worked nearly all her life on a farm, and every day she works to feed her animals, and in the planting season, to prepare the land for crops. She starts in the early hours of the morning and finishes when night falls. Her work involves a lot of physical labor, but Liverata doesn't hold back because she wants to get ahead. She primarily grows quinoa and wheat, which she harvests and brings to the market to sell. Liverata knows the risks of working in agriculture, such as low prices or unexpected changes in the weather, but she perseveres. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she's very happy to be a client of that institution. With this money Liverata will buy sacks of fertilizer, as this is the time for planting and she is preparing the fields for cultivation.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Asociacion Yunguyo Group

texts.es: El grupo Asociacion Yunguyo esta representada por la señora Celia quien direge a un grupo D. 15 personas las cuales son conocidas entre si ya que residen en el mismo barrio. En su mayoria las(os) integrantes son mujeres trabajadoras que dejan el hogar para buscar mejores oportunidades para sacar adelante a su familia. Ellas(os) se dedica a diferentes cactividades como a la confeccion y elavoracion D. prendas D. vestir y calzados, al transporte publico, servicio , contruccion y comercio D. ropa, coca, comida y abarrotes. son gente responsable y con ganas D. progresar como lo demostraron en anteriores grupos en los que trabajaron con la fundacion ahora cursan su cuarto ciclo con gente nueva en el grupo pero saben que son gente responsable y que responderan a las espectativas del resto del grupo antiguo. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para sus pequemas micro empresas asi como para el incremento D. materiales para la venta y a la mejora D. alguno D. sus productos e especial para le época naviD.ña que es cuando mas productos se venden.
texts.en:
Yunguyo Association group is represented by Mrs. Celia. She leads a group of 15 members who know each other because they live in the same neighborhood. The majority of the members are working women who leave their homes to seek out better opportunities to help their families get ahead. They work in different sectors, such as baking, clothing sales, footwear sales, public transport, service sector, construction, coca sales, food sales, and grocery sales. They are responsible people with the desire to progress, as demonstrated in past work with the foundation. This is their fourth loan cycle, and they've added new people to the group. However they know that these people are responsible and they meet the expectations of the experienced members. The loan will go toward supplies, materials, and tools for these small businesses. For example, the money will buy more materials to sell and will improve some of the products, especially during the Christmas season when sales are higher.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Editza

texts.es: La Sra.  Editza M. está solicitando a AFODENIC refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), vive en la zona # 6 de la zona Ubana de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como bibliotecaria de la Univesidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea desde hace 9 años, tiene dos hijos, el niño mayor tiene 11 añitos de edad estudia su tercer grado, la niña tiene 9 años estudia tercer grado, su esposo trabaja como albañil y ayuda con los gastos del hogar ,  Editza es una mujer  con alto espiritud de superación personal, muy responsable, es una mujer que ama su trabajo,   su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la carrera de Ingenieria en Zootecnia, salud para ella y su familia, ademas anhela terminar de construir su  vivienda para así darle  mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Editza M. has asked AFODENIC to refinance her second loan to invest in home improvements (construct an additional room). She lives in the #6 zone of Nueva Guinea, and has worked in the library in the URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea University for nine years. She has two children. Her son is 11 years old and he is in the third grade. Her daughter is 9 years old and is also in the third grade. Editza's husband works as a bricklayer and helps cover the costs of keeping a home. Editza is a woman of high spirits and a desire to get ahead. She's very responsible, and loves her work. She dreams of finishing her studies as a zoologist, keeping herself and her family in good health, and finishing construction on her house in order to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Diane

texts.fr:
Madame T. Diane est née le 27 octobre 1974 à Sokodé, l’une des villes du Togo. Elle est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des chaussures, des habits et des pagnes.  Elle achète ses produits dans le grand marché de Lomé, et les revend dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville pour servir ses clients locaux. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2007.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock avec 20 paires de chaussures, 5 douzaines habits, et 10 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Ms. Diane T. was born on October 27, 1974 in Sokodé, a city in Togo. She is single and does not have any children. Her business is to sell shoes, clothes and lengths of brightly colored African cloth. She buys these items in the main market of Lomé and resells them in the Agoè district in the north of the city to serve her local clients. She began this business in 2007. This first loan that she is taking out will allow her to restock with 20 pairs of shoes, five dozen outfits, and 10 pieces of the brightly colored African cloth.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes and clothes

loans.name: Afefa Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Née le 5 janvier 1969 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo, madame L. Aféfe Kossiwa est une femme vaillante qui exerce le commerce d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Agoè, au nord de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à un militaire et mère de quatre (4) enfants.  Depuis qu’elle a commencé cette activité en 2003 elle arrive à contribuer dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de sucre, 8 sacs de riz, 12 cartons de lait, et 3 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
Born on January 5, 1969 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Mrs. Aféfe Kossiwa is a strong woman. She runs a general food store business in the Agoè district, which in the northern part of Lomé. Her husband is in the army and she has four children. After having begun this business in 2003, she is now able to help with the family’s expenses. She purchases her products in the main market of Lomé. This first loan that she is taking out will allow her to purchase 10 sacks of sugar, eight sacks of rice, 12 cartons of milk and three bottles of oil.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general food products

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr:
Madame D. Affiwa est une couturière et revendeuse de produits génériques et d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Agoè, au nord de Lomé, la ville ou elle est née le 8 mai 1970. Elle s’est mariée à un chauffeur, et ils ont quatre (4) enfants. Elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 3 bidons de huile, 2 sacs de riz, et 2 cartons de savons afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients au cours de ces périodes de fête.
texts.en:
Mrs. Affiwa D. is a dressmaker and also sells generic goods and general food products in the Agoè district, which is in the northern part of Lomé, the city where she was born on May 8, 1970. She is married to a chauffeur, and they have four children. She helps out her husband by contributing to the family expenses. This first loan that she is taking out will allow her to buy three bottles of oil, two sacks or rice, and two cartons of soap so that she can better serve her clients during the holidays.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods

loans.name: Dzigbodi

texts.fr:
Madame T. Dzigbodi est née le 8 juillet 1956 à Kpéte-Ele, une ville située à 145 Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est veuve et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité le commerce de pagne dans le marché d’Agoè au nord de Lomé.  Avec dix ans d’expérience dans le domaine, elle connait bien ce commerce.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 pièces de pagne afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients et tirer de bon revenu.
texts.en:
Ms. Dzigbodi T. was born on July 8, 1956 in Kpéte-Ele, a city that is 145 kilometers from Lomé city. She is a widow and has one child. She sells lengths of brightly colored African cloth in the Agoè market in the north of Lomé. With ten years of experience, she knows this business well. With this first loan, she will be able to purchase 10 pieces of cloth so that she can serve her clients and increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lengths of brightly colored African cloth

loans.name: Belia Esther

texts.es: Doña Belia Ester López, es casada,  tiene una pequeña pulperia , su esposo asume los gastos del hogar,  ademas de atender su negocio realiza las actividades del hogar,  solicita su 1er crédito a  AFODENIC para invertido en mejora de su vivienda y poder realizar compra de materiales de construcción como es cerámica y cambiar el piso de su casa,  ya que su mayor anhelo es de tener una vivienda digna, bonita para sus hijos, y así mejorar las condiciones de su hogar; Belia Ester tiene capacidad y voluntad de pago,  es de familia de buenas costumbre, honrada, reconocida, trabajadora, es una señora que le gusta que sus hijos vivan en buenas condiciones humanas y social, por lo tanto se  esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos menores de edad que estudian educación primaria.
texts.en:
Belia Ester López is married and has a small store. Her husband takes care of the household expenses. In addition to tending to her store, she performs the household tasks. She is requesting her first loan from AFODENIC to invest in the improvement of her house by purchasing construction materials such as ceramic to be used for the floor of her house. Her biggest desire is to have a decent house for her children in order to raise their living conditions. Belia Ester has the capacity and willingness to repay the loan; she is from a decent family, honest, recognized, hard-working. She would like her children to live with good living and social conditions, which is why she puts forth much effort to give them, who are in elementary school, a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Changing floor in house - Purchase of ceramic tiles

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Préparant les fêtes de fin d’année, madame K. Alimatou, née en 1972 à Kémérida, dans la préfecture de Binah au nord de Togo, est une revendeuse des céréales dans le marché d’Agoè, un quartier située au nord de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à un menuisier et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a ouvert un magasin pour vendre les céréales depuis 1987 ! Avec plus de vingt ans d’expérience, elle est experte dans ce commerce, et elle peut bien aider sa famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.   
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 6 sacs de riz et 3 sacs du haricot.
texts.en:
In preparation for the festivities at the end of the year, Mrs. Alimatou K. was born in 1972 in Kémérida, in the prefecture of Binah in the north of Togo. She sells cereals in the Agoè market, a district that is situated in the northern part of Lomé city. She is married to a carpenter and has five children. She opened a store to sell her goods in 1987! With more than 20 years of experience, she is an expert in this business and she can help her family by contributing to her their daily expenses. This first loan will allow her to purchase six sacks of rice and three sacks of beans.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Née le 13 avril 1956, madame K. Afiwa est une mère d’une famille de cinq (5) enfants dont le mari est un assistant d’hygiène.  En travaillant à son domicile situé à Agoè, un quartier de Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente du maïs et l’élevage des volailles.  Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2002 et ce travail lui a permit d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES et elle a bien remboursé. Avec ce second crédit, elle pourra acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de soja pour vendre et pour nourrir ses volailles.
texts.en:
Born on April 13, 1956, Ms. Afiwa K. is a mother who has a family of five children and a husband who is a health care assistant. Working in her home located in Agoè, a district of Lomé, she sells corn and raises poultry as her line of work. She started this business in 2002. It enables her to help her husband to cover family expenses. She has already benefited from a WAGES loan, which she repaid. With this second loan, she will be able to buy 15 sacks of corn and 10 sacks of soybeans to sell and to feed her fowl.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and soybeans

loans.name: Adjoa Mawulawoè

texts.fr:
Madame K. Adjoa Mawulawoè est née le 15 aout 1960 à Tsevié, une ville située à 35 km de la ville de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à un instituteur à la retraite et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a pour activité la restauration et vente des boissons, commerce qu’elle a commencé depuis l’année 2003.  Son entreprise est situe dans le marché d’Agoè, au nord de Lomé, ou elle peut trouver beaucoup de clients.  Elle s’approvisionne à la Brasserie de Lomé.
Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter toute sorte de boissons, des ignames, du riz, et des condiments pour la restauration. Avec ce crédit elle pourra bien vendre et aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Adjoa Mawulawoè K. was born on August 15, 1960 in Tsevié, a city located 35 km from the city of Lomé. The mother of five children, she is married to a retired primary school teacher. Her work has been in catering and selling beverages, a business she started in 2003. Her enterprise is situated in the Agoè marketplace, north of Lomé, where there are many customers to be found. She gets her supplies at the Brasserie de Lomé. She has never been the recipient of a loan and is requesting this initial loan to buy all sorts of beverages and yams, rice, and condiments for catering. With this loan, she will be able to do well selling and helping her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and tubers

loans.name: Binaba

texts.fr:
Née le 15 février 1982 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, madame G. Binaba s’est mariée à un commerçant et elle est mère de deux (2) enfants. En 2004 elle a ouvert son magasin ou elle vend des boissons dans le quartier Agoè au nord de Lomé.  Avec ce travail, elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour refaire son stock avec 50 casiers de bière et 30 casiers de sucreries. Ce nouveau stock lui permettra de bien vendre durant la période des fêtes en décembre.
texts.en:
Born on February 15, 1982 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Ms. Binaba G. is the mother of two and married to a shopkeeper. In 2004, she opened her store where she sells beverages in the Agoè district, north of Lomé. Through her work, she is assisting her husband greatly in covering family expenses. She is requesting this initial loan to replenish her inventory with 40 cases of beer and 30 cases of candy. This new stock will enable her to do well in her sales during the December holiday season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and candy

loans.name: Julio Alonso

texts.es: El Sr. Julio Alonso solicita su 2do refinanciamiento, para construir un dormitorio en su casa de habitación,  labora como recolector de transporte en la empresa Pedro Joaquín Chamorro, es un cliente que demostró moral, capacidad y voluntad de pago en el credito anterior, es de familia responsable reconocida en el municipio, tiene alto liderazgo, solicita que se brinde ayuda, ya que requiere de mejorar las condiciones de vivienda en la que habita, de esta forma obtener mejores condiciones de vida, solo de esta forma puede salir adelante en la construcción del dormitorio sus hijos van a tener mejor condiciones de vida y social   es un cliente trabajador le gusta superar la forma de vivir, don Julio esta  satisfecho por el servicio recibido de la institución ya que ha tenido grandes beneficio pues el credito anterior lo utilizo para realizar mejoras en su casa, por  esta razón prefiere continuar con el servicio de AFODENIC ya que le ayuda a la familia para salir adelante y desarrolla su situación socio económico.
texts.en:
Julio Alonso is requesting his second loan to build a bedroom in his house. He works as a ticket collector in the Pedro Joaquín Chamorro company. He is a client who demonstrated morals and the capacity and willingness to repay his loans with his first loan. He is from a responsible family that is known in the area. He is a leader; he is asking for help since he needs to improve his living conditions. Through the construction of a bedroom for his children they will have better living and social conditions. He is a hard-working client that would like to improve his way of life. Julio is satisfied by the service he has received from the institution since the last loan that he received was used for improvements to his house; that's why he prefers to continue with AFODENIC, since it helps his family to get ahead and develop his economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: B. Elodie

texts.fr:
Née le 22 octobre 1973 à Sante Bas dans la préfecture de Bassar au Togo, madame T. B. Elodie est une jeune fille veuve avec deux (2) enfants.  Elle a pour activité la vente du maïs et des cassettes dans le marché d’Agoè, un travail qui lui permet de soutenir ses enfants.  
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de reconstituer son stock afin de bien vendre durant la période des fêtes en décembre. Avec ce crédit, elle pourra acheter 10 sacs de maïs et 4 sacs de cassettes.
texts.en:
Born on October 22, 1973 in Sante Bas, in Bassar Prefecture in Togo, Ms. B. Elodie T. is young widow with two children. Her work, selling corn and cossettes (dried tuber chips) in the Agoè marketplace, allows her to support her children. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to replenish her inventory, so that she can do well in her sales during the December holiday season. With this loan, she will be able to buy 10 sacks of corn and 4 sacks of cossettes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam es soltera, vive con sus hermanas y su padre. Tiene más de 7 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales, principalmente ovejas, a las cuales cuida con mucho cariño. También tiene cultivos de quinua y papa, que vende en el mercado principal de la ciudad Jauja, ahora tiene planes para mejorar y producir más. Adicionalmente Miriam trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad, como asesora de  proyectos, ella es docente de profesión y lo combina con sus labores agrícolas. Es la quinta vez que Miriam solicita un préstamo en MFP, y es una de las clientes más cumplidora de su banco comunal. En esta oportunidad desea invertir en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes, a fin de preparara su tierra para la época de siembra.
texts.en:
Miriam is single and lives with her sisters and father. She has more than 7 years of experience raising animals, mainly sheep, which she raises with much care. She also has quinoa and potato crops that she sells in the main market in the city of Jauja; now she has plans to improve and produce more. Additionally, Miriam works for the municipality of her area, as a project adviser. She is a teacher by profession, which she combines with her agricultural work. This is the fifth time that Miriam is requesting a loan from MFP, and is one of the most dependable clients of her communal bank. With this loan she would like to invest in the purchase of sacs of manure and chemical fertilizer, so that she can prepare her fields for the planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacs of fertilizer

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la  agricultura, siembran de verduras, sobre todo cebolla y también tubérculos, adicionalmente cultivan alfalfa y pastizales que sirven de alimento para su ganado vacuno y ovino, de esta manera, ha podido durante estos años comprarse una casa que le permite dar comodidad a sus hijos. Hasta el momento sigue trabajando, sembrando y luego cosechando para poder vender sus productos. Es la cuarta vez que Ofelia solicita un préstamo en MFP. Con este dinero podrá  invertir en la compra de urea y pesticida para sus tierras, además de algunas ovejas.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She and her husband work in agriculture; they plant vegetables, mainly onions and tubers, as well as alfafa and grassy pastures that serve as food for their cattle and sheep. Doing this over the years they have been able to buy a house that allows them to provide comfort for their children. They continue working, planting and later harvesting to be able to sell their products. This is the fourth time that Ofelia has requested a loan from MFP. With this money she will be able to invest in the purchase of urea and pesticides for her land, as well as several sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of urea and pesticide for her crops

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca es madre de 2 hijas. Desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, posee gran cantidad de animales; como 3 vacas y varias ovejas, las cuales vende por temporadas. Aprendió también a aprovechar el excremento de la vaca para usarla como combustible cuando se seca. Rebeca vende sus productos agrícolas (cebolla, papa y habas), animales y la leche de sus vacas. Esto lo hace porque es el sostén de su  familia y sus hijas que están en edad escolar y necesita solventar sus gastos de educación. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, pero es muy recomendad por el banco comunal que la invitó. El dinero será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono para preparar sus tierras de cultivo para esta campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a mother of two daughter. For 10 years she has worked doing agriculture and livestock tasks. She has quite a few animals, 3 cows and various sheep, which she sells for seasonal use. She also learn to take advantage of the cow excrement to use as fuel when dried. Rebeca sells her agricultural products (onions, potatoes, and broad beans), animals and her cow's milk. She does all of this because she is the financial support of her family and for her children, whom are school aged and have educational expenses. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with MFP, but she is highly recommended by the communal bank that invited her. The money will be invested in the purchase of natural fertilizer to prepare her crop land for the upcoming planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural fertilizer for her crop land

loans.name: Betty Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Betty S., tiene un anaquel D. golosinas, en el centro D. la ciudad, desD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana, se instala en su puesto D. venta y trabaja allí hasta finalizado el día, su anaquel esta muy bien surtido y el préstamo que solicita servira para adquirir mercadería relacionada con las fiestas D. fin D. año.
La señora tiene tres niños, dos D. los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposo también colabora económicamente al presupuesto familiar y ambos se apoyan para llegar a realizar sus metas familiares.
La cliente se encuentra en su tercer crédito con la institución, demostrando bastante responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Betty S. has a booth selling sweets in the city center. From the early morning hours, she sets up in her booth and works all day. Her booth is well stocked and the loan that she is requesting will be used to acquire merchandise associated with the year-end celebrations. She has three children, two of whom are school aged. Her husband also provides economic support for the family budget and both help each other to realize the family's goals. This is her third loan with the institution and has demonstrated quite a bit of responsibility in repaying her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.es: Rosabel tiene 42 años, vive  con sus hijos. Calcula que ya hace 5 años tiene una pequeña su tienda, empezó en este negocio porque necesitaba de más ingresos para educar a sus hijos, es si que inició con poco capital y con mucho esfuerzo pudo incrementar su mercadería. Luego, pudo trasladar su bodega a un local más amplio, donde abastece  a sus vecinos de los productos principales de pan llevar. Rosabel trabaja denodadamente para seguir creciendo, aunque sabe que esto le tomará tiempo, atención y dinero, lo viene asumiendo con muchos retos para su futuro. Es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, durante todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una de las más puntuales para devolver el dinero. Esta vez invertirá en la compra de mercadería, implementara su tienda con productos de limpieza personal, de belleza, detalles para regalos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosabel is 42 years old and lives with her children. She estimates that she has already had her small store for 5 years. She started this business because she needed more income to educate her children. As such, she started with a little money and a lot of effort and was able to increase her merchandise. Later, she was able to move her store to a larger location, where she supplies her neighbors with basic products and produce. Rosabel works tirelessly to continue growing, although she knows that this will take time, focus, and money, and she has come to take on many challenges for the future. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan with MFP. During all this time she has demonstrated that she is one of the most punctual in paying back the money. This time she will invest in buying merchandise, stocking her store with personal hygiene products, beauty products, and little gifts, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma vive con su esposo y uno D. sus hijos. Tiene una amplia trayectoria en las tareas del campo, cría vacas y ovejas, como también cultiva papa y otros productos D. su zona, con lo que ha sostenido el gasto D. su familia, en especial D. sus 4 hijos, D. los cuales el menor sigue todavía con ellos, ahora su meta es que su último hijo sea cocinero profesional, y ya está próximo a culminar sus estudios, esto le da más fuerzas a Vilma D. continuar trabajando en el campo, el cual requiere D. gran esfuerzo físico. Durante las últimas semanas se ha dedicado a seleccionar cuidadosamente las semillas, porque D. ello dependerá la ganancia en su cosecha. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, ella fue recomendada para formar  parte D. su banco comunal. Vilma solicita este dinero para comprar 2 sacos D. abono para preparar su tierra D. cultivo.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her husband and one of her children. She has significant background in agricultural activities, raising raises cows and sheep as well as growing potatoes and other local products with which she has sustained the family's expenses, especially those of her 4 children, the youngest of whom still lives with them. Now her goal is for her youngest son to become a professional cook, and now that he is close to finishing his studies, this gives more motivation to Vilma to continue working in agriculture, which requires a great physical effort. During the last weeks she has worked carefully selecting the seeds because the earnings from her harvest will depend on this. It is the first time that she has applied for a loan in MFP. She was recommended to join her communal bank. Vilma requests this money to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer to prepare her land for cultivation.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Desde hace más de 15 años se dedica al bordado, todo comenzó por curiosidad y le terminó gustando realizar este arte, el que aplica más en los trajes típicos de su zona, elabora bellos bordados, teniendo un buen criterio en el uso de los colores. Por la calidad de los trabajos que ofrece, ha adquirido más clientela, que siempre la recomiendan. Su negocio, es para ella, su pequeña empresa, inclusive tiene tarjeta de presentación para adquirir nuevos clientes. Yanina tiene ahora mayores expectativas para ser mejor. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, reconoce que el préstamo que recibe le sirve mucho en su trabajo, y por la puntualidad en sus pagos ha sido aceptada para renovar un ciclo más de préstamo. Yanina solicita este dinero para comprar hilos de variados colores, los más costosos suelen ser el dorado y el plateado.
texts.en:
Yanina is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children. For more than 15 years she has worked doing embroidery. Everything began with curiosity and she ended up liking this art, which she applies on the typical clothing of the area, makes beautiful embroidery and has a good judgement in the use of the colors. Because of the quality of the work that she offers, she has acquired more clientele as they always recommend her. Her business is for her a small enterprise and she even has a business card to acquire new clients. Yanina now has greater expectations to improve. It is the second time that she is applying for a loan in MFP. She recognizes that the loan that she receives will help her very much in her work and due to the punctuality of her payments she has been accepted to renew another loan cycle. Yanina is requesting this money to buy thread of various colors, the most expensive ones are usually gold and silver.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase thread of different types and colors

loans.name: Elizabeth Genoveva

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth C., es madre soltera, tiene un niño, y es ella quien se encarga de su cuidado y mantención, la actividad que desarrolla es la venta de comida rápida en un pequeño local de la zona de Miraflores, un barrio residencial de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, lugar donde ya tiene clientela. Con mucho esfuerzo adquirió una movilidad para hacerla trabajar de taxi, para lo cual requiere comprar una radio de comunicaciónes, esta movilidad está bajo el cuidado de su hermano quien es el coductor y recibe una renta por su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth C. is a single mother, has a child, and she is in charge of caring for and supporting him. The activity that she develops in the sale of fast food in a small locale in the Miraflores zone, a residential neighborhood in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, a place where she already has a clientele. With much hard work she acquired a vehicle to make it work as a taxi, for which she needs to buy a communication radio. This vehicle in under the care of her brother who is the driver and receivesa payment for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a Communication Radio

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La señora Nieves C. es cliente antigua de la institución, es bastante cumplida y trabajadora.Se dedica a la venta de comida en su zona, recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda en la preparación de los alimentos y en su  venta. Con la compra de una licuadora y un horno, la señora  en alguna medida mejorará sus ingresos pues ampliará su gama de productos, se debe mencionar que es una familia muy unida y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nieves C. is an old client of the institution and she is very reliable and hard working. She works selling food in her neighborhood and she receives support from her husband who helps her in the preparation of the food and its sale. With the purchase of a blender and an oven she will improve her income as she will increase her range of products. It should be mentioned that it is a very united family and responsible in making payments.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an oven, blender and groceries

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga M., tiene 43 años de edad, desde hace 18 años que se dedica al comercio; hasta hace dos años aproximadamente vendía golosinas, refrescos, cigarrillos, etc. en un puesto ubicado en la calle 21 de la zona de San Miguel, pero por razones de salud, tuvieron que intervenirla quirúrgicamente, cediendo el puesto a un familiar, quien le paga un alquiler mensual.
Actualmente la Sra. Olga se dedica a traer productos alimenticios como tunta, ají, condimentos y artículos de cocina en general, que vende y reparte por la zona sur, una zona residencial de la ciudad de La Paz, con  ayuda de su hija menor. El esposo Don Nicanor trabaja como chofer asalariado, con sus ahorros y créditos pudieron adquirir un pequeño terreno en el cual construyeron su vivienda actual.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga M. is 43 years old and for the past 18 years she has worked in commerce. Since approximately two years ago she has sold sweets, soft drinks, cigarettes, etc. in a stand located in 21st Street in the San Miguel zone. But for health reasons she had to have surgery, yielding the stand to a relative who pays her a monthly rent. Currently Olga works bringing food products like dehydrated potatoes, peppers, condiments and general kitchen supplies which she sells and distributes in the southern zone, a residential area in the city of La Paz, with the help of a younger daughter. Her husband Nicanor works as a self-employed driver and with their savings and loans they could acquire a small piece of land in which they constructed their current house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Kossi est né le 7 février 1975 à Tchekpo dedekpoe, une des villes du Togo.  Il est célibataire et il n’a pas d’enfant.  Il est chauffeur à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2000 et il a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine. 
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter un autre bus.  Avec ce nouveau véhicule il pourra mieux servir ses passagers et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Kossi A. was born on Februrary 7, 1975 in Tchekpo Dedekpoe, a city in Togo. Unmarried and without children, he is a chauffeur in Agoè, a district north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. He started this business in 2000 and has a lot of experience in this field. The initial loan he is requesting will enable him to buy another bus. With this new vehicle, he'll be able to serve his passengers better and to realize a large profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bus

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Dame D. Akossiwa est née le 21 mars 1976 à Tsévié ville située à 35 km de la capitale du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle a pour activité la vente des pagnes dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2001 et maîtrise bien ce métier.
Elle a toujours obtenu des crédits au près de WAGES et se comporte toujours bien dans le remboursement.
Ce Sixième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 pièces de pagne de marque phoénix afin de bien vendre pendant la période des fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa D. was born on March 21, 1976 in Tsévié, a town situated 35 km from the capital of Togo. She is married and the mother of 4 children who are all enrolled in school. Her business is selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly patterned African cloth used as clothing, turbans, and to carry babies) in the Agoè neighborhood. She began this business back in 2001 and has a lot of experience in it.

She has been receiving loans through WAGES and has always reimbursed them correctly. This sixth loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 30 lengths of Phoénix brand "pagnes" to be sold during the period of end-of-year festivities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Dzigbodi Mawéna

texts.fr:
Madame N. Dzigbodi Mawéna est née le 24 décembre 1953 à Atakpamé ville située à 165 Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de consommation courante et de pagne dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2007.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des pagnes pour une valeur de 100.000FCFA et des produits de consommation courante pour une valeur de 200.000FCFA
texts.en:
Mrs. Dzigbodi Mawéna N. was born on December 24, 1953 in Atakpamé, a town situated 165 km from the town of Lomé (the capital of Togo). She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her principle business is selling food staples and "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African cloth used as clothing, turbans, and to carry babies) in the Agoè neighborhood north of Lomé. She buys her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé and began her business in the year 2007.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 100,000 F CFA worth of "pagnes" and 200,000 F CFA worth of food staples.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Née en 1960 au Ghana,  pays situé au coté ouest du Togo, Madame D. Rose est mariée et mère d’une grande famille de six (6) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce des produits médicamenteux, d’ustensiles et divers dans son quartier, au nord de Lomé. Avec presque dix ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, elle n’a jamais reçu un crédit au près de WAGES.  
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des médicaments, des ustensiles, et de divers pour reconstituer son stock afin de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Ghana, a country situated on the west side of Togo, Mrs. Rose D. is married and the mother of a big family of 6 children. She sells medicines, utensils, and various other items in her neighborhood north of Lomé. With almost 10 years of experience in this business, she has never received a loan from WAGES.

She is requesting this first loan to buy medicines, utensils, and various other items to bolster her inventory so that she can make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of medicines, utensils and various other items for re-sale

loans.name: El Condor Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal El Condor está formado por 10 clientes, pertenece a la zona D. San Pedro, una zona populosa D. la ciudad D. La Paz. El Banco surge gracias al emprendimiento D. la familia S., quienes se dedican al comercio.
Eva Q.  es la líder del grupo desD. sus inicios, tiene un pequeño puesto D. venta en el mercado D. la Zona, se dedica a la venta D. comida. Ella vive en la ciudad D. El Alto, Bolivia, pero todos los días empieza su jornada desD. tempranas horas D. la mañana  preparando la comida que va a vender durante el día, luego viaja a la ciudad D. La Paz y se instala muy temprano en su puesto D. trabajo, La meta D. la señora Eva es sacar adelante a sus hijos, mejorar su calidad D. vida y su negocio. 
El Señor Felipe S., es el tesorero del grupo es uno D. los integrantes varones del grupo se dedica a la venta D. repuestos en la misma zona, D. San pedro, vive con su mamá y sus sobrinos a los cuales mantiene con su negocio. 
Lourdes es la Secretaria D. Actas es una señora trabajadora que venD. todo tipo D. productos D. temporada ya sea chompas, juguetes etc. Tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar el esposo le ayuda con mantención del hogar, y con los estudios y cuidados D. los hijos.
Es un grupo bastante solidario que al momento no presentan problemas D. pago ya que se encuentran en su 4to crédito.
texts.en:
El Condor Communal Bank is maD. up of 10 clients and is located in the San Pedro zone, a populous area in the city of La Paz. The bank arose thanks to the entrepreneurship of the S. family, who work in commerce. Eva Q. has been the leader of the group since its beginnings. She has a small stand in the local market where she sells food. She lives in the city of El Alto, Bolivia, but everyday she starts her work from the early hours of the morning preparing food that she is going to sell during the day. Then she travels to the city of La Paz and sets up her work stand very early. Eva's goal is for her children to advance and to improve her quality of life and business. Mr. Felipe S., the treasurer of the group and one of the male group members, work selling auto parts in the same neighborhood of San Pedro. He lives with his mother and his neices and nephews who he supports with his business. Lourdes, the secretary, is a hardworking woman who sells all types of seasonal products such as sweaters, toys, etc. She has 2 children who are school aged. Her husband helps her with the household expenses, with their studies and to care for the children. It is a group with a lot of solidarity that at the moment does not have any repayment problems as they are already on their 4th loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Balkiesa

texts.fr:
Né en 1982, dame M. Balkiesa est une femme divorcée et a un enfant. 
Elle est une femme vaillante et fait le commerce de produits de beauté et de prêt-à-porter dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. 
Cette activité qu’elle a commencé depuis 2003 marche très bien pour lui et elle désire prendre ce premier crédit pour acheter 20 habits de nouveau model afin de pouvoir bien vendre durant la période des fêtes.
texts.en:
Born in 1982, Ms. Balkiesa M. is a divorced woman with one child. This is a courageous woman who does commerce in beauty products and in ready-to-wear clothing in the Agoè district of Lomé. Her business, which she started in 2003, is going very well for her. She would like to use this initial loan to buy 20 new-style outfits in order to do well in her sales during the holiday season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy outfits and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Egnonam Afi

texts.fr:
Madame T. Egnonam Afi est née en 1981 à Ganavé, une des villes du Togo. Elle s’est mariée avec un mécanicien moto et ils ont deux (2) enfants. Depuis l’année passée, elle exerce le commerce des produits pharmaceutiques au marché d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle soutient ses enfants et paye les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter divers produits et différents produits pharmaceutiques.
texts.en:
Ms. Egnonam Afi T. was born in 1981 in Ganavé, a city in Togo. She is married to a motorbike mechanic, and they have two children. Since last year, she has been doing commerce in pharmaceuticals in the Agoè marketplace. With the income from this business, she supports her children and covers family expenses. Currently, her inventory is depleted, and she would like to get supplies. For this, she is requesting this initial loan to buy various good and different pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods and different pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr:
Madame A. P. Olga est née le 15 juillet en 1980 à Teheriba, une ville au Togo. Cette jeune fille est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfants.  Elle a pour activité, la vente de graviers dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006, quand elle avait vingt-six ans.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 14 camions de graviers afin de mieux servir les clients.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Olga A. was born on July 15, 1980 in Teheriba, a city in Togo. This young woman is unmarried and has no children. She works selling gravel in the Agoè district north of Lomé. She started this business in 2006 when she was 26 years old. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 14 truck-loads of gravel to serve her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gravel

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Héctor Manuel Batz de 34 años de edad,  Casado de oficios Comerciante, “Confección de playeras” cuenta con un taller de 4 Maquinas,  habita conjuntamente con su Esposa y sus hijos, cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad, desde su juventud se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los Préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la Confección de Playeras para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejor condición de vida a su familia. Tales como los estudios de sus hijos y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor Manuel Batz is 34 years old and is a merchant who makes woven shoes. He has a workshop with 4 machines and lives with his wife and children. They have three employees. Since his youth, he has worked in crafts; thanks to the loans he was able to take his family forward. In his home in Paraje Chichaclan of Cantón Paquí in town and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala he is a very well-known person. He asked for a loan from Asociación Asdir so that he can purchase the raw materials for the production of woven shoes to provide for and to be able to meet the demand of his clients. In this way, he will be able to improve his family’s life by earning more money and provided for his children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (To increase capital)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes cloth and various goods

loans.name: Biova Hervé
