texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Bioava Hervé est né en 1985. Il est un jeune célibataire avec plein d’énergie pour travailler. Depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs d’écoles il est rentré dans le commerce de portable dans son quartier.
Il a commencé cette activité en 2007 et a déjà des clients potentiels.
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de faire le stock pour pouvoir bien vendre et tirer de bon bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mr. Bioava Hervé A. was born in 1985. He is young, unmarried, and full of energy for work. Since he quit school, he has been doing commerce in mobile phones in his neighborhood. He started this business in 2006 and already has potential customers. This initial loan he is requesting will enable him to build an inventory to do well in his sales and to derive a good profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell mobile phones

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.en:
Geneviève A. was born on September 30, 1973 in Cotonou. Originally from Abomey, she is married and has one child, Aurelle, who is 12 years old and in school. Geneviève went to school through junior year of high school and then went to beauty school for three years. She has owned her own beauty salon since 1999 and has many assistants to help her. She also sells beauty accessories, hair locks, and other assorted hair products. With this loan, she would like to buy more locks of hair and beauty products.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Dame A. Geneviève est née le 30/09/1973 à Cotonou. Originaire d'Abomey, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant ( Aurelle âgée de 12 ans et scolarisée). Elle a fréguentée jusqu'à en classe de 4eme, ensuite elle a reçut une formation en coiffure pendant trois ans . Aujourd'hui elle est gère son propre salon de coiffure depuis 1999 avec plusieurs apprentis qui l'aide dans son activité. Elle vend accessoirement les produits de beauté, les mèches et autres divers articles liés à son métier. La demande de ses clients étant devenue très forte, elle a sollicité son deuxième prêt pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: 6 dozen locks of hair, cartons of hairsprays and assorted products

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr:
Madame A. Akoko est née le 12 octobre 1969 à Tsévié localité située à 35 Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des pagnes qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé.
Avec le revenu de cette activité qu’elle a commencé en 1997 elle arrive à aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
A l’approche de ces fêtes de fin d’années elle désire augmenter son stock afin de pouvoir bien vendre a cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagne.
texts.en:
Ms. Akoko A. was born on October 12, 1969 in Tsévié, a town located 35 km from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children, who all go to school. She works principally in selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) that she buys at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Using the income from her business, which she started in 1997, she manages to assist her husband with family expenses. With the coming year-end holidays, she would like to increase her inventory in order to do well in her sales. For this, she is requesting this initial loan to buy 15 lengths of pagne cloth.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
A. Akossiwa est une jeune fille célibataire âgée de 26 ans. Elle a pour activité la vente des ustensiles en plastiques et des verres à boire. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana où les articles sont vendus à un prix réduit.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons d’ustensiles de cuisine et des glacières.
texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa A., age 26, is young and unmarried. Her work involves selling plastic utensils and drinking glasses. She gets her supplies in Ghana, where goods are sold at a reduced price. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 5 boxes of kitchen utensils and some insulated coolers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic utensils

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
S. Akouvi est née le 31 décembre 1975 à Zowoula dans la préfecture des Lacs. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Elle a pour activité la vente de pagne et de mèche dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de  la ville de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 pièces de pagne et des mèches afin de pouvoir bien vendre pendant les fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Ms. Akouvi S. was born on December 31, 1975 in Zowoula, in Lacs Prefecture. She is unmarried and has a child in her care. She works selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and hair extensions in the Agoè district north of the city of Lomé. She gets her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 5 lengths of pagnes and some hair extensions in order to do well in her sales during the year-end festivals.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" and hair extensions

loans.name: Houénafa

texts.en:
Houénafa H. is 35 years old and originally from Calavi. She was raised by her stepmother for 20 years, and helped her to run her boutique. She started her own account and began to sell fresh fish in the Zogbo Market. For the past 5 years, she has sold traditional food such as akassa, pate, and rice (traditional carbohydrate staples) to elementary school children. She also sells local Sodabi liquor at her house. This is her fourth loan to buy more flour, oil, and liquor for her businesses.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Dame H. Houénafa est âgée de 35 ans et originaire de Calavi. Elle a été élevée par sa marâtre pendant une vingtaine d'années, elle aidait celle-ci à vendre dans une boutique divers articles et des condiments. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte et avait débuté par la vente des poissons fris dans le grand marché de Zogbo. Depuis 05 ans, elle vend de la nourriture ( akassa, riz, paté ) aux enfants d'une école primaire de la place et de la boisson forte traditionnelle apellée "SODABI" à la maison. C'est dans le souci de renforcer son activité qu'elle a sollicité ce 4 eme prêt qui servira à l'achat des sacs de maïs , de farine de blé et des bidons d'huile

loans.use: Purchase of 1 bag of corn, one bag of wheat flour, one oil drum, one drum of Beninese liquor, and other assorted products

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is forty-six years old. She is married with four kids:  one of them successfully completed high school; and the other three are still in school. Cecilia enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her kids. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. However, her progress level is low because of inadequate working capital. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increased her profits. She hopes to increase her savings to push the dream of her kids’ education through to completion. She is a member of the community group called ‘Nnowm’ (Song) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Renacer Ingenio Group

texts.es: El grupo “Renacer Ingenio” esta representado por la señora Mónica que se dedica  a la venta D. tenis, existe parentescos familiares entre la señora Mary Lourdes,Marilin y Adelia pero cada una tiene independencia economica por lo que el grupo no tiene mayores contratiempos. Una mayoría D. los socios (as) se dedica al comercio los cuales venden comida, celulares, electrodoméstico, ropa a la confesión D. polleras, chamarras y zapatos. Cada uno es conciente D. la competencia que existe en el mercado D. compra y venta pero los años que tienen D. experiencia en el rubro les permite decir que son capaces D. pagar sus cuentas con puntualidad dy responsabilidad. El financiamiento esta destina a la adquisición D. mercadería para la venta así como a la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para sus pequeños negocios. Son gente que tiene experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con grupos anteriores, demostrando honestidad y puntualidad en los pagos.
texts.en:
The group “Renacer Ingenio” (“Reborn Ingenuity”) is represented by Mrs. Mónica, who sells tennis shoes. Mrs. Mary Lourdes Marilin and Adelia are relatives, but each one has her own business, so that the group doesn’t have bigger problems. Most of the members are involved in businesses that sell food, cell phones, electric appliances, clothes for confession, including skirts, jackets, and shoes. Each one is conscious of the competition that exists in the market, but the years of experience they have in the field allow them to know that they are capable of paying their repayments punctually and responsibly. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise to sell, such as supplies, materials, and tools for their small businesses. They have experience in working in mutually binding groups since they have worked with groups before. They have demonstrated honesty and punctuality in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 and has been working in Accra central market since she was 25. Her experience in the market has made her one of the more successful traders. Esther buys clothing materials, laced clothes, and ladies shoes at wholesale prices, and distributes it personally to various stalls inside the market. She is married with two kids, a boy and a girl, currently in school. Her hard work means so much to the family since it contributes to the payment of utility bills, education fees, and food bills. 

Esther would like to distribute higher quality products, but will need a loan to do so. With the loan, she wishes to purchase more yards of laced cloth, ladies shoes, and materials. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to own her own stall inside the market. She is a member of the trust group called “Nnowm” (meaning, song). Members in this group provide support to one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more yards of laced cloth, ladies shoes, and materials.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 39 year old business woman. She is married with two kids who are currently in school. She has been a seamstress for seven years. She sews all forms of female clothes with various kinds of styles that suit the tastes of her customers like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, etc. She also sells food stuffs to support her family with additional income. With the loan, she wants to buy more supplies for sewing like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to double her savings to provide her children with quality educations. She is a member of the community group called “Nnown” (meaning, song) Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Grupo “Renacer” esta representado por la señora Regina. En su mayoría los socios (as) se dedican a la venta D. comida en snacks o en pequeños puesto D. venta, también a la venta y elaboración D. pan, cosméticos por catalogo y los varones se dedican al transporte público. Son gente honesta y trabajadora que se conocen D. tiempo ya que residen en el mismo barrio, en general conocen del trabajo en grupos solidarios porque participaron en grupos anteriores en la Fundación y saben D. la responsabilidad que implica los pagos y puntualidad D. los mismos. El dinero financiado servirá para la compra D. insumos y materiales así como para el crecimiento D. sus puestos D. venta D. comida y para la reparación D. los vehículos que son las herramientas D. trabajo D. los socios. Los socios (as) se encuentras esperanzados ya que este dinero les servirá para incrementar los ingresos y para cumplir mejor sus metas y enfrentar las dificultades del día a día.
texts.en:
Group “To Revive” is represented by Mrs. Regina. Most of the members sell food in snacks or in small stands. They also sell and make bread, sell cosmetics through a catalogue, and the men work in public transport. They are honest and hard-working people that have gotten to know each other over time since they live in the same neighborhood. In general, they know how to work in mutually binding groups because they have participated in groups before with the Fundación and they know the responsibility and punctuality associated with the payments. The money loaned will serve to buy supplies and materials as well as for the growth of their food stands and for the maintenance of the vehicles that are their tools for work. The members are hoping that this money will help them increase their income, reach their goals and face day-to-day difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise capital

loans.name: Rudy Baldomero

texts.es: El Señor Rudy Mejía de 20 años de edad,  casado de oficios Comerciante, “Confección de Playeras Típicas” cuenta con un taller de 4 Maquinas,  habita conjuntamente con su esposa y un hijo, cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los  conocimientos que sus padres le dieron y con los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chisay del Cantón Nimapa del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y activo para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rudy Mejía is 20 years old and makes traditional woven shoes. He lives with his wife and son. He has a workshop with 4 machines, and has three employees. Since his childhood, he has worked with crafts thanks to the knowledge his parents gave him. With the loans, he will be able to take his family forward. In his home in Paraje Chisay in Cantón Nimapa in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, he is a well-known person. He is requesting a loan from Asociación Asdir so that he can buy raw materials and assets for his craft so that he can provide far and meet the demand of his clients. In this way, he will be able to improve his family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (To increase capital)

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Ángela C. se dedica con mucho ahínco al negocio de venta de artículos plásticos los cuales comercializa en su propio tramo donde atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos en edades escolares. Es por este motivo que se esfuerza grandemente para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. 
Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los artículos plásticos con el propósito de comercializarlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Ángela C. eagerly sells plastic products, which she markets in her own section where she works every day, starting very early in the morning.

She is a single woman and is responsible for taking care of her three small children, who are in school. Because of this, she works very hard to offer her children the conditions necessary for their development. At this time, she is looking for the support of Ceprodel to get a loan so that she can buy plastic goods with the goal of selling them in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo A. tiene la edad de 48 años habita en San José los Ríos ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa Y hijos, la esposa de este señor trabaja como comerciante en el mercado Oriental, para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, al igual sus hijos le apoyan a la mamá y a él para no pagar personal que le ayuden a la agricultura. Don Juan trabaja como agricultor desde hace 25 años, sus planes para un futuro es llegar a comprar mas terreno para establecer mas cultivos y darle a cada uno de sus hijos la herencia. La mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 9,000.00 córdobas para comprar fertilizantes y venenos para aplicárselo al cultivo para que de buenos frutos y a si tener una buena cosecha, como una buena venta de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Pablo A. is 48 years old and lives in San José los Rios, which is in the municipality of Ticuantepe, with his wife and children. His wife works as a merchant in the Oriental market to help with the household expenses. Also, the children support their mother and help with the agriculture. Mr. Juan has been a farmer for 25 years. His plans for the future are to buy more land to plant more crops and to give each of his children an inheritance. His biggest problem is a lack of financing. He is requesting a loan of C$ 9,000.00 córdobas to buy fertilizers and poisons to apply to his crops so that he will have a good yield and, thus, have a good harvest, like a good sale of fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poisons and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Señora Juana B. de 54 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Domésticos, “Elaboración de canastas Plásticas” cuenta con un pequeño Taller,  habita conjuntamente con su Esposo y sus hijos, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los Préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chosamiel del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la Elaboración de canastas Plásticas para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Juana B. is a 54-year-old married homemaker. She has a small workshop to weave plastic baskets and lives with her husband and children whom she also counts on as employees. Since childhood, she has done crafts. She is thankful for the loan so that she can lead her family forward. She is well-known, and her residence is in the Paraje Chosamiel del Cantón Juchanep in the city and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. She has come to ask Asociación Asdir for financing the purchase of raw materials for basket weaving to facilitate and meet the demand of her customers, and thus have the opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for basket weaving

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
Su nombre es Juana Mercedes M. J. tiene la edad de 54 años, su estado civil es casado esta Señora Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 1 de sus hijas dependen de ella, esta una adolescente de nombre Mercedes  quien tiene la edad de 20 años y esta cursando el 4 año de farmacia, su compañero de vida labora como agricultor, sus deseos son de darle a sus hijos casa donde ellos puedan vivir seguros y tranquilos, dentro de sus propósitos esta el realizar mejora a su establecimiento por lo que espera que pueda realizarlos.



La actividad económica de Doña Juana es la venta de calzado, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 30 años, Doña Juana inicia con la venta de granos básicos en lo que vendía los siguientes productos: arroz, aceite, azúcar y frijoles pero no pudo continuar este negocio por los motivos políticos y fracaso en este negocio mas tarde decide implementar la venta de ropa en la que vendía pantalones, camisas y faldas este negocio no le genero muchos ingresos por lo que en aquella época no había variedad en productos y finalmente se dedica a su negocio de la venta de calzado que es en lo que labora actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita viajar hasta Managua para realizar las compras de los zapatos deportivos ya que la compra de sandalias las realiza en Masaya.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes M. J. is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Her youngest daughter, Mercedes, 20 years old and in her fourth year of pharmacy school, still depends on her financially. Her husband is a farmer. Her dream is to provide a safe and peaceful home for her children. To accomplish this, Juana wants to further develop her business. For thirty years, Juana has sold shoes. She began her business selling staple grains and proceeded to sell rice, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. Her first business failed due to political instability. Later, she decided to sell clothing and she sold pants, shirts, and skirts, but this was not very profitable because at that time there was not a variety of products available. Finally, she began selling shoes and that is what she does today. This loan is for working capital that she needs to travel to Managua to buy sneakers, as she is able to buy sandals in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Johana del Carmen L. tiene la edad de 32 años habita en San José La Concepción, junto a su esposo Y hija, el esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y le apoya con la finca, ella trabaja como comerciante y a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, con sus propios esfuerzos y de  su esposo han logrado establecer un tramo de frutas y verduras. La mayor dificultad que  ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento, sus planes para un futuro es llegar a tener un gran puesto de víveres  para darle una mejor condición de vida a su pequeña hija que apenas tiene dos añitos de edad. Ella solicita la cantidad de C$ 3,000.00 córdobas para compra más fertilizante para mejorar el cultivo y así producir hermosos y ricos frutos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Johana del Carmen L. is 32 years old and lives in San José La Concepción, together with her husband and daughter. Her husband works as a security guard and supports the farm, while she works as a trader and at times works with the agriculture. Through her and her husband’s efforts, they have managed to establish a section of fruits and vegetables. The greatest difficulty she has had is a lack of financing. Her plans for the future are to have a great job to provide her young daughter, who is barely two years old, with a better living condition. She requests the amount of C$ 3000.00 córdobas to buy more fertilizer in order to improve her crop so that she can produce beautiful and rich fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Ofelia Marina

texts.es: La Señora Ofelia B. de 38 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Delantales Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño Taller, de Tres máquinas  habita conjuntamente con sus hijos, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los Préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Choescuela del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la Confección de Delantales Típicos para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Y poderles darles educación para cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Ofelia B. is a 38-year-old married seamstress. She has a small workshop with three machines to make aprons for women. She lives with her children whom she also counts on as employees. Since childhood, she has been engaged in crafts. She is thankful for the loans so that she may lead her family forward. She is well-known, and her residence is in Paraje Choescuela Canton Juchanep in the municipality and department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. She has come to ask Association Asdir for financing the purchase of raw materials for making aprons to facilitate and to meet the demand of her customers and thus be able to provide improved living conditions for her family. She also wants to give an education to each of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making aprons

loans.name: Lidia Candelaria

texts.es: La Señora Lidia S. de 27 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Compra y Venta de Ropa de vestir” cuenta con un pequeño Negocio,  habita conjuntamente con su esposo e hijos,  desde tres años se dedica al comercio gracias a los Préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Choescuela del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra y venta de Ropa de Vestir para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejore condiciones de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Señora Lidia S. is a 27-year-old married weaver. She has a small business buying and selling clothing. She lives with her husband and children. For three years, she has been a wholesalerthanks to the loans which allow her to carry her family forward. She is well-known and lives in Paraje Choescuela Canton Juchanep in the city and department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. She has come to ask Association Asdir for financing the purchase and sale of clothing to facilitate and to meet the demand of her customers and thus have the opportunity to provide improved living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Fanny Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora Fanny A. vive en la zona las Lomas, D. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia, es propietaria D. un pequeño taller en el que se fabrican moldes D. hojalata, dicho taller esta instalado en el domicilio D. la señora. 
La señora Fany realiza moldes para tortas, en diferentes formas (corazones, personajes, etc.), además la señora realiza artesanías como ser: lámparas en miniatura para las ferias además D. moldes para la elaboración D. galletas, todo el trabajo lo realiza en hojalata (lata).
El préstamo solicitado servirá para la compra D. material como ser: hojalata, vidrio, y otros accesorios para la elaboración D. estos materiales. Le colabora su esposo con los gastos D. la casa, y ademas le ayuda en la elaboración D. estos accesorios.
texts.en:
Señora Fanny A. lives in the neighborhood of Lomas in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She owns a small workshop in which she makes molds of tin. This workshop is set up in her home. Señora Fanny makes molds for cakes in different shapes (hearts, characters, etc.). In addition, she makes crafts such as miniature lamps for fairs, as well as molds for biscuits. All of her work is down in tinplate. The loan will be used toward the purchase of equipment, such as a tin, glass, and other parts for the manufacture of these materials. She collaborates with her husband to pay living expenses and also assists in the development of these accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to create tin molds

loans.name: Angel Benito

texts.es:
El Señor Angel Benito P. V. es choofer propietario de un minibus de 15 pasajeros que funciona con gasolina y gas natural, trabaja en el sindicato de minibuses Eduardo Avaroa que realiza el recorrido desde la zona central hasta una zona periurbana de la ciudad. El señor Angel empezó trabajando como chofer asalariado y con muchio esfuerzo y en compania de su esposa llegaron ahorrar lo suficientepara comprar su propia movilidad. Este es su primer prestamo el cual lo invertira en la compra de llantas y para realizar el mantenimiento de la movilidad.			
Vive en casa familiar y ayuda con los gastos de la casa cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien le ayuda tambien con los gastos familiares y a mejorar cada vez más.
texts.en:
Señor Angel Benito P. V. is the driver and owner of a minibus of 15 passengers that run on gas and natural gas. He works in the union of minibuses Eduardo Avaroa that makes the journey from a central area to an urban area in the city. Angel began working as a driver and an employee. With much effort and in the company of his wife, he came to save enough to purchase his own minibus. This is his first loan, which he will invest in the purchase of tires for the maintenance of his minibus. He lives at home and helps with family expenses. He has the support of his wife, who also helps with family expenses and with continual improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase minibus tires for maintenance

loans.name: Julia Aurelia

texts.es: La Señora Julia P. de 35 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Femeniles, con oficio en la “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño Taller, de dos Telares  habita conjuntamente con su Esposo y su hija, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los conocimientos heredados pro sus padres y con los préstamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chosamiel del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la Elaboración de cortes Típicos para poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela ya que debido a la calidad de su trabajo los clientes los buscan, así también poder mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, como también mejorar sus ingresos y hacer crecer su taller.
texts.en:
Señora Julia P., 35 years-old, is a married professional woman, with a business in the "Making of Typical Clothing for Women". She relies on a small workshop with two looms. She lives with her husband and daughter. They have two employees for the same activity. Since her childhood she has been dedicated to the Craft. Thanks to the know-how inherited from her parents and the loans she has received, she has been able to move her family ahead. She is a well known person, and her residence is in the Paraje Chosamiel del Cantón Juchanep of the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. She has come to The Asdir Association to request financing for materials for the making of typical clothing to be able to meet the demand of her clientele, since many clients seek her out due to the quality of her work . In this way she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family, and also to improve her income and grow her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for making typical Guatemalan clothing

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Francisco M. Q., se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos, vive en la zona de Alto Llojeta, zona donde se encuntran las fabricas de ladrillos, el señor realiza la compra de  unos 8000 ladrillos a la semana y los vende en la ciudad de Cochabamba, Bolivia, ciudad situada a unos 400 Km de La Paz, lugar en el cual existe un amplio mercado para este producto. Este es su primer prestamo en EMPRENDER, con el ampliará el negocio. Ayuda con los gastos de la casa y a su vez cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es ama de casa sueñan con mejorar cada vez más su negocio. Es una persona muy responsable, y tiene muy buenas referencias por donde vive.
texts.en:
Señor Francis Monastery Q. purchases and sells bricks. He lives in the area of Alto Llojeta, an area where you will find the brick factories. He purchase approximately 8000 bricks a week and sells them in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia, a city located some 400 km from La Paz, in which there is a large market for this product. This is his first loan with EMPRENDER, with which he will expand his business. The loan will assist with the cost of the house. He also has the support of his wife, who is a housewife who dreams of improving the business. He is a very responsible person and has good references where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
La señora Rogelia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la confección de ropas y además posee una librería todo en su propia casa. Rogelia cuenta que aprendió el oficio de la costura de su madre y gracias a la ganancias que le ha dejado este trabajo ella pudo montar su librería.

Ambos negocios son atendidos por ella misma, dice que esto le ha ayudado a sustentar su familia pues la situación económica del país no ha sido del todo buena. 

Ella ya ha solicitado créditos a la Fundación Paraguaya con anterioridad y en esta ocasión ella solicita una nueva para poder comprar telas e hilos pues ha tenido una gran cantidad de pedidos de confección para estas fiestas de fin de año. Al igual desea comprar algunos artículos de decoración navideña para vender en su librería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rogelia is a very hardworking woman. She makes clothing and also has a school supplies store in her house. Rogelia says that she learned the trade of sewing from her mother and thanks to the earnings that this work has produced she was able to start up her school supplies store. She takes care of both businesses herself. She says that this has helped her support her family, since the economic situation of the country has not been all good. She has already requested loans from Fundacion Paraguaya previously, and on this occasion she requests a new one to be able to buy fabric and thread, since she has had a large quantity of orders for tailoring for all the end of year parties. At the same time, she would like to buy some Christmas decoration items to sell in her school supplies store.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and other accessories for sewing

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es: El Señor Santos Angel L. M., es propietario de un bus de 15 para 15 pasajeros, trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa y empezo a trabajar como chofer desde muy joven y ya cuenta con su movilidad propia, su primer prestamo en EMPRENDER fué de Bs. 2500.- para la compra de accesorios para su movilidad. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y además ayuda con los gastos familiares. Aspira a comprarse otro bus. El crédito será invertido en la compra de material de construcción para remodelar el domicilio donde vive y para la construcción de un departamento completo en donde tendrá más comodidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Angel L. M. owns a bus for 15 people and works for the Eduardo Avaroa labor union. He began to work as a driver when he was very young and now he owns his own vehicle. His first loan with EMPRENDER was 2500 BS in order to purchase accessories for his bus. His parents support Mr. L. and he helps his family with the cost of living. He wishes to buy another bus. The loan shall be invested into the purchase of construction material to redesign the house where he lives and to build a new apartment where he could live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Jose Darvin

texts.es: El Señor José B. de 23 años de edad,  Soltero de oficios Tejedor, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares,  habita conjuntamente con sus padres, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez laboro como empleado, en donde fue adquiriendo conocimiento, la cual poco después emprendió su taller ya que con ello a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje ChiB. del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y activo para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Teniendo como visión que su taller de fabricación de cortes típicos crezca y que sea un distribuidor mayorista de textiles en el departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Señor José B. is 23 years-old and a single professional weaver in the "Making of Typical Clothing for Women". He relies on a workshop with 2 Looms. He lives with his parents. They have two employees for the same activity. In his childhood he worked as an employee, where he was acquiring knowledge. Shortly after he undertook his workshop since with it he has been able to move his family ahead. He is a very well known person, with Residence in the Paraje ChiB. del Cantón Juchanep of the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. He has come to the Asdir Association to request a loan for the purchase of materials and assets for said craft to facilitate and be able to meet the demand of his clientele and thus to be able to give better living conditions to his family. He has a vision of growing his typical clothing workshop production and becoming a wholesale distributor of textiles in the department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for making typical Guatemalan clothing

loans.name: Renacer Ayarmaca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “AYARMACA”, se fundo en febrero del 2008, actualmente se encuentra en el II ciclo de la, esta conformada por  14 socias, 11 mujeres y 3 hombres, lleva el nombre de la comunidad AYARMACA.
 
La comunidad de Ayarmaca, esta ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba, distrito de Chinchero Dpto de Cusco, se encuentra a 45 minutos  de la ciudad del Cusco, por carretera afirmada.
Las socias son mujeres campesinas, que se dedican a actividades de crianza y comercio de animales menores, como cuyes, gallinas, cerdos, ellas compran en las ferias comunales (por eje. cuyes S/ 8.00 y lo venden en la ciudad del Cusco a S/. 12.00). 
El crédito es un servicio que valoran porque les sirve para, incremento de capital y mayores posibilidades de regular el flujo de caja de la unidad familiar. Valoran los requisitos mínimos, la entrega y devolución del crédito en la propia comunidad. como en la mayoría de los casos la valoración del ahorro tiene mucha importancia.
texts.en:
The village bank "AYARMACA", which was founded in February 2008, is currently in its second cycle. It is comprised of 14 members, 11 women and 3 men, and bears the name of the community AYARMACA. The Ayarmaca community is located in the province of Urubamba, in the Chinchero district of the Dept. of Cusco, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, by way of unpaved road. The members are rural women, who engage in the breeding and trade of young animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. They buy them at town fairs (for example, guinea pigs cost S/8.00 and sell them in the city of Cusco for S/.12.00). The loan is a service that they value because it allows them to increase capital and creates greater possibilities of regulating cash flow from the family unit. They value the minimum requirements, the delivery and the repayment of the loan in their community. As in most cases, the valuation of savings is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of the community bank will use the surplus from the purchase and sale of small animals like guinea pigs, poultry, pigs

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
La señora María Gloria Morínigo, es casada, vive en casa propia,     tiene dos  hijos, quienes  son  mayores de edad. La misma cuenta con una lavandería para ropas. En Paraguay, las personas llevan sus ropas a las lavanderías para que las personas ahí se encarguen de lavarlas y plancharlas pagando por el servicio, a diferencia de otros países en donde las personas hacen uso de las máquinas solamente y se encargan de lavar sus propias ropas.

El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, situado a dos cuadras de la Avda. Eusebio Ayala, que es una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad. Se inició con un de aproximadamente U$ 650 que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.

La señora María Gloria Morínigo retira el préstamo para la adquisición de un secarropas más para poder abastecer con los trabajos que tiene.

Uno de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento o mobiliario,  y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Gloria Morínigo is married, lives in her own house, and has two children that are already grown. She has a landromat. In Paraguay, people bring their clothing to laundromats so that the people there deal with washing and ironing them, paying for that service, which is different from other countries where people make use of machines and take care of washing their own clothes.

The business has a very good location, situated two blocks from Avda. Eusebio Ayala, which is one of the main streets in the city. She started with approximately US$ 650, which has increased with the passage of time, and nowadays she counts on a broad client list.

Ms. María Gloria Morínigo withdraws this loan to acquire another dryer to be able to keep up with the work that she has.

One of her aspirations is to be able to expand this business soon, referring to the equipment or furnishings, and to be able to offer a more comfortable and pleasant environment for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dryer for clothes

loans.name: Anibal Gonzalo

texts.es:
El caballero Anibal M. es originario de la ciudad de Chnandega desempeñándose en la venta de plátanos en el mercado Central donde labora desde hace cuatro años. Es importante destacar que esta actividad la lleva a cabo apoyándose de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha invertido directamente en la compra de los plátanos para su venta.

Hoy en día una vez más ha acudido al apoyo de Ceprodel para obtener un crédito debido a que sus plátanos se le han agotado y le urge comprarlos para venderlos. Por esta razón él espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y logrará mejorar la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Anibal M. originally comes from the city of Chnandega, working in the sale of plantains in the Central Market where he has worked for four years. It is important to mention that he is able to carry out this activity by supporting himself with credit from Ceprodel which he has invested directly in buying plantains to sell them.

Now, once more, he has turned to Ceprodel for support to get a credit as his plantains have run out and he urgently needs to buy more to sell more. For this reason he confidently waits for his credit to be approved and he will be able to improve the condition of his business


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plantains/Compra de plátanos

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Gómez de Rojas, es casada,  vive en casa propia,    tiene cinco  hijos, quienes  ya son  mayores de edad. La misma cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura el cual se encuentra en su domicilio. Ella se inició con un capital de Gs. 500.000.- U$ 100.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes, lo que le ha permitido ir ampliando su taller.

La señora Teresa Gómez  retira el préstamo para la adquisición de más telas y así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, mediante la adquisición de más máquinas de coser  y así poder brindar también puestos de trabajo a otras personas que sepan coser, para el desarrollo profesional y económico de los jóvenes principalmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa Gómez de Rojas is married and lives in her own house. She has a small tailoring shop, which is found in her home. She began with an amount of 500,000 Paraguayan Guarani (approximately US$100), which has increased over the years and nowadays she relies on a broad list of clients, which has allowed her to expand her shop.

Mrs. Teresa Gómez withdraws this loan to acquire more fabric and with it be able to fulfill her clients' orders. One of her aspirations is to be able to expand this business soon, through acquiring more sewing machines, and with that be able to also give jobs to other people that know how to sew, especially for the professional and economic development of young people.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric of various types and colors

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el Mercado Central, la señora Silvia S. se dedica al negocio de panadería donde fabrica todo tipo de pan para ofrecerlo a sus clientes. 

La señora Silvia es madre de dos hijos con el deber de mantener y de brindarle todas las condiciones para su desarrollo. Es por esta razón que se ha esforzado grandemente en la elaboración de pan, galletas, picos, pudines y manjares para ofrecerlo a  sus clientes. 

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito solicitado para la compra de los insumos o materia prima para preparar el pan. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos anteriores cancelados satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the Central Market, Mrs. Silvia S. has a bakery where she makes all types of bread to offer to her clients.

Silvia is the mother of two children, with the task of taking care of them and providing them with the conditions for their development. It is for this reason that she has worked so hard in making bread, cookies, snacks, puddings, and delicacies to offer to her clients.

Nowadays her motivation for which she looks to Ceprodel is to obtain the loan requested to purchase the ingredients or raw materials for making bread. Her credit record shows 8 previous loans paid off satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Juana Vilma es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica con mucho ahinco a atender su pequeña tienda en el mercado Central donde comercializa  productos caseros, productos varios y productos comestibles.

La señora Juana ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos ya que requiere comercializarlos para continuar con su negocio en el mercado Central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Vilma is from the city of Chinandega and works very eagerly to take care of her small store in the Central Market, where she sells homemade products, variety products, and groceries.

Juana has come to Ceprodel with the purpose of obtaining a loan, which will allow her to purchase products, as she needs to sell them to continue her business in the Central Market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
Maria Félix P. F. tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijas la mayor de nombre Maria tiene la edad de 13 años y cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria y su otra hija  Diana de 6 años que cursa recientemente el 6 grado de primaria, su esposo labora en una  radio, en sus propósitos  esta el mantener su negocio activo y desea acondicionar  su establecimiento para que sus clientes puedan tener la comodidad de disfrutar los deliciosos nacatamales que vende y también desea tener su propia casas ya que en la que reside actualmente es la casa de sus suegros y al comprar su propia casa podrá darle a sus hijas un lugar que sea propiedad de ellas.


El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, su actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales y el destace de cerdo, ella da inicio a su negocio con 10 libras de carne y vendía la carne del cerdo mas tarde decide dedicarse a la elaboración del nacatamal e inicia con un promedio de 100 nacatamales y al responder a la afluencia de clientes decide solicitar un préstamo para empezar la compra de cerdos y es así como logra obtener este oficio que lo convierte en su trabajo y medio de vida, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de la comida de los cerdos y obtener de esta forma buena producción de carne ya que ha tenido bastante tiempo de trabajar con la Fundación León 2000.
texts.en:
Maria Félix P. F. is 37 years old, married, and has two daughters. Her oldest daughter, Maria, is thirteen and in her second year of secondary school. Her younger daughter, Diana, is six years old and in sixth grade. Her husband works on the radio. Her goal is to maintain her business and to create a comfortable environment in which her customers can enjoy her delicious “nacatamales” (pork tamales made in banana leaves). She also wants her own home, since she currently lives with her in-laws. By buying her own home she will be able to give her children a place that is their own. For ten years she has sold “nacatamales” and pork slices. She began her business with just ten pounds of pork to sell. Later, she decided to make “nacatamales” and began with an average of 100 “nacatamales.” Because of the fantastic response of her customers, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase pigs and that is how this business became her way of life. This loan will be used for working capital that she needs to purchase feed for the pigs to ensure that she has high-quality meat to sell. She has worked with Fundación León 2000 for some time.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucrecia Adelina

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Lucrecia S. C. tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es acompañada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos su hija mayor tiene la edad de 10 años y cursa recientemente el 1 grado de primaria y un niño de 2 años no estudia, su compañero de vida labora es comerciante, sus propósitos son que su negocio se mantenga activo y en sus deseos esta el luchar por sus hijas para que tengan una casa y así obtengan un lugar donde vivir para que el día de mañana no pasen necesidades de vivienda y un futuro en los estudios.



El tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 7 años su actividad económica es la de venta de frutas y verduras en la que vende cosas como: tomate, piña, banano, naranjas y otros, inicia su negocio por cuenta propia a la edad de 21 años vendiendo ahí mismo en el Mercado la Estación y empieza con los productos como: tomate, cebolla, chiltoma y es mas tarde consigue la afluencia de clientes y decide invertir en el banano y otros, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la comprar de mas productos ya que necesita abastecerse de zanahoria, tomate, cebolla debido a la elaboración de las diferentes comidas que se realizan para estos días festivos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia S. C. is 28 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. Her daughter is 10 years old and currently in elementary school, while her son is 2 years old. Her partner is a storekeeper. She hopes that her business will stay active, and she is determined to struggle so that her children can have a house in which to live. She hopes they never lack anything, and wants to see them pursue their studies in the future.

She has had this business for 7 years. She sells fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, pineapples, bananas, oranges, and other produce. She started her business on her own at the age of 21, working right in the La Estación Market, selling tomatoes, onions and sweet peppers. She later managed to obtain a solid client-base, so she decided to invest in bananas and other produce. This loan will be used as work capital to purchase more produce because she needs to stock up on carrots, tomatoes and onions since people use these ingredients for special meals during the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 64 años D. edad y es madre D. 4 hijos, es casada. Asistió al Programa D. Alfabetización  durante 3 meses. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 200.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro una vaca para engorD., dedicándose hoy en día a la crianza D. ganado vacuno.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y con parte D. sus ahorros comprara un ganado vacuno (toro) que pagara en 5 cuotas .

Ella desea continuara con su negocio y al mismo tiempo trabajar en  labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Gregoria is one of the founding members of the communal bank „Espiritu Santo” in Centro Poblado D. Chimbo in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 64 years old, married and has four children. She has attended the Literacy Program for three months. With the first loan of 200 soles she increased her capital and bought a cow, today she deals with raising cows. With the loan of 1500 soles that she is requesting now and with part of her savings Gregoria will buy a bull. She will pay this amount back in five installments. She would like to continue raising cows and at the same time do agricultural work.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Francisca Jerónima

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora Francisca L. se dedica arduamente a la labor de venta de verduras las cuales son comercializadas con mucha alegría en su establecimiento. 

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los perecederos como lo son papas, cebollas, chiltomas, zanahorias entre otras. Una vez que adquiera el crédito procederá a la compra de estos productos. Es importante destacar que ella se ha destacado por haber realizado varios prestamos en Ceprodel habiéndolos cancelados todos efectivamente y perfilándose como una fiel cliente.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon Francisca Lopez dedicates herself to the hard labor of selling vegetables, which she does happily from her stall.

Now she is looking for the support of Ceprodel to get credit to buy perishable goods like potatoes, onions, sweet peppers and carrots, among other things. Once she has the credit she will proceed with buying these products. It is important to mentions that she has had various loans with Ceprodel which she has repaid on time, shaping herself as a faithful client.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable goods/Compra de los perecederos

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 76944

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Doña Clara  es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 70 años D. edad es casada y  madre D. un hijo que ya tiene familia, Ella asistió  al Programa D. Alfabetización durante un año. Con el primer préstamo obtenido D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ropa americana para vender en Yunguyo y que en la actualidad sigue vendiendo.

Con el préstamo que recibirá D. S/.1500.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 05 cuotas  comprara más ropa y así continuar con su negocio.

Su deseo es continuar con su negocio y así  seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Clara is a founding member of the Espiritu Santo ["Holy Spirit"] community bank in Chimbo, a town in the Peruvian "provincia" of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 70 years old, married and the mother of one son who has his own family now. She attended the Literacy Program for a year. With her first loan of S/.300 [300 Peruvian soles], she bought American clothes to sell in Yunguyo, clothes that she's still selling.

With this loan of S/.1,500, to be repaid in 5 installments, she will buy more clothes to continue her business.

She hopes to continue developing her business and use the revenues to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
La señora Zeneyda M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos lácteos como lo es queso, cuajada y crema en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León. Ella es una con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus  tres hijos por los cuales debe de trabajar arduamente todos los días para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las cuajadas el queso y la crema para continuar atendiendo a sus clientes en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Zeneyda Martinez dedicates herself to her business of selling dairy products like cheese, curds and cream in the La Terminal market in the city of Leon. She is responsible for supporting 3 kids, for whom she has to work hard each day to bring them better conditions in life.

Now her reason for turning to Ceprodel is to ask for credit to buy raw ingredients to make curds, cheese and cream to continue serving her clients in La Terminal market in the city of Leon.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo, del distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 2 hijos que dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos veterinarios y también  la ayuda a criar animales para engorde. Con el préstamo  que recibió de S/.  500.00 nuevos soles inicio con este negocio y compro ganado ovino. Tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad cuenta con ganado vacuno y ovino que vende para pagar al Banco.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara productos veterinarios.
 
Celia manifiesta que con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos pudo iniciar un negocio ya que otro Bancos no dan esa facilidad.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the Espiritu Santo ["Holy Spirit"] community bank in Chimbo, a town in the Peruvian "provincia" of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 2 dependent children. Her husband sells veterinary products and also raises livestock for sale. With her first loan of S/.500 [500 Peruvian soles], she started her livestock business and bought sheep to raise. She's worked with Manuela Ramos for two years.

She now depends on sales of cattle and sheep to repay the bank.

With this loan of S/1,200, to be repaid in 5 months, she will buy veterinary products.

Celia says that the loan from Manuela Ramos allowed her to start her business and gave her a chance that she couldn't get from other banks.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy veterinary products for livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compa de mercadería

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: El señor José Leonel, habita en el Km. 11 ½ carretera a Masaya entrada Esquípula, todavía no es casado vive con su mamá y trabaja como Administrador de cybernik, los sueños de don José es llegar a tener su propio negocio y lograr mejorar la casa de su mamá ya que en un futuro piensa casarse y formar una familia .La mayor necesidad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento, ya que lo que el gana aporta parte para la casa y sus propios gastos. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 10.000.00 para comprar materiales de construcción y poder mejor parte de la vivienda para tener mas privacidad ya que su casa es pequeña
texts.en:
Mr. José Leonel lives at kilometer 11.5 on the highway to Masaya at Esquípula. He has not yet married, is living with his mother, and is working as an administrator at Cybernik. His dream is to have his own business and make improvements to his mother's home as he hopes to one day get married and build a family. His greatest need is financial capital, since his earnings are only enough to support the household and his own expenses. He is applying for an amount of $10,000 córdobas to buy construction materials to improve part of the house to create more privacy in their small home.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build an addition to the house

loans.name: Marvin Andres

texts.es:
El Joven Marvin Sánchez C. tiene la edad de30 años, su estado civil es casado, tiene 2 hijas  su hija mayor Karen  tiene la edad de 6 años cursa recientemente el 1 grado de primaria y su hija menor génesis de 7 meses quien no estudia, su estado civil, su esposa labora en la venta de mercadería en general, sus deseos son de prosperar y mantener su negocio activo en sus propósitos esta el obtener su propia casa ya que actualmente donde reside es de mama y desea acondicionarla para que sus hijas tengan su casa propia y también proporcionarle a sus hijas un futuro de estudios.


El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio  es de 4 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general que consiste en la venta de pantalones, camisas, trajes para niños y trajes para dama, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza colocando pequeñas cosas de venta como: colas, diademas y trajes para niños y mas tarde su esposa piensa en la idea de la venta de ropa y es así como inicia este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos en Managua .
texts.en:
Mr. Marvin Sánchez C. is a 30-year-old married father of two children. The eldest child, Karen, is 6 years old and in the first grade, while the youngest, Génesis, is 7 months old. His wife works selling general merchandise. He hopes that his business will be prosperous and active. Because he currently lives with his mother, he plans on obtaining his own house and wants to furbish it so that his daughters can have their own house. He also wants to provide his daughters with an education.

He has had this busines for 4 years. He sells merchandise such as pants, shirts, children’s outfits and women’s dresses. He started this business on his own account, initially selling small items like hair bands, headbands and children’s outfits. Later, his wife got the idea of selling clothing, which was how this business was formed. The loan will be used as work capital because he needs to purchase merchandise in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno. Tiene 42 años, es casada y  madre de 4 hijos que están en el colegio, vive en la Av. Circunvalación Lupaca S/N, estudio el quinto grado de primaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro bayetas y lanas para bordados.

Carmela en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de papa y frutas pero al mismo tiempo sigue haciendo sus bordados para venderlo en Los Uros, y así pagar con puntualidad su préstamo.

Con el crédito que solicitara de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara 03 sacos de semilla de papa.

Ella desea terminar de construir su casa y poder vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the communal bank "Inmaculada Concepcion", in the district of Juli in Chucuito - Puno. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children who attend high school. Carmela was able to attend school unitl the 5th grade. She lives on Avenue Circunvalacion Lupaca S/N. With the first loan she received, she purchased supplies for her embroidery and handicrafts. Right now, she works selling potatoes and fruits, but also continues with her embroidery work which she sells in Los Uros. She was able to repay her first loan on time.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase sacks of seed for growing potatoes. Her goal is to finish the construction of her house and to be able to live peacefully.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 bags of seed for growing potatoes

loans.name: Feliciana Isabel

texts.es:
El pinol es la bebida típica de Nicaragua y a la venta de esta bebida desde hace 9 años se dedica la señora Feliciana P. en su establecimiento en el mercado La Estación de León. Vende el pinol en polvo listo para preparar y son muchos los clientes que le visitan diario para comprar este producto. 

Una necesidad que hoy mismo la señora Feliciana atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el dinero para comprar el maíz, la leña y las bolsas para prepara el pinol o pinolillo. Es por esto que espera que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para la compra de esta materia prima para continuar preparando la bebida más sabrosa en Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Pinol is Nicaragua's traditional drink and selling it has been Feliciana Perez's livelihood for the last 9 years. She operates her business from a space in the La Estacion market in Leon. She sells powdered pinol, ready for mixing, and has lots of customers who stop by daily to buy from her.

Feliciana needs a loan to buy maize, wood and containers for making pinol or pinolillo. She hopes that Ceprodel will extend the loan so that she can buy the basic supplies she needs to continue making Nicaragua's most delicious drink.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for beverage business.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo del distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo. Tiene 44 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, 2 viven con ella, estudio el sexto grado de Primaria. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 01 ganado vacuno (vaca) para engorde. Antes de iniciar con este negocio trabajaba en la venta al por mayor de galletas en Tacna, cuando se caso a los 17 años decide empezar con el negocio de crianza de ganado vacuno junto a su esposo. Actualmente sigue con la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino. 

Con el préstamo que solicitara de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles comprara 01 toro a S/. 2.200, el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas.

Su anhelo es que su hijo sea profesional y poder vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" in the center of Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo. She is 44 years old, she is married and a mother of 4 kids, 2 of which live with her and are in the sixth grade of primary school. With the first loan of 300 soles she bought a calf for raising. Before starting this business she worked selling biscuits in bulk in Tacna. When she got married when she was 17, she decided to start a business raising cattle with her husband. Now she still does this, raising cows, sheep and pigs.

With the loan she has asked for, of 2,500 soles, she will buy a bull for 2,200 soles, which she will repay in 5 installments.

Her wish is that her son will be a professional and be able to live peacefully.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull/Compra de 1 toro.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”   del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. Ilave Nº 825, estudio el segundo año de Secundaria.
Tiene 37 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijas que todavía dependen de ella.  Elena con el primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles decide invertir en la compra de bayeta y lana para bordados. Tiene casi un año y medio trabajando con el Banco.
 Actualmente tiene una tienda de Abarrotes y sigue haciendo bordados en bayeta para vender en Cusco.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, etc.

Elena manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para trabajar además que pueden ahorrar con toda confianza.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Communal Bank 'Inmaculada Concepcion', in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito-Puno, she lives in the Jr llave No 825, and she studied until the second year of secondary school. She is 37 years old and she is married with 2 daughters who still depend on her. With the first loan she received form Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, Elena decided to invest in buying cloth and wool for embroidery. She has been working with the Bank for nearly a year and a half.

She now has a grocery store and still does embroidery on cloth to sell in Cusco.

With this loan of 3000 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil etc.

Elena states that Manuela Ramos supports her work as well as allowing her to save with confidence.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil etc/Compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, etc.

loans.name: Isaura Margarita

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Estacion en la ciudad de León la señora Isaura T. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras como lo son uvas, manzanas, papas, cebollas, chiltomas, plátanos, zanahorias, entre otros.

Su negocio lo ha venido desarrollando a través del tiempo ya que ha invertido grandemente para aumentar el volumen de venta de los perecederos. Es importante destacar que Ceprodel le ha beneficiado grandemente por lo que le ha brindado los créditos para la compra de estas frutas y verduras. Es por esta razón que ella espera una vez más que su crédito sea aprobado para continuar con su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
At the La Estacion market in the city of Leon, Isaura Telleria makes a living selling fruits and vegetables. Among other things, she sells grapes, apples, potatoes, onions, sweet peppers, platanos, and carrots.

Her business has grown over the years because she's invested significantly to increase her sales of perishables. It's important to note that Ceprodel has played a huge role in her success by extending loans to her to buy the fruits and vegetables she sells. She's now applying for another loan so that she can continue her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo, distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo –Puno. Tiene 48 años  y es madre de 5 hijos que aun apoya, es casada, su esposo también trabaja con ella en la crianza de ganado vacuno, porcino y ovino. Con el primer préstamo obtenido de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado ovino para engorde. Actualmente sigue con este negocio que le da ganancias para pagar con puntualidad su crédito. Hace 8 años que trabaja con el Banco Comunal.

Con el crédito que recibirá de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas comprara ganado vacuno para engorde.

Ella desea incrementar sus ganancias con este negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa is a member of the Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” in the city of Chimbo--a district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 48 years old, married and mother of 5 children. Her husband also works with her raising bovine, swine and ovine cattle. With the first loan she obtained in the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, she purchased bovine cattle. Being currently involved with the cattle business has motivated her to pay future lines of credit on time. She has been working with Comunal Bank for 8 years. This line of credit in the amount of S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles will be paid back in 5 installments and it will be applied to purchase additional cattle. She wishes to generate more income with this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for profit

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 46 años  y es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están a su cargo, es casada, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en la crianza de animales menores. Con el primer préstamo de S/: 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado porcino, ovino, gallinas y patos, negocio al que sigue poniéndole mucho empeño. Tiene 8 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara alfombras de Lima para vender en Cusco.

Su deseo es mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr Juana is a member of the Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” from the central town of Chimbo, of the distric of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 46 years old, married and mother of 6 children - she still supports 3 of them. Her husband helps her run the small-size livestock raising business they own. WIth the first loan in the amount of S/: 300.00 nuevos soles, she purchased pigs, goats, chickens and ducks. She has been working with Maria Ramos for 8 years and she is putting in a lot of effort into this. With the new loan of S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will purchase rugs from Lima and resell them in Cusco. Her desire is to increase business volume and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Rugs

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” del  distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. Bertonio Nº 288.
Tiene 49 años, es conviviente y madre  de 5 hijos que mantiene aun, su esposo no la apoya por lo que tiene que trabajar sola. Julia dice que tuvo su esposo a los 16 años y ya no pudo estudiar. . Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que obtuvo por primera vez compro verduras y frutas para vender y repartir por mayor en Cusco.

 Ella actualmente continua con este negocio, viaja los días Lunes  a Tacna a traer verduras y frutas, los días viernes lleva a Cusco y cuando le sobran sus productos vende los días Miércoles y Domingos en Juli.

Con este préstamo solicitado de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara verduras y frutas por cajas.
texts.en:
Mr. Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” from the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito-Puno - she lives at the Jr. Bertonio Nº 288. She is 49 years old, married and mother of 5 children whom she still supports. She does not receive any help from her husband and has to do the work by herself. Julia says she got married when she was 16 and could not continue her education. With the S/: 300.00 new soles loan she first got, she purchased greens and fruits and sold them in Cusco. Currently, she is still involved in this business; she travels to Tacna on Mondays to buy greens and fruits and sells them on Fridays in Cusco. Whenever there is anything left she sells them in Juli on Wednesdays and Sundays. She will apply the S/: 1200.00 new soles, 4-month term loan, she is requesting to purchase boxes of vegetables and fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Mr. Seam K. is 44 years old and lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Kuth Lai, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. They do not earn enough income to provide for their family. Thus, Mr. Seam K. decided to request a loan to buy a boat for fishing. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other attends the local school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a boat

loans.name: Mit's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mit A. is a group leader of six people who all live in Kampong Trea village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money to plant her rice field, so she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sun Lai, is a fisherman. Mrs. Mit A. is 20 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Laiheng

texts.en: Mrs. Laiheng T. lives in Preak Ta Sao village in Kandal Province. She sells fruit in the local market. Since she has a lot of customers who need many items, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Hann Sokhorn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Laiheng T. is 51 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hoang Thi B. is 34 years old . She lives in Gia Khanh Commune, Binh Xuyen  district, Vinh Phuc Province. She has two children. She has been a member of TYM since 2003. Her family's main income is pork trading. For the next loan, she wants to borrow 14 million VND ($825 USD) to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Mr. Samnang L. is a farmer who lives in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. He owns a plot of land where he cultivates vegetables to earn a living.
