He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy corn seeds so he is requesting a loan $500 USD. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's standard of living. His wife, Mrs. Yoeurn Samet, is a rice-soup seller. Mr. Samnang L. is 30 years old and the father of four children, two of whom attend the local school but the other two are too young (ages 2 and 4).

loans.use: To buy corn seeds

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Mrs. Then K., 30 year-old mother of two children who are attending the local school, is a villager in Preak Samroung Village in Kandal Province.  She and her husband, Mr. Khorn Map, are both employed in a garment factory but lack sufficient salary to provide good living conditions for their household. Thus, Mrs. K. is requesting a loan to buy two cows to start a breeding business which she hopes will result in increased income and improved living conditions.

loans.use: To buy two cows for a breeding business.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi T., 26 years old and married with children, lives in Gia Khanh Commune, Binh Xuyen District, Vinh Phuc Province. She has been in the TYM Fund since 2003, and her main income is derived from raising and selling pork.

With an increasing income her family’s life is getting more and more stable to the point where Pham has enough money to invest in her children’s education. She is now requesting a loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Ie

texts.en:
Mrs. Ie K. lives in Preak Louk Village in Kandal Province, where she and her husband, Mr. Chorn Sorn, own a piece of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Their current rice revenue is not sufficient to support their household, so Ie is requesting a loan to rent a plot of land for rice cultivation and to purchase rice seed to support the field. She hopes to thereby increase their income and improve their standard of living.

Ie is 43 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To rent a plot of land to cultivate rice and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 48 years old. She has three children. She lives in Gia Khanh Commune, Binh Xuyen District, Vinh Phuc Province, with her husband and her children. 

She joined in TYM Fund in 2002. Now, her main income is from growing rice and a tractor service.  With an average income of about 4 million per month in the local currency, her family’s income is growing more and more stable. This time she wants to borrow 15 million (USD$900) to invest in her business.

loans.use: to invest in her business.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Mr. Phea C. is a villager in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. He is a fisherman who can catch a small amount of fish because he has insufficient fishing tools. 

In order to improve this business, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat motor to use with his boat. In addition, he would use the rest of the money to purchase fishnets for his fishing. 

His wife, Mrs. Phann Sao Ry, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. Mr. Phea C. is 46 years old and the father of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a boat motor and purchase fishnets for his fishing.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi B. is 53 years old. She has been part of TYM Fund since 1999. She lives in Nam Vien Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province, with her husband and four children. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Her family’s main income is raising pigs and her husband’s salary. Their business is well-developed and brings in an income to their family of about 3 million per month in the local currency. This time she wants to borrow 9 million (USD$550) to invest in raising pigs

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
Mrs.  Vu Thi D.  is 45 years old with four children; two of them are grown up. She has been part of TYM since 1999. During her membership her performance has been very good; she always pays on time. 

Now her main income is poultry raising, growing rice and the salary of her husband. They earn about 3million per month in the local currency.
This time she wants to borrow 12 million (USD$725) to buy more chickens and cows for raising.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and cows for raising.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom P. is a villager in Krodass Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Koy Kai, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. Since they have only one business from which they can make only a meager income to provide for their family, Mrs. Khom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy ducklings and duck food to start breeding ducks. She hopes to increase their income and improve her living conditions.

Khom is 51 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a computer teacher in the local institute while another one is employed in a garment factory. Two of them stay home to do household work while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy ducklings and duck food to start breeding ducks

loans.name: Kieu Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Kieu Thi B. is 51 years old. She has 3 children; one of them is still a student. She joined TYM in 2006. Now her family’s main business is hog-raising and trading. Their business is well-developed  and has brought their family to have a stable income (4million/month).  This time she wants to borrow 10 million to invest in her business.

loans.use: to invest in her hog-raising business

loans.name: Yat

texts.en: Mrs. Yat P. is a villager in Preak Louk village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhoev  Ly, are farmers who have a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living. From this plantation, they can collect only a little rice revenue to provide for their family. Thus, Mrs. Yat P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan after she sells her cow. She is a 56-year-old and the mother of three children, one of whom is an ice-cream seller while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Ta Thi B. is 61 years old.  She has 5 children and 3 of them are grown-up.  She lives in Tam Dong Commune, Me Linh District, Ha Noi.  In 2005, she joined TYM and accessed her first loan to invest in her business. Now, her main income comes from traditional medicine. For the next  loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9 million  to invest in her business.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Mrs. Chai K. is a farmer and lives in Krodass Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have rice seed to plant on the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed. She expects to use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer for her field to make her crop more productive.

Chai's husband, Mr. Koer Kis, is a fisherman. Mrs. Chai K. is 45 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and  fertilizer

loans.name: Warlin

texts.en:
Warlin P., 33-year old father of two children, farms a family-owned rice field in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. As the head of the family, he chooses to work under the heat of the sun just to earn a living and provide what his family needs. He is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase 1 sack of certified seeds and 3 sacks fertilizer for the next planting season. Imbued with strength and industry, he never gets tired plowing the fields to ensure enough food for their table. Hard work is the only thing he can give to provide enough things for his family.

“I dreamed to have a more convenient life for my wife and my children,” he uttered. This has fueled his intention to double-time his work to be a more productive farmer. CEV has been helping him to improve his yield every harvest. By joining in the organization, he has easy access to the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEV offers.

loans.use: To purchase  fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi T.  lives in Tam Dong Commune, Me Linh District, Ha Noi Capital. She is 46  years old and has three children. Her husband is a worker. She has been a member of TYM since 2000. Her main sources of income are raising hogs, growing rice, and her husband's salary. She is now requesting T. borrow 9 million VND T. invest in her daughter's shop.

loans.use: To invest in her daughter's shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 43 years old. She has six children, four of whom are grown. She has been a member of TYM since 2006. Now, her main sources of income are raising poultry and growing rice. She makes about 4 million VND per month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow  9 million VND to invest in raising ducks.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 28 years old . She lives in Tam Dong Commune, Me Linh  town, Ha Noi capital. She has 2 children . She is a member of TYM since 2006. Now, her family's main income is fish selling . For the next loan, she wants to borrow  9 million  to invest in her business.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 28 years old. She lives in Tam Dong Commune, Me Linh town, Ha Noi. She has 2 children. She has been a member of TYM since 2006. Now, her family's main income is from selling fish. For the next loan, she wants to borrow 9 million VND to invest in her business. (original text was in English; minor corrections made to grammar)

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in fish selling business.

loans.name: Saviet's Group

texts.en:
There are four members in this group, Mrs. Saviet Y., 48, makes a living selling groceries such as cakes, candy, and toys for pupils who are in the primary school. She has eight children, four of whom are married and the other four are students. Her husband, Mr. Yon Ouk, 54, is a goldsmith. Saviet is applying a $250 loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Saviet is the leader of the group. The other members are:

Mrs. Sonoeun N., 26, a housewife who takes care of five children. She requests a loan of $250 to buy a wood carving machine for her husband’s business.

Mrs. Roeum T., 62, a widow and a housewife. She has three children. One daughter works in a hotel, so Roeum is requesting a $150 loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work.

Mrs. Sony K., 28, sells used clothing in the market. She needs a $150 loan to buy construction materials for her husband’s job. 

The borrowers live in Slokram Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P., 63 years old and the mother of two children who were already married, is from Bunawan Agusan del Sur and farms a family-owned rice field. She bought a small parcel of land for her family as a source of living. Until now she has never stopped tilling the land to have enough food to share. Despite her age, Erlinda and her husband still manage the farm. Together, they have worked industriously and are happy to cultivate the land under the heat of the sun for a good yield.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizer to be used this planting season. She also aspires to purchase farm implements, which she can use when tilling the land. “I am happy about being part of CEV. I meet other people who really have dreams like me,” she said. Now, Erlinda enjoys receiving credit assistance, training as well as insurance coverage that CEV offers to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en: Mrs. V.  lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province.  She is 62 years old and has six children, all of whom are grown. Her husband is a worker. She has been a member of TYM since 2000. Her sources of income are raising fish, growing rice, and her husband's salary. She wants to borrow $600 USD to buy cows to raise.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. L.  lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province She is 50 years old and has 4 children and 2 of them are grown - up. Her husband is a  security guard and her sons are workers. She is a member of TYM since 1999. .Now, her main income are raising cows, growing of rice and husband's salary. For the next L. cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million to buy cows for raising
texts.en:
Mrs. L. lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province. She is 50 years old and has 4 children and 2 of them are grown-up. Her husband is a security guard and her sons are workers. She has been a member of TYM since 1999. Now, her main income is from raising cows, growing rice and her husband's salary. For the next L. cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million VND to buy cows for raising. (original text was in English; minor corrections made to grammar)

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows for raising.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Mrs. Sona L., 27, has been a rice farmer since 2000. This is her main source of income, and she currently earns approximately $2.66 each day. Sona has no children and is married to Mr. Eoun Kim, 28, who is a construction worker. They in Koktlokkroam Commune in Siem Reap Province. Sona requests a loan of $500 to buy two oxen to help her plow her farm. (Sona and her husband are in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Vu Thi M. is 53 years old.  She has 4 children and all of them are grown-up.  She lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province.  In 1999, she joined TYM and accessed her first loan to invest in raising pigs. Now, her main income sources are raising pigs and her sons' salaries . For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million  to buy more pigs and feed for raising them.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed for raising them

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L.  is 57 years old.  She has 5 children and all of them are grown-up.  She lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province. Her husband is a contruction worker.  In 1999, she joined TYM and accessed her first loan to invest in raising pigs. Now, her main income sources are raising pigs and her husband's salary. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million  to buy more pigs and feed for raising them.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed for raising them

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily E., a 33-year-old from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, has three children. She is a devoted wife has long been worried about what future she could give to her children, considering that they are just tilling a small parcel of land. Emily knows that she could do something else to improve their lives through venturing into a business. Farming has been their ultimate source of living into which she believes she should invest more to increase yield and have enough food to eat for her family. As she reached initial success, she was able to hire people to work in her rice field during planting season and harvest.

She wants a loan of Php 7,000 to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer, 1 sack of seeds (50 kls/sack) as well as pesticides needed in her farm.

Her being part of CEV makes her enjoy credit assistance convenience as well as training and insurance coverage it offers to all its clients. “CEV taught me to save and do better in my farm. They provide opportunities to all their clients to have additional income as well as to be good entrepreneurs in their own ways,” she added.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene S., 37 years old, mother of three children and a rice grower and entrepreneur from Bunawan, Agusan del Sur, manages to till a family-owned rice field. She a loving mother and never minds working under the heat of the sun as long as she can manage her farm well and able to provide food for her children. Arlene is also open to exploring other possible income areas but needs help to pursue her plans.

She is requesting a loan from CEV of Php 7,000 to purchase I sack of certified "palay" seeds and 2 sacks of fertilizer. Through this, she believes she will create a better return on her investment during harvest.

“I always care to have better income to lift up our family condition. Someday I could be able to provide a convenient life for my children, a kind of life that they really dream of,” she said. CEV has been helping Arlene in her farm business to realize her dreams. Now she enjoys receiving credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEV provides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlin G., a 37-year-old farmer, has three children. Her husband, a rice grower, has been helping her till their own rice field to ensure food to eat. “As parents, all we can do is work hard and carefully take care of our crops so that we have enough harvest for our family,” she said. “I’m just thankful that someone is lifting us up through credit assistance they provide to increase our yield."

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to CEV to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers for her farm. She also considers venturing to other possible income areas so that she can accommodate the needs of her children.

To date, Merlin has easy access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEV offers. She believes that she could soar high in business and soon realize her plans.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng U. is a villager in Smao Lich Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Aside from this plantation, she and her husband, Mr. Sim Chea, are incense stick makers.

Since this business is going well, they want to sell door-to-door, so Mrs. Eng U. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to bU. a motorbike to transport her products door-to-door. Mrs. Eng U. is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study because they are two and four years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to transport her products

loans.name: Mrs. Noeur Khum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of 13 people is located in Tong Rong Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Noeur K. is the village bank president who has beE. selected by the members. She has 0.5-hectares to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Try Pov, is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar or wine. He cannot do his work because he cannot climb up to gather palm juice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Noeur K. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie into a ladder so her husband can re-start the business. She is 38 years old and the mother of two childrE., one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

One member of this village bank has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The end-of-term member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to make a ladder for her husband's business

loans.name: Lavodi Group

texts.en:
Charles is 47 years old. He began his business in 2001 selling containers of 25 liters of palm oil. He started with 40 containers of 25 liters of palm oil. In 2002, the main Matadi Road that linked Kinshasa to the village where Charles used to purchase palm oil was washed out, blocking access to his supply of palm oil. Charles got stuck the other side of the washed-out road, together with all his goods, for four months. Some of his goods spoiled and he lost much money.

When he returned to Kinshasa in 2003, Charles did not have enough capital to re-vitalize his business. He then decided to begin doing interior decoration of people’s houses which allowed him to have some capital to open a general store. Charles now wants to develop his decorating business by purchasing some appropriate tools for interior decoration. He is also planning to diversify his general store by adding fresh foods.

loans.use: To develop his decorating business by purchasing some appropriate tools etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en: Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. Nuriddin A. has been selling fruits and vegetables in Dushanbe city for the past two years. He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings, as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. Nuriddin began selling in “Ganj” market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall, with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor, is his pride and joy. Nuriddin is a father of three young children, who are in school. Like any father, he is doing all he can in order to ensure his children the best future and make them well-educated. Now he needs a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) in order to increase his stock of goods. He promises to repay the loan within four months and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Increasing his stock of vegetables

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
Mukaram A. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Previously, Mukaram's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as a traffic cop didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her children. This was the reason that Mukaram decided to start her own business four years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by allowing her clients to pay in installments she's seeing her orders get bigger. Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering her household so that her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) that she will pay back in four months. With this money, Mukaram will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses and grow her business. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal fabrics to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Numonjon

texts.en: Numonjon B. is 24 years old. He is married and has a daughter. His wife keeps the house and takes care of their daughter. Numonjon and his wife are raising their daughter with love and trying to ensure that she has everything a kid may need. Numonjon has been running his business for about four years. He has a retail store, and he supports his family with this small business. He sells different kinds of TVs and DVD players at his store in the central local market. All the goods are supplied from the neighboring country China. Numonjon tries to have wide range of goods, thus meeting the requirements of his customers and satisfying the needs of clients with different levels of income. Numonjon has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006. His credit history makes him eligible to receive new and larger loans. In order to increase profits, Numonjon needs to increase the variety and number of goods that he offers. With this purpose, he requests 4000 Somoni ($1,200). He promises to repay the loan within six months. Your support will really help him. Be an important part of the growth of Numonjon’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to increasing his stock

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Née le 11 mai 1976 à Agbelouve, une ville située 60 km de Lomé, madame D. Ayawavi s’est mariée avec un chauffeur et elle est mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 1998, elle a vendu des assiettes et des glacières dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 douzaines assiettes et 8 douzaines glacières.
texts.en:
Born on May 11, 1976 in Agbelouve, a town situated 60 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo, Mrs. Ayawavi D. is married to a professional driver and is the mother of two children. Since 1998, she has been selling dishes and coolers in the Agoè district, north of Lomé. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 10 dozen plates and 8 dozen coolers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 dozen plates and 8 dozen coolers for re-sale

loans.name: Ama Ametowoyona

texts.fr:
Madame N. Ama Ametowoyona est née en 1960 à Adangbe, une des villes de Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, et son mari est un magasinier.  Elle a pour activité la revente des produits génériques dans le quartier d’Agoè, une activité qu’elle a commence depuis 2000. 
Elle n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 50 boites d’Iron Tonic, 40 boites de Feromin, et 18 boites de Vitaglobin. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ms. Ama Ametowoyona N. was born in 1960 in Adangbe, a city in Togo. She is married and the mother of four, and her husband is in the warehouse business. Her work, which she began in 2000, involves selling generic pharmaceutical products in the Agoè district. She has never been a recipient of a loan from WAGES. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 50 containers of Iron Tonic, 40 of Feromin, and 18 of Vitaglobin. With this new inventory, she will do better in her sales and realize a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Madame A. Adjo est née le 31 décembre 1970. Elle s’est mariée avec un conducteur de moto-taxi, et elle est mère de deux (2) enfants.  Elle a pour activité la revente des friperies dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. 
Elle n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES, et elle a commencé son activité depuis 2005.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 50 chemises et 30 jupes. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ms. Adjo A. was born on December 31, 1970. A mother of two children, she is married to a motorbike taxi driver. Her work, which she began in 2005, involves reselling second-hand clothing in the Agoè district of Lomé. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 50 blouses and 30 skirts. With this new inventory, she will be able to do well in her sales and realize a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Jonscorner C Group

texts.en:
Greatery M., age 34, is widowed with 3 children (ages 18, 14, and 8). She has a café, which she began 9 years ago. She works from 6:00 AM until 2:00 AM and says she could definitely use a break! She is able to make a monthly profit of about $160.

Greatery has taken 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital, and she has paid it back successfully. Now, she is hoping for a new loan to increase her stock of beer and soda and make her café nicer and more comfortable.

Greatery will share this loan with subgroup C of the Jonscorner loan group. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Greatery is standing in the center in a yellow kitenge.

loans.use: To make her cafe nicer and increase her stock of drinks

loans.name: Mikocheni A Group

texts.en:
John N., age 55, is married with 6 children. He owns a hardware shop that he started in 1999. He works daily from 8:00 AM to 8:30 PM daily. He is able to earn a monthly profit of $122. 

John has previously taken 2 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he has repaid successfully. He is now requesting a new loan to improve his wife's beauty salon. He is hoping to paint it for starters!

John is part of subgroup A of the Mikocheni Group. His subgroup consists of 8 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, John is the only man.

loans.use: To increase the quality of his wife's beauty salon

loans.name: Jonscorner B Group

texts.en:
Rahim L., age 50, is married with 3 children (ages 28, 21, and 18). He is also taking care of his wife's late brother's son, who is 15. He sells medicine for animals in villages upcountry, and when he comes back he manages his small farm with various crops. He started this business 1 year ago. He opens from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM daily and is able to make around $800 monthly profit.

In the past, Rahim has taken out 1 loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his business and to start a chicken business. He hopes for a new loan to buy more medicines because he has big orders from Masai people for their animals. Rahim will share this loan with subgroup B, who sell food, fish, snacks, juice, and bread. This subgroup belongs to the Jonscorner group, whose members monitor each other in paying back the loans.

In the picture Rahim is standing on the right.

loans.use: To buy a big stock of medicines to take upcountry

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat J. is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 adult children. 

Muhabbat owns a clothing business at the local market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been running this business for about 10 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Muhabbat tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around 1000 Somoni. 

Muhabbat has requested a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for 6 months to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors because the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for the winter season. By purchasing additional inventory, Muhabbat will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and develop her business

loans.name: Kholiskhon

texts.en:
Kholiskhon I. is 40 years old. She is married with two children. She started her own business 10 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough to meet their family's expenses. 

Kholiskhon sells candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income she generates allows Kholiskhon to support her large family, including her husband's parents, who live with her family. Kholiskhon dreams about providing all of her children with higher education. 

Today she is requesting 3600 Somoni for 12 months. She is going to spend the loan to expand the range of goods in her confectionary store. She is planning to spend the income to buy a private store, as well as for educating her children. 

Kholiskhon thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time, as she has with her previous loan.

loans.use: Enlarge the range of goods purchase a private store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A., a single parent with four dependents and a junior high education, buys fish from local fishermen, processing, preserving, and sending them to the market for sale at Boatase near Elmina. Responsible for taking care of her children's financial needs, she has been in this business since 1998.

Cecilia is requesting a loan to buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete the family house she is in the process of building.

loans.use: To buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Babayor

texts.en:
Babayor K. is 56 years old. He is married with two children. For more than 12 years, Babayor has been selling vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. His elder son helps Babayor with the business. His business begins in the early morning at 5:00 a.m. He buys vegetables wholesale from the local farmers and sells them in the market.  He trades in the market that is known for its attractive prices. All this allows Babayor’s business to generate a considerable and stable income for his family. 

Today, he is planning to purchase new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of goods that he sells. For this purpose, he requests 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for 4 months. Having a positive credit history with IMON, Babayor promises to repay the current loan as promptly as he did the previous time.  

The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Babayor’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To Increase the range of vegetables that he sells

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs Nguyen Thi V., 43 years old and married with two children, lives in Hung Yen Commune, Hung Nguyen District, Nghe An Province. She has been in the TYM Fund since 2002, and her main income comes from raising chickens and growing rice. Her husband is a driver, and their combined incomes have provided a measure of stability for their family. Nguyen is now requesting a loan to buy more chicken feed and chickens to raise.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chickens.

loans.name: Antoinetta

texts.en:
Mrs. Antonietta A., 55, is married to Alejandrino A.. They were blessed with 6 children.  They live a simple lifestyle: her husband is a fisherman while she has been engaged in fish vending for almost 10 years. She’s a very industrious woman who never stops selling fish from morning ‘til afternoon every day.  She is a role model mother in her own right, having sent her 2 children to college where they have finished a course, while her 4 children are currently studying in high school.

When she joined ASHI, she started with a loan in the amount of P5, 000 for fish vending but she now needs P10, 000 to start up a variety store with her next loan. She makes sure that her credit performance is always 100%. She wants to open up a variety store with school supplies because her house is very near the elementary school.  To start up a variety store she needs a working capital of Php 10,000 for her next loan to purchase of bulk quantities of school supplies.  

She wants to manage her own store and not suffer under the heat of the sun selling fish from house to house.  Through ASHI  Antonietta is hoping that her dreams will come true, especially to start up a variety store.

loans.use: fish vending

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Mrs Tran Thi H., a 38-year-old mother of four children who go to school, joined TYM in 2003. Her family’s main businesses are raising pigs and operating a wedding service that provides clients with food and drinks, tents, tables, and music.

Their businesses are developing well, providing the family with a stable income. Tran is now requesting a loan to further invest in her wedding service.

loans.use: To invest in her wedding service.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedita Prado L., 40, is married to Mr. Ludy L., and presently resides at Brgy. San Francisco North, Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  She is a flexible mother and a plain housewife, a vendor of fruit and vegetables to help her husband support their family.  She enjoys buying and selling vegetables, her business with her first loan through ASHI in the amount of Php 5,000.  

Mrs. Mercedita is a cheerful mother as she faces those trials that come her way as she lives with her family.  Hunger and poverty are her inspirations because they teach her to be more responsible and strong to handle them.  As she says, “behind the poverty, opportunities comes along”.  

As she was explaining her dreams in life, she felt very emotional, for example she did not finish her studies even in high school, so she doesn’t want her children to be like her.  That is why even though she suffers a lot, she strives to send her children to school up to college level so that they can find a decent job.  

One of her greatest dreams in life is to start up a restaurant right in the town of Tibiao, Antique Philippines. She believes that only ASHI can help her to access a working capital of Php 10,000 from her next loan to start up a restaurant.  Through this loan, she can provide better education for her children and have a stable business for her family.

loans.use: vegetable vending

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., a 36-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are students, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2007. Her family’s main businesses of raising pigs and selling eggs are doing well and yielding them a stable income.  Nguyen is now requesting a loan to invest in her businesses.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Maame Ekua

texts.en:
Maame Ekua S., a single parent with four dependents, was educated through junior high. Buying fish from local fishermen, Maame Ekua processes and preserves them and then sends them to the market for sale at Boatase near Elmina, an activity she has done since 2000. She uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses.

Maame Ekua will use the loan to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save towards building a family house.

loans.use: To buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Mrs. Maricel Oliveros M., 21, is a workaholic mother and a resident of Brgy. San Isidro, Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  Currently she is living together with her parents and her husband and their 2 children.  She and her husband did not finish their studies even up to high school because of poverty. Due to lack of education they cannot find a decent job and that is why her husband decided to work as a “sacada” (plantation laborer) on the island of Negros, Philippines. 

Finally, Maricel joined ASHI to have a working capital of php 5,000 with a term of 50 weeks for  fish vending.  She believes that through ASHI they will be able to rise up from poverty and have a brighter future for their children.  And if she given a chance she would like to become a wholesaler of fish, provided she can manage to get a working capital of Php 10,000 through her next loan.  She plans to link up with the other wholesalers from different towns in the province of Antique or even to deliver to Luzon, the largest island in the Philippines, if she can have access to enough capital for her business someday.

loans.use: fish vending

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame B. is a single parent with four dependants. She has received schooling through the junior high level. Nyame sells fish that she buys from fishermen and brings home for processing and preservation. She sends the fish to the market for sale at Boatase near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Nyame uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, utility bills, and other expenses. This loan will enable Nyame to buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. Nyame plans to use part of the new profits from her expanded business to provide a quality education for her children. The remaining profits will be saved towards a house she wants to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. sells fish that she buys from fishermen and then brings home for processing and preservation. She sends the fish to the market for sale at Boatase, near Elmina. Victoria has received no formal education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. Victoria has been selling fish since 1996. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest towards further educating their children.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. has been selling fish in the market at Elmina since 2006.  She buys the fish from local fishermen and then brings them home for processing and preservation. Elizabeth has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Elizabeth is responsible for paying utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to assist in meeting the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Claude R.. He is 33 years old and married with 4 children and 3 adopted orphans of the 1994 Genocide.

He started his business in 2006, selling lubricants for trucks, cars and motorcycles. He has switched business to hardware, where he sells different building materials like cement, paints, nails, electric lights etc.

He is looking for a loan worth 515000 Frws to add more stock for his clients, since he is speculating on high sales in the Christmas season! He will be repaying his loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
Sobirjon A. raises cattle in his house. He works as the person on duty in an electrical supply store and receives a tiny salary. He is the only provider for his family and his salary is not sufficient. He is married with three children. 

Since 1992, Sobirjon has been raising cattle. In the beginning of 2005, he found out about a microloan fund of IMON. Since that time, he has been working with IMON, showing himself to be reliable client. 

Now, Sobirjon needs a new loan to expand his business and increase his profits. He lives in a village and has no problem feeding additional animals. In the future, Sobirjon plans to expand into the milk processing business. With your help, he can achieve all his goals.

loans.use: To buy cattle and expand the business

loans.name: Dado

texts.en:
Dado J. is 46 years old. He is married and has a son. Dado is a very diligent and hard-working man. He uses his car to provide taxi services inside the city of Khujand. For the last 10 years, his current business had been the main income for the family, allowing Dado to improve the living conditions of his large family. In addition to his wife and son, he is also supporting his parents. 

As with any business that generates income, Dado's business also requires some investment from time to time. Now, his car needs thorough repairs. For this purpose, Dado is requesting 3500 Somoni ($1050 USD) for 12 months. Having proved himself to be a reliable client, Dado promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all who are supporting him.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Kayum

texts.en:
Kayum J. is 45 years old. He is married and is the loving father of 4 children. For 11 years, Kayum has been raising cattle and growing wheat on his land. He is planning to sow wheat on his 2-hectare plot of land. 

He wants a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer, and fuels and lubricants to prepare the land. In addition, he raises cattle with the help of his older sons. He want to spend part of the loan to rebuild his cattle shed. For these purposes, Kayum is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni for 12 months. 

You can become an important part in Kayum family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase fuels and lubricants, and to rebuild his cattle shed

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.en:
Rahbar R. is 46 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of three adult children. Rahbar is a market vendor. For the last 12 years, she has sold cottonseed oil in the local market. Her son helps Rahbar with the business. 

In traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil. In particular, our national dish, "oshi palov" needs lots of cottonseed oil to be delicious. So the goods that Rahbar sells are in high demand among the population. 

Today, Rahbar is planning to expand her business, so she is requesting $1200 USD for 12 months. The loan will be used to purchase cottonseed oil. Rahbar is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cottonseed oil

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Mrs. Maxima A. A. is a member of ASHI in San Francisco North, group 1, Center 38, Tibiao, Antique, Philippines.  She is a 53-year-old mother married to Mr. Enrico A. and has 10 children.  They live in a mountain site of the district of San Francisco North Tibiao, Antique.  She was encouraged to join ASHI because of the principles of the institution: helping women to show their skills through lending them working capital for a business 
as a micro-entrepreneur.  

She used a starting capital of Php 5,000 for charcoal vending, but it's quite dangerous in the community so she had to have a permit from the Municipal Office.  The access to the product in the market is quite difficult, that’s why her daily income cannot cover the needs of her family.  

Her first loan amounting to Php 5,000 got her started in firewood and charcoal vending. She got a one-year term to maintain a good credit rating performance. Because of their dreams, they feet that ASHI will provide a big capital in the near future that they will use in poultry farming so that they can become a supplier of many restaurants in the Municipality of Tibiao.  Maxima needs P10, 000 for a business in native chicken and rice retailing.

She dreams that all her children will finish their studies and they will no longer experience what they experienced before. She marked the day that when she joined ASHI: she begin to dream, hope, and find a way to get out of poverty.

loans.use: Charcoal  Sales

loans.name: Anzhella

texts.en:
Anzhella is married and has two sons. She sells underwear and socks in two city markets - Privos and Lyaseevskaya. Her competitive advantages are good quality and good location of her business place. Being honest and respectful helps her to attract even more customers.

Anzhella has been in this business for many years. She decided to get involved in this business because she knows this particular kind of goods well and the business space she is appropriate for this kind of goods. Her gross income is 3000 UAH, working capital is 3600 UAH. She buys her goods often and sells a lot. The income helps to pay her bills and to raise her two sons. Her oldest son, who is 18 years old, helps in the business.

Anzhella would like to get 1,500 UAH to purchase more socks. This will allow her to offer better variety of warm winter socks and help generate more income for her family. Anzhella is sure that offering good products and showing respect toward her customers can make her business a success.

loans.use: to purchase more socks

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey sells spare parts for Russian and Ukrainian cars. Since these parts are in high demand, this business is quite successful. The working capital is about 7,000 UAH, the gross income is 4,300 UAH. 

Andrey has been an entrepreneur for several years already. He has good business qualities such as honesty and respect toward his customers. He always knows what the clients need. His pricing attracts customers as well. 

Being a hardworking and goal-driven person, Andrey wants to continue to develop his business. Andrey would like to receive 1,500 UAH to purchase more inventory. This will allow him to increase the variety and make his business even more successful.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen Nacional H., 39, married to Cristobal H. and blessed with 4 children, is a resident of San Francisco Norte Tibiao, Antique Philippines. In facing the journey of poverty, she has experienced several challenges that taught her a lot. One thing that she will never forget for the rest of her life is the time when they experienced a financial crisis and she had problems in the relationship with her husband.

One of Helen's dreams is to have her children go all the way through college and get a degree. Mrs Helen H. decided to join ASHI to have a working capital of Php 5,000 to use for her business, vegetable vending and gardening. She is a simple woman with a vision to start up a restaurant, to be manager, and to have a "tricycle" taxi for her husband. She hopes that through ASHI she can achieve her dreams but she needs Php 10,000 for her next loan for her gardening to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds and 1,000 meters of screen to cover her garden to keep it free from insects. If she is provided with this amount she can harvest a lot of vegetables from her garden and she can market them at a nearby town in the Province of Antique Philippines.

Being a dedicated mother for her children, she finds strength from ASHI, an institution with a passion for helping poor women show their skill and ability to lift themselves out of poverty.

loans.use: vegetable gardening and vending

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Mrs. Betty Doroteo S., 52, is a resident of Barangay San Isidro, Tibiao, Antique Philippines. She was blessed with 7 children and six of them have already finished their studies and have a stable job now.  For Betty, education is very important that’s why the couple did everything they could to earn more income just to send their children to school. Like others, she has also had experience with the many challenges of poverty. She mentioned that she  would have to wake up early in the morning  to harvest rice just so that they have something to feed their children. 
 
Betty used her first P5, 000 loan to open up a variety store. She gave her best to establish it and hopes to make it a mini-grocery store someday. She plans to request her second loan amounting to P 10,000 that she will use for this grocery. The sacrifices that she has encountered are her weapon to survive, i.e., through ASHI after a year she will begin to have a mini-grocery.

Her greatest dream is to have a mini-grocery with refreshments situated at their home.   And if possible she can have a branch in the town proper of Tibiao in order to provide employment to others but she needs a working capital of Php 10,000 for her next loan.  Though this is her first time to join a micro-finance institution, she hope that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will in fact give the best direction and opportunity to all members.

loans.use: starting up a variety store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn A., 33, is married to Mr. Henry A.. They are blessed with 3 children and reside in Brgy. San Francisco, Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  Currently they are living with her parents-in-law due to insufficient funds to build their own house.  

Like others, Evelyn had terrible experiences earlier about completing her studies; she worked just to support her brother and sister, since she is the eldest in the family.  Since she has had a family of her own, she is still suffering from the different facets of poverty, especially financial problems.  Thanks to her industry and courage in facing those trials, she started up a variety store as one of her sources of income to cope up with the basic needs of her family.   

One of her greatest dreams is to send her children to school and have them finish their studies.  She also dreams of a stable business and even of having the working capital to become a wholesaler of rice and a retailer as well.  With these dreams she needs a capital of Php 10,000 for her next loan through ASHI.  Giving a chance to have a starting capital of Php 5,000 she aims to do her best to maintain her good performance in ASHI, since this is an opportunity, according to her.

loans.use: variety store

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Mrs Belinda Montero E., 54, is a resident of Brgy. San Francisco North, Tibiao Antique, Philippines.  She finished her Bachelor of Science in Education and practiced her profession for almost 5 years. Unfortunately she did not continue teaching when she was separated from her husband because there was a third party involved with their relationship on her husband's side.  She now stands as a mother and a father for her six children.  

Being a single mother, many challenges and trials come into her life. One of these is a financial problem concerning the medical treatment for her son, who suffers from drug abuse.  She recalls those years when she baked bread and cooked dishes to sell in their neighborhood just to earn income to meet the basic needs of her family.  

Those past experiences have made her become firm in the face of challenges.  Besides, despite being a single mom, she established her 5 children and sent them to school to finish college, and recently they have stable jobs. Being a responsible mother she felt her responsibilities for her children. Currently she wants to have working capital for her own business and not depend on them.  

She is hoping that someday she will be able to start up a restaurant or refreshment stand because she is a good cook but she lacks opportunities because of having no capital.  If she is given a chance and if somebody like ASHI is willing to grant her working capital of Php 10,000 to start with, she will do her best to expand her business and to show her integrity.

loans.use: variety store

loans.name: Delecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Delecia A., 50, is married to Helson A. and blessed with 6 children. Like her they are only at the elementary level in school; they cannot afford to send their children to high school due to financial problems. Presently they reside in the mountain site of San Francisco North, Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  Based on their experiences with poverty, she decided to work as a “sacada” (plantation laborer) in Negros, Philippines.  

When ASHI came to her area, explaining its purpose and vision for less fortunate women, she began to hope that ASHI can give her the opportunity to show her skills such as fruit and vegetable vending.  

Fruit and vegetable vending is a very common job for mothers just to cope with the needs of their family.  Delecia has a great dream that she could establish a business as a rice retailer with her own stand in the municipality of Culasi, Antique near the town of Tibiao, Antique Philippines.  

To realize this dream, she needs a working capital of Php 10,000 to purchase 10 sacks of rice for her business.  Mrs. Delecia has faith in God that she can achieve her dreams someday, if she has patience and is industrious.

loans.use: fruit and vegetable vending

loans.name: Mrs. Sokren Yem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan is made up of eighteen people in Tong Rong Village in Kampong Cham Province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sokren Y., the village bank president, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and earn a living. Her husband, Mr. T. Mol, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine. In this business effort, at present he cannot proceed because he does not have enough material to conduct it. Thus, Mrs. Sokren Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to a palm tree for her husband to climb up and gather palm juice. 

Mrs. Sokren Y. is 34 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child who is too young to wO. or study.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to tie to a palm tree for her husband to climb up and gather palm juice

loans.name: Travail Group

texts.en: Roxy started his business in 1998 with a capital of $100 selling paints. He is 39 years old and has a daughter who is five years old.  He studied at college the art of making paints.  Roxy is planning with Hope’s loans to open a painting business. There is high demand for his paints, and many people like Roxy’s paint and services because he enjoys doing it.  Roxy has been a faithful Hope client since last March. He received three loans which he repaid regularly and completely. Roxy lives and does his business in the Northern area of Kinshasa which is the most populated area of the city.

loans.use: To open a painting business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon K. has a small business that capitalizes on the huge demand for cell phones and related accessories in Tajikistan. He started selling phones four years ago and now has a small stand in a market at the bus station. He is not married yet, but despite his young age, he supports his parents. 

Azamjon’s business is very personal. Often, he will get a request for a specific phone or accessory, and he will make a special effort to find it if he does not have it in stock. At the same time, Azamjon sells SIM cards and cards to replenish of the phone account balance, which are currently in high demand among the population. 

Azamjon has requested a loan to give him extra capital to purchase inventory for his business. IMON Tajikistan is happy to be able to provide the means for Azamjon to strengthen his business and continue working toward his goals.

loans.use: To purchase SIM cards and cards to replenish the phone account balance

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab G. is 28 years old. She is married with two adorable children. 

Zainab sells men’s clothing, such as jackets, suits, and trousers, in the local market. She started her business 9 years ago. At that time, her husband, who is also an entrepreneur, supported Zainab by providing the funds for her start-up. Gradually, Zainab's business has expanded. Hardworking and polite by nature, she has managed to obtain a clientele that is happy with her goods and services. The business generates a stable income for the family. Zainab loves her children very much and she wants all of them to be well educated. 

Today, she is requesting 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for 8 months. She is planning to spend the loan to purchase additional clothes for the cold season. 

You can become an important part in Zainab's family's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving to her.

loans.use: To purchase men’s clothing

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Mavjuda, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. 

Mavjuda is an extremely hardworking and energetic woman. She is 31 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Mavjuda started her own business, because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family's expenses. 

For more than 3 years, she has operated a store where she sells girl’s and women’s underclothes. As a rule, she travels to the neighboring town of Istaravshan to get new garments at very cheap prices. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Mavjuda hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her two children. 

To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. For this purpose, Mavjuda requests 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for a term of 6 months. She promises to repay the loan accurately, as she has done with the previous loan. 

Mavjuda is counting on your help. Be an important of the growth of Mavjuda’s business.

loans.use: To buy new underclothes for girls and women

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
Kodirjon S. is 38 years old. He is married with four school-age children. Kodirjon has been running his business for 5 years. He selling different kinds of decorations for wedding cars. His trading place is located in the center of the city. 

As a rule, Kodirjon works from the early morning until late at night. When serving clients, Kodirjon is polite and friendly. His business is stable, generating the significant income for the family. 

Today, Kodirjon is requesting 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for a term of 4 months. He is planning to purchase various types of decorations to expand his business. 

Kodirjon has been a client of IMON for two years and has a positive credit history. This time, as before, he promises to be accurate when repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase various types of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.en: Mabelle M. is a 27-year-old single woman who lives in the village of Wome, a small town located in a lush and beautiful area of Togo near the Ghanaian border. To provide for her parents and family, Mabelle sells beverages and liquor along the side of the road. She is pictured here in her shop. With this loan from Kiva, Mabelle hopes to travel to Lomé, 130 kilometers away, to restock her inventory with drinks to resell in Wome. With the money she will earn from these sales, she hopes to be able to continue to take care of her maternal family, as well as marry and create a family of her own.

loans.use: To restock her inventory with drinks to resell

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en:
Tuti S. is 48 years old. She is a very wise and hardworking woman. She is married with three children. This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of clothing for children, such as jackets, sweaters, and jeans. 

She started her business 4 years ago. Little by little, she has expanded her inventory and, thanks to the good service she offers, her business is growing rapidly. She says that with the income from her business she is able to provide education and food for her children. 

Now, Tuti needs a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) which she will use to buy children's clothing for the winter season to meet the demand of her clients and to continue growing. She is committed to paying back this loan in 8 months. 

This is the time to help someone who needs it. Please do not hesitate to help improve the quality of life of this family.

loans.use: To purchase children's winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Salimatou Habibou

texts.fr: Salimatou Habibou D., 49 ans, mariée, 10 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des denrées alimentaires pour renforcer  son activité de restauration. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer aux dépenses familiales  Elle sollicite un  prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Salimatou Habibou D., age 49, is married and has ten children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group Sinthiang Coundara for five and a half years. She wants to buy grocery items to bolster her catering business. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des denrées alimentaires pour approvisionner son restaurant.

loans.name: Goundo

texts.fr: Goundo Cissé, 58 ans, mariée avec des enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Missirah depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  acheter des tissus et les produits de teinture pour renforcer son activité de teinture et de commercialisation. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Goundo Cissé, age 58, is married and has children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Missirah for a year and a half. She wants to buy cloth and dye materials to bolster her business in dyeing and marketing. Her income will enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyeing and selling clothing

loans.name: Yaye

texts.fr: Yaye D., 58 ans, veuve avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Missirah depuis 1 an. Elle vend des légumes sur une table et de la glace aussi. Yaye veut acheter et revendre des légumes, du poisson séché, poisson fumé, fruit de mer conditionné et entretenir sa vente de glace avec le paiement de la facture d’électricité. Elle s’est déjà achetée un congélateur vertical et veut renforcer ces activités. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer le bien être familial. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Yaye D., age 58, is a widow with seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Missirah for a year. She sells vegetables, displayed on a table, and also ice, which she sustains with the paying of the electricity bills. Yaye wants to do trade in vegetables, dried fish, smoked fish, and packaged seafood. She has already purchased an upright freezer and wants to bolster her business. Her income enables her to improve the family's well-being. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fish, seafood, and to make and sell ice

loans.name: Racine Group

texts.en: Blaise runs a general boutique. He sells soaps, containers, sugar, salt, toilet papers, candles, matches, and so on. He has been in business since 2002. He began his business running a telephone booth, but in 2006 he fell sick and was hospitalized for three weeks. After recovering, Blaise decided to change the business by opening a general boutique in 2007. After learning through his friend about Hope’s loan program, he decided to join one of its groups in February 2008. Blaise has already received two loans from Hope that he repaid correctly. With his next loan he plans to extend his business by adding others items such as phone accessories. Blaise is 35 years old and a father of a 5-month-old baby. Blaise runs his business in the Northern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To add to the phone booth others items such as phone accessories

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
In the little barangay of Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Lourdes P., 61 years old, used to operate a copra-buying business. Her husband was her greatest business partner for 20 years. They educated their 2 children from their copra-buying business. Life is not so tough for the family to survive. The business they operated was good and their neighbors are their loyal customers, but the family would like to venture into a mini grocery store. They want to help their neighborhood by providing a store that has it all. They know that this business would not be possible without help. Paglaum MPC came as a resource for their capital needs. They applied for a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase additional stocks for their store and for store improvement as well.

Lourdes and her husband have a big wish for their “apo” (grandchild) to finish his studies. But above all, they want to serve the community and for their business to flourish.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stocks for her store and store construction

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: Yola tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 5 añitos, vive en la casa de su madre. Desde los 16 años trabajaba en un restaurante como ayudante de cocina, pero hace un año decidió poner una tienda donde vende, alquila y reproduce CDs de música y películas. Este negocio, por el momento, le es muy rentable porque no tiene competidor, ella siempre añoró ese tipo de negocio. Su esposo trabaja en la chacra y cuando ya no tiene que cultivar le ayuda en el negocio, la dificultad primaria es que no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir su negocio y convertirlo en un espacio más atractivo y acogedor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero piensa comprar varios millares de CDs en blanco y películas de todas los tipos.
texts.en:
Yola, 19, is partnered and has a 5 year old son. She lives with her mother. When she was 16 years old, she started working in a restaurant as an assistant to the cook, but a year ago she decided to set up a shop where she sells, rents and reproduces music and movie CDs. For now, the business is very profitable because she doesn't have any competitors. She always yearned for this kind of business. Her husband is a farm laborer and when he's not working, he helps her with her business. Her main obstacle now is that she doesn't have enough capital to stock the business or make the space she uses for it more attractive and inviting. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money, she plans to buy a few thousand blank CDs and movies of all kinds.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs for resale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 32 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ella realiza diversas actividades, tiene dos hectáreas sembradas de plátanos, y cítricos, cuando termina de cultivar o cosechar se dedica a trabajar como peón en la fabricación de cajones de fruta, pero esta temporada se propuso preparar y vender comida en el mercado, los días de feria, ya que es tanta la demanda que le llega a faltar comida esos dias, le es muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias. Su dificultad es que no tiene un puesto fijo en el mercado y los vigilantes de la municipalidad la desalojan de cada lugar donde la encuentren. Con el dinero solicitado comprará utensilios adecuados para la venta de comida, y víveres para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son. She partakes in several business activities. She has two hectares of plantains and citrus, but when she finishes growing and picking her crops, she makes fruit crates. This season, however, she set out to sell food at the market on market days. Demand is so high that she runs out of food on some days. This business is very lucrative and yields good profits. Her problem is that she does not have a fixed booth at the market, so the municipality guards evict her from wherever they find her. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase cooking utensils for food sales and the supplies needed for food preparation.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils and provisions

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 26 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y trabaja para ellos. De niño se dedicaba a la siembra de cítricos y demás frutas, pero hace 6 años viene talando arbolés y tiene sus clientes ya conocidos a quienes provee de madera, para la elaboración de cajones de fruta. Su actividad inicia a las 4.00am se va a las profundidades de la selva a buscar los arbolés maduros, compra cada tallo a S/.20.00 y el los vende a S/ 36.00 ya trozados en trocos. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, todo este tiempo solventa así sus gastos, solo encuentra dificultades en tiempos de lluvia, ya que no puede sacar su carga. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP. El haber accedido a este préstamo le permitirá comprar un motor de aserrar para facilitar su actividad.
texts.en:
Esteban is 26 years old, single, lives with his parents, and works for them. Since he was a boy he has grown citrus and other fruit trees, but six years ago he began cutting down trees. He now has an established clientele for whom he provides wood to be made into fruit crates. He begins working at 4:00am, when he goes deep into the forest to look for mature trees. He pays S/20.00 (approximately US $6.50) for each tree and then sells the cut wood for S/36.00 (approximately US $11.50). It is a very profitable enterprise, and for most of the year he completely covers his expenses. During the rainy season, however, he cannot remove the trees from the forest. This is his fourth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA. With this loan he will purchase a table saw which will greatly facilitate his work.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a table saw

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D., 45 ans, mariée, 05 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tanaff depuis 5 ans. Elle achète des tissus et des produits pour faire la teinture et vendre, elle vend des légumes au marché et gère un restaurant. Mariama veut renforcer  ses diverses  activités. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé, de scolarité de sa famille  Elle sollicite un  prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama D., 45, married and raising 5 children, has been a member of the village bank of Tanaff for 5 years. She buys cloth and products for dyeing and sells them. She sells vegetables in the market and manages a little restaurant.

Mariama wants to bolster her various businesses. Her income permits her to contribute to improving living conditions, health, and schooling for her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth, vegetables, dyeing products, and food ingredients for her little restaurant

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y su única hija. Desde joven conoció la agricultura como una actividad muy rentable, cuando se casó sembró en grandes cantidades, las ganancias le dieron la oportunidad de comprar un vehículo, ahora, con su carro realiza taxi, sin dejar de cultivar de modo alternado. Con el taxi gana diariamente S/.40.00, las dificultades se presentan cuando el carro se malogra y tiene que hacer cambiar las piezas, las cuales son muy caras. Pero en general, está muy contento con la actividad que realiza. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado tiene previsto cambiar las llantas de su auto, y también comprará abono para su chacra de cítricos.
texts.en:
Feliciano is a 43-year-old married man who lives with his wife and only daughter. Ever since he was young, he realized that agriculture is a very lucrative line of work. When he got married, he planted a great amount of crops. The profits obtained from his crops gave him the opportunity to purchase a car, with which he now offers taxi services, while still cultivating on the side. He makes 40.00 PEN with his taxi cab, but he faces difficulties when his car breaks down and he has to purchase parts, which are very expensive. In general, he is very happy with this business. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money being requested, he plans on replacing his car tires and purchasing fertilizer for his citrus farm.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his taxi cab

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, su esposa e hija, por el momento viven en la ciudad, él vive con su padre. Desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, su padre es propietario de varias parcelas de terreno con acceso a la carretera, por ello que siembran en todas sus chacras, mayormente cultivan carambolas y demás frutas cítricas, cuando es tiempo de cosecha, envían sus frutas por camión a la ciudad. Sembrar carambolas le es muy rentable, porque es una planta que una vez que empieza a dar fruto no detiene su producción, es por ello que casi en todas sus chacras han sembrado carambolas, Fidel conoce muy bien cuando abonar y cuidar adecuadamente la planta. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará insecticidas para evitar a las mosquitas que perjudican las hojas a las carambolas, también comprará abono para su chacra.
texts.en:
Fidel, 41, is partnered. His wife and daughter are living in the city for now, while he's living with his father. He's worked on farms since he was a boy. His father owns some land with access to a road so they can plant all over the land. They mostly grow "carambolas" [a kind of mango] and citrus fruits. At harvest time, they deliver their fruit to the city by truck. Growing carambolas is very profitable because once it starts to fruit, it doesn't quit. That's why almost the entire farm is planted in carambolas. Fidel well knows when to fertilize and how to adequately care for the crop. This is his third MFP loan. With the money, he will buy insecticides to ward off the bugs that damage the leaves of the carambolas. He'll also buy fertilizer for the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Fortunata
