texts.es: Fortunata tiene 39 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. De niña se dedicaba a la agricultura, después que se comprometió estaba al cuidado de sus hijos, hace un año a decidió vender gaseosas, y hace 4 meses a comprado un mostrador para la venta de golosinas, porque a ella le encanta estar ocupada y sobre todo, si esto le genera un ingreso económico. Para ampliar su negocio quiere vender cerveza, porque nota que es muy rentable, solo que le falta una refrigeradora para que pueda vender las cervezas y las gaseosas heladas. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 39 years old and married. She and her husband have two children. From the time she was young she worked in agriculture. After she got married she was busy caring for her children. She decided a year ago to start a business selling sodas and drinks, and 4 months ago she purchased a display case for the sodas. She likes to stay busy and above all, this helps generate needed income. To grow her business, she would like to start sellling beer, as she realizes there's a lot of demand. So far she doesn't have a refrigerator to keep the beer and drinks cold. This will be her 5th loan with MFP. The money will be used to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business with sodas and drinks

loans.name: Ubaldo Miguel

texts.es: El señor Ubaldo A. es una persona de 25 años de edad, con residencia en el Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán, Guatemala, trabaja en la artesanía, fabricante de cortes típicos de diferentes diseños, casado  y con dos hijos, debido a la demanda que tiene de cortes típicos, se ve obligado a incrementar su capital y taller de telares, por lo que se acerco a la asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo de Q3,504.00 quetzales la cual utilizara para la compra de materia prima y así poder incrementar su producción de cortes típicos. Con la visión de poder mejorar su condición de vida de su familia y ayudar a sus dos hijos a que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que en los tiempos de su niñez sus padres no le pudieron dar la oportunidad de estudiar. Siendo una persona reconocida en su comunidad sin malos antecedentes.
texts.en:
Mr. Ubaldo A. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez in the Totonicapán Region of Guatemala. He works in the handicraft production of typical native dress of various designs. He is married with two kids. Due to the demand of native weaves, he needs to increase his capital and the loom workshop. He approached ASDIR to apply for a loan of 3,504 quetzales to buy raw materials and increase production. As a child his parents were unable to give him the opportunity to study so his dream today is to improve the quality of life for his family and send his two children to school. He is recognized figure in his community and has a good record.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (To raise capital)

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 46 años de edad, es casado tiene 5 hijos, ahora vive con dos de ellos y su esposa. Desde hace muchos años atrás se dedica a la compra y venta de muebles, los compra de la cárcel, fabricados por presos, luego los lleva a  la ciudad de Lima para la venta, ha notado que le es muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias. Por el momento no tiene muchos pedidos de muebles, entonces se está dedicando a la construcción de cajones para fruta. Esta actividad lo saca de sus apuros económicos porque diario le pagan S/.20, además también siembra cítricos. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP. El dinero será invertido en la compra de sus muebles, luego del 15 de diciembre viajará a Lima para negociarlos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old and married with 5 children. Two of the children still live at home with him and his wife. For many years, Francisco has worked buying and selling furniture. He buys the furniture from a prison, where it is made by the inmates, and then he brings it to the city of Lima to sell. He has found this to be a viable business which generates good income. Lately, he has not had as many requests for furniture, so he has been constructing crates for fruit. This helps him supplement his business because he earns about 20 soles each day from selling the crates. He is also growing citrus fruits. This will be his 5th loan with MFP. The money will be used to purchase more furniture, so that after December 15 he will be able to travel to Lima to sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more furniture which he will resell in Lima

loans.name: Mary Nakayima’S Group

texts.en:
Mary is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 60-year-old single mother. She had three children but all died and Mary takes care of the four orphans of her late children. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she is staying with five people and only two people bring in additional income to the family. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Mary works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She doesn’t use public transport as she buys from delivery vans, and also there is depot nearby. She operates a pub at her home. Mary sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. Mary sells to all categories of people, excluding children under 18 years. Mary has been in this business for over ten years. She owns a bakery in the village, besides the pub business. She has been with MCDT for eight years working all this time with the same group mates and servicing her twentieth loan. Mary wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and beers and necklaces. She is aspiring to build rental rooms in the plot she bought from previous loans.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es: Gabina tiene 33 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos que están en la etapa escolar. Cuando era soltera trabajaba en una casa limpiando y como niñera, cuando se casó se dedicó a su hogar y al cuidado de sus, pero ahora que ellos están más grandes y tiene mayores gastos, ha empezado a trabajar en la fabricación de cajones de frutas, al día le pagan entre S/. 15.00 a S/.20.00. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para dejar la comida preparada, trabaja de 8.00am hasta 5.00pm, se siente muy bien, le gusta elaborar cajones, no dice, por las tardes también se da tiempo para realizar el servicio de lavado de ropa. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero que Gabina solicita será usado para solventar los gastos educativos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gabina is 33 years old and married with two children who attend school. When she was single, Gabina worked as a housekeeper and nanny. When she got married, she was dedicated to caring for her home and her children. Now that her children are a bit older and the household costs are higher, she has begun to work again making crates for fruit. She is able to earn betwen 15 and 20 soles a day. She gets up at 4 in the morning to prepare the meals for her family, then she works from 8 to 5. She feels good about the work, and likes making the crates. In the afternoons she still has time to do the laundry. This is her 4th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The money will be used to help cover school costs for her children.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help cover school expenses for her children

loans.name: Israel Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Israel Feliciano S. Vásquez, de 41 años, la cual se dedica a la fabricación de cortes típicos, cuenta con 25 años de experiencia, ya que cuando fue joven laboro para doña Juana García, quienes se dedicaban también a la fabricación de cortes típicos, de donde adquirió experiencia en las diferentes etapas para la elaboración de los materiales de este tipo de artesanía, siendo entusiasta inicio su propio taller de fabricación de cortes típicos, en donde fue creciendo poco a poco a través de los prestamos que adquirió en la Asociación ASDIR, por lo que ahora cuenta con demasiada demanda y solicita un préstamo de Q, 5, 508.00, quetzales para comprar mas telares y materia prima, para así poder incrementar su capital, ya que con ello también ayudara a que mejoren la condición de vida de su familia y ayudara a generar dos fuentes de empleo en su comunidad del Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán Guatemala.
texts.en:
Mr. Israel Feliciano S. Vásquez, is 41 years old and works in the handicraft of typical native dress. He has 25 years experience, having worked for Mrs. Juana García in the same business when he was younger and learned the different stages of processing the materials. Empowered by that experience, Israel started his own handicraft workshop for typical native dress, growing slowly with the help of loans he acquired through the ASDIR Association. He is now in high demand and is applying for a loan of 5,508 quetzales to buy more looms and raw materials, in order to increase his capital, so that he can improve the quality of life for his family and help generate two sources of employment in his community of Caserío Chotacaj, Aldea Vásquez in the Totonicapán Region of Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (To raise capital)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 47 años, es casada, tiene 7 hijos, ahora viven con ella 3 de ellos. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura, actualmente es una madre de familia muy eficiente, pera ello se levanta 4.00 am. para dejar listo el menú de sus hijos, luego se va la chacra, después de cosechar encajona todas las frutas para enviarlas al mercado. A ella le agrada mucho la actividad que realiza, por ello no siente que trabaja, lo hace con mucho cariño y además le es muy rentable. La dificultad es en el momento de transportar la fruta a los mercados y no tiene como  llevarlas. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP. El dinero será invertido en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de los cajones que le sirven para embalar sus frutas.
texts.en:
Julia is 47 years old and married with 7 children. 3 of the children still live at home. From the time she was very young Julia worked in agriculture. Today she is the mother of a very efficient family. She gets up at 4 in the morning to prepare the childrens meals for the day, after that she goes to the fields. After picking the fruit, she packs all the fruits in crates to bring them to the market. Julia likes her work and it is a good business. The difficulty is when it's time to transport the fruit to market and she doesn't have enough crates. This is her 4th loan with MFP. The money will be used to purchase the materials needed to make more crates for packing the fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the materials needed to make crates for fruit

loans.name: Señor De Potocchi Group

texts.en:
The Señor D. Potochi Village Bank is located in the Ascensión community of the Huancavelica Department. The district is popular with tourists, since it has some thermal baths, which are separated by the Ichu River.

Rosa Muño is married and has a small store, which she runs with the help of her husband. He used to work as a janitor at a local school, but is now retired and receives a pension. “I’ve learned to save and how to distribute my money within my business,” she says. She will use her loan to buy construction materials for her store and to pay the rent.

Aurelia C. is married and has a store where she sells drinks, dry goods, and sweets. Years ago, her husband had an accident and as a result her business suffered, so now she uses her loans to buy more merchandise to restock the store. Her dream is to have a business to train women to weave and do handicrafts.

Blanca A. is married and has an 8-year-old son. She has a boutique which she would like to stock with more things such as cosmetics. She also wants to save up to buy a home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El bancomunal Señor D. Potochi, esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Ascensión en el departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta es una zona turística cuenta con aguas termales separadas por el Rio Ichu.

Rosa Muño, es casada, tiene una pequeña tienda que trabaja con el apoyo D. su esposo que trabajaba como personal D. servicio en un Colegio, ya dejo D. trabajar y ahora cobra su seguro. “He aprendido a ahorrar y a saber distribuir el dinero D. mi negocio”. Su préstamo lo utilizará en comprar materiales D. construcción para su tienda y también para dar en alquiler.

Aurelia C., es casada, tiene una tienda D. bebidas, abarrotes y golosinas. Hace años su esposo se accidento y su negocio bajo, por eso ahora sus prestamos los utiliza en comprar mas mercadería, su sueño es tener una empresa para capacitar a mujeres en tejidos y artesanías.

Blanca A., es casada y tiene un hijo D. 8 años, tiene una boutique a la cual le gustaría surtir con mas cosas y así equipar su negocio, le gustaría comprar mas cosméticos y ahorrar para comprar su casa.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, to pay the rent, etc.

loans.name: Berna Namuli’S Group

texts.en:
Berna is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with 1 child, aged 14 years. Her children go to school. Berna takes care of her old parents She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with three people. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Berna works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala, operating a retail shop. She uses public transport to and from work. Berna buys crates from delivery vans. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. Berna sells to all categories of people excluding children below 18 years, but on a retail basis. Berna has been in this business for five years, working seven days a week. Before starting this pub business, she was selling porridge to market dwellers and cyclists. She is faced with a challenge of competition and transportation. She has been with MCDT for eight years working all this time with the same group mates and servicing her eighteenth loan. Berna wants to use this very loan to buy other crates of beer. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 48 años, es casada tiene cuatro hijos, ahora vive con tres de ellos. Desde los 25 años se dedicó al negocio de venta de comida en las ferias, con esfuerzo pudo adquirir su propia casa donde ahora tiene un restaurante y le va muy bien. Los más fieles de sus clientes son los transportistas, los días no puede abrir su negocio, la buscan impacientes. La venta de comida le es muy rentable, también aprovecha en vender gaseosas y cervezas. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero piensa comprar bebidas y cervezas, además de víveres para la preparación del menú diario.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and married with 4 children. 3 of the children still live at home. For 25 years, Julia has worked selling food at the markets. With a lot of effort, she was able to buy her own house where she runs a small restaurant. The truckers are her most loyal customers, and on the days when she can't open her business, they are all waiting impatiently for her to reopen. The business is good, and she also sells sodas and beer to generate additional income. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money, she wants to purchase more drinks and beer, as well as ingredients needed to prepare the daily meals she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages for her restaurant, as well as ingredients for the daily menu she offers

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: La señora Maria Santos Vásquez B. que desde los 16 años de edad, emprendió su taller en la fabricación de cortes típicos, gracias a los conocimientos que le dejaron sus padres, aprendió las diferentes etapas para la elaboración, teniendo en la actualidad 55 años de edad, no ha dejado aun su profesión, casada y con dos hijos aun bajo su cargo aun. Sobresaliendo a través de los prestamos que ha tenido en la asociación ASDIR, ha podido crecer dentro de su taller, la cual ahora solicita un crédito de 5, 508.00 quetzales, en donde lo utilizara para la compra de dos telares mas, como también  materia prima, ya que piensa heredar los conocimientos a sus hijos, por lo cual sus hijos trabajaran para generar mas ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida de su familia, teniendo el fin principal de poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Siendo una persona reconocida en la comunidad de la aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Santos Vásquez B. is a 55-year-old mother of two. She has worked in the weaving of typical native dress since she was 16 years, having learned the different process stages from her parents, and she has never left the profession. She grew the business with loans from the ASDIR Association and was able to grow within her workshop. She is now applying for a 5,508 quetzales loan, which she'll use to buy two more looms and raw materials. She plans to hand down her knowledge to her children, so they can continue the business to generate more income and improve their quality of life for their families, but her first goal is to cover the current client demand. She is a recognized person within the town of Vásquez in the Totonicapán Region.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (To buy two looms and raw materials)

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos L. S., casada y oficios domésticos, con 35 años de edad, con dirección en la aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán, Guatemala, emprenderá su taller en la elaboración de cortes típicos, ya que uno de sus hijos es empleado de doña Lucia Chuc, personas quienes se dedican al mismo trabajo, tiene ya el conocimiento del proceso de este producto, por lo que siendo entusiastas solicitan a la asociación ASDIR, un crédito de un monto de Q5, 508.00, por un plazo de 12 meses, para la compra de dos telares y todos los accesorios necesarios para que se forme un pequeño taller de fabricación de cortes típicos, ya que ellos no quieren depender mas de otras personas, la cual con esto podrán mejorar su condición de vida de su familia y así poder generar mas ingresos y conforme al tiempo hacer crecer su fabricación de cortes típicos. Teniendo como visión ser una empresa de distribución masiva de cortes típicos en el área de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos L. S. is a 35-year-old married homemaker, living in the town of Vásquez in the Totonicapán Region of Guatemala. She is starting a workshop for weaving typical native dress, with her son who already knows the business, having worked with Mrs.Lucia Chuc who works in the same field, so he knows the process of creating articles of native dress. They are very eager to apply for this loan of 5,508 quetzales with the ASDIR Association, to be repaid over 12 months, in order to buy two looms and the necessary accessories to build a small manufacturing workshop for native weaves. They no longer wish to be dependent on others. With this business they will be able to improve the quality of life for their family, generate an income, and, over time, grow production. Their vision is to become a mass distributor of typical native dress in the Totonicapán Region.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (To raise capital)

loans.name: Jazmina De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Jazmina tiene 31 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Sabana grande, es madre soltera y con un hijo de 8 años de edad, que lo tiene estudiando en la escuela del barrio, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos desde hace siete años esta en las ventas, el cual inicio con dinero que presto en Afodenic para aumentar las ventas pues vendía poco, lo cual logro aumentar su inventario y captar mas clientes. Con esta solicitud seria la tercera, la cual va invertir en comprar ropa, camisas escolares. A largo plazo es adquirir más clientes, vender otros productos y ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Jazmina is 31 years old and lives in the “Sabana Grande” neighborhood of Managua. She is a single mother to an 8-year-old son who attends school in the neighborhood. For seven years she has sold clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She began her business with a loan from Afodenic which enabled her to increase her inventory and attract more customers. Prior to her initial loan, she had sold very little. This will be her third loan, and she intends to invest it in clothing and school uniforms. In the long term, she wants to expand her customer base, sell more products, and help her son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carmen tiene 46 años de edad,  habita en anexo a villa Libertad, en la capital de Managua, es soltera y no tiene hijos, logro poner una pulpería, aparte que vende tortillas, gas licuado, desde hace doce años, lo cual comenzó vendiendo solo tortillas, y frijoles, con dinero propio lo cual ahorro y puso la pulpería, con este crédito quiere para invertir en materia prima en la compra de granos básicos y aceite, lo cual se vende mas. A largo plazo desea terne una distribuidora para hacer crecer su capital, y poder subsistir.
texts.en:
Carmen is 46 years old and lives in the Villa Libertad neighborhood of Managua. She is single and does not have children. For twelve years she has had a small general store where she sells tortillas and cooking gas. She began her business by selling tortillas and beans. She used her own money and saved until she had enough to open the store. She plans to invest this loan in staple ingredients such as grains and oil, her store's most popular items. In the long term, she would like to become a distributor so that her profits will increase and she will be able to live well.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and oil

loans.name: Doris Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Doris tiene 53 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama primero de Mayo, del colegio 2 andenes al sur, su esposo es jubilado lo cual recibe su pensión mensual, tiene dos hijos los cuales están casados y son independientes, su negocio es una disco móvil que se llama Extremo la tiene desde hace nueve años, la cual inicio con su hijo mayor con la ayuda de su papa, lo cual el se fue fuera del país lo cual ahora la administra ella. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar el porche. A futuro es comprar mejores equipos para que tenga mejor sonido la disco móvil, y así poder tener mas  contratos, y obtener mejores ganancias, para mejorar cada día su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doris is 53 years old and lives two blocks south of the high school in the First of May neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension. She has two children who are married and financially independent. Her business is a disco called “Extremo” (“Extreme”). She began the business nine years ago with her elder son. As he has moved out of the country, she currently manages the business by herself. She requests this loan to purchase construction materials to remodel the porch which houses the disco. In the future, Doris would like to invest in better equipment to upgrade the sound quality of the disco. She will then be able to get more contracts and increase her profits so that she can continue to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel the porch

loans.name: Gwokyalya Erena’Sgroup

texts.en:
Erena is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is 43 and married with 6 children, aged between 10 and 21 years. All her children go to school. Erena takes care of her old parents. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with five people. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea.

Erena works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from work. She sells to an average of 20 customers day, and besides selling beer, she sells to all categories of people. Erena has been in this business for five years working six days a week. She is faced with a challenge of seasonality and medication. She has been with MCDT for four years working all this time with the same group mates and wants to use this very loan to have a permanent place and aspires to educating her children up to university level.

loans.use: To built a permanet place for her business

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La Sr. Martha tiene 44 años de edad, habitante del barrio José Urbina, madre soltera con dos hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad los tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Doña Martha trabaja como cocinera desde hace 2 años trabajarle a una empresa privada. Sus planes son construir su casa de concreto y tener mejores condiciones económica y social. Anteriormente trabajaba en una zona franca como operaria pero no obtenía suficiente ingreso y los horarios no le permitían estar con sus hijos y decidió cambiar de trabajo. Agracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedra, hierro, perlines para brindarle a su familia una mayor seguridad y comodidad, ya que su casa esta actualmente de hecha de zinc y el piso es de tierra.
texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old and lives in the José Urbina neighborhood. She is a single mother with two children (ages 14 and 17) who attend high school in the capital. For two years Martha has worked as a cook for a private company. She plans to build a concrete house and to work towards having better economic and social conditions. Previously, Martha worked in a free trade zone but did not have sufficient income and the schedule did not allow her to spend time with her children, so she decided to change jobs. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, Martha has been able to buy construction materials like cement, sand, rocks, iron, and steel girders. These materials will provide her family with greater comfort and security, since her house is currently constructed of zinc and has an earthen floor.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: Doña Angela Maritza está solicitando a AFODENIC refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción del pantri ), trabaja como Afanadora del Hospital Jacinto Hernández,  desde hace 22 años, tiene 2 hijos: la mayor de 15 años estudia 4to año de Educación Secundaria y el menor de 10 años estudia 5to grado de Educación primaria, su esposo trabaja como Auxiliar de Mantenimiento en el Hospital, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar,  doña Angela es una mujer  responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy humilde, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, ella se siente agradecida con esta institucion ya con los créditos anteriores obtenidos ha mejorado su vivienda y ha comprado electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia,  su sueño es  que sus hijos estudien, tener salud y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Angela Maritza would like AFODENIC to refinance her seventh loan to remodel her home by constructing built-in cabinetry. For twenty-two years she has worked as a cleaner at Jacinto Hernández Hospital. She has two children. The elder is 15 and in the fourth year of secondary school. Her younger child is 10 years old and in fifth grade. Her husband works as a maintenance assistant at the hospital. She and her husband share household expenses. Angela is a responsible, honest, hard-working, and humble woman. She lives in Zone 2 of the New Guinea neighborhood, an area where the population grows daily. She is grateful to AFODENIC for previous loans that have enabled her to improve her home. She has purchased electronic appliances which have greatly enhanced living conditions for herself and her family. Angela's dream is that her children continue to study, maintain good health, and find stable employment so that they can help their family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a pantry

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne Dovenon was born around 1966 in Sehoue and she married Whadab Houadegla, a geographer. She has 4 children and Farelle is 2 years and 9 months old. After her failure in BECP, she received training to be a typist, but ended up not pursuing it. Instead, she helped her mother to sell bundles of firewood, manioc flour (a traditional Beninese food), and drinks. After the birth of her first child, who is now 13 years old, she started her own business and took after her mother's. Now she is attepting to diversify with more consumer items. With her second loan, she would like to buy liquor, detergents, and preservatives.

Dame DOVENON Anne est née vers 1966 à Sèhouè d'où elle est originaire, elle est mariée à HOUADEGLA Whahab qui est géographe de profession et est mère de 04 enfants dont Farelle de 2 ans 9 mois. Après son échec au BECP, elle a reçut une formation en datylographie qu'elle n'a pas finalement exercé. Elle aidait sa mère à vendre les fagôts de bois, de la farine de manioc et de la boisson traditionnelle.Après la naissance de son premier enfant qui a aujourd'hui 13 ans, elle s'est mise à son propre compte en vendant les mêmes articles que sa mère. elle exerce jusqu'à cette date la même activité mais en prenant le soin de diversifier avec la vente des savons et divers autres articles de grande consommation. Pour satisfaire ses clients elle a sollicité ce 2 eme prêt en vue d'aggrandir son étalage.

loans.use: 2 drums of 50 liters of sodabi liquor, detergents, and a box of preservatives

loans.name: Martina Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Martina  está solicitando a AFODENIC refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una Habitación), trabaja como Jefe de Operaciones en Finca Nicaragua, vive  en la zona # 2  de Nueva Guinea, a pesar que ella no tiene hijos es una joven que ha luchado para que a su ancianos padres no les falte nada, pues como es la hija menor, vive con ellos para atenderlos en lo que mas pueda, Martina  es una mujer profesional, responsable, honesta,  trabajadora, profesa  la religión católica, su sueño es tener un porvenir mejor, estudiar una maestria,  tener una vivienda bonita, trabajo, y tratar que a sus padres no les falte nada del hogar.
texts.en:
Martina would like AFODENIC to refinance her third loan in order to construct a new bedroom in her home. She works as Chief of Operations at “Finca Nicaragua,” and lives in Zone 2 of the New Guinea neighborhood. Although she has no children, Martina is a young woman who has worked hard so that her aging parents do not want for anything. Since she is their youngest daughter, she lives with and cares for them. Martina is a professional woman. She is responsible, honest, hard-working, and Catholic. Her dream is to have a better future. She wants to earn a master's degree, have a beautiful house, be gainfully employed, and make sure that her parents have a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a bedroom

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina M. is 35 years old, married, and a mother of three children. Two of them are in school, while the last born is still breastfeeding. Faustina works very hard because she has the added responsibility of wanting her kids to attend the university some day.

She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She sells her products by ‘hawking’, which is door to door sales. Faustina is an achiever and is focused on saving enough money to support her kids in school.

She wants to use the loan to purchase additional plastic materials and kitchen sets to sell to her customers. She would be very grateful for this loan.

Faustina M. is a member of the community group called “Nnown” (meaning song) Group. The members in this group serve as guarantees to one another to access and repay the loans. She does not sell on the days the group meets. Her photo was taken during one of the group meetings.

loans.use: Purchase additional plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Doña Petrona  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar la casa), trabaja en el Hospital Jacinto Hernández como supervisora desde hace 28 años, iene una hija mayor de edad, ella desde muy joven asumio  el rol de madre y padre para su hija, se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora que ha luchado por ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda ubicada  en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea,  este barrio recientemente se poblo y cada día se va aumentando su población,  Petrona es una mujer con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral, que ama su trabajo,  a pesar que no tiene a su hija a cargo ella cuida a su mamá ya que esta bien viejita,  su sueño es tener estabilidad, salud y una vivienda  bonita ,  doña Petrona se siente muy gradecida con AFODENIC, ya que con los créditos anteriores logro construir poco a poco su vivienda y de esta manera brinda mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona A. is applying for her fifth loan to invest in improving her home (whitewashing the house). She has worked at the Hospital Jacinto Hernández as a supervisor for the past 28 years and she has a grown daughter, for whom she took on the role of both mother and father at an early age. She is very responsible, honest and hard-working, and has striven to improve her home bit by bit, located in the urban center of Nueva Guinea, a recently populated neighborhood and growing daily. Petrona is a woman of high spirits both personally and at work, which she loves. Although her daughter does not live with her, she does take care of her very elderly mother. Her dream is to have stability, health and a nice home. Petrona is grateful to AFODENIC for the previous loans which helped her slowly build her home and this way she could bring greater comfort to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement: To whitewash the house

loans.name: Celia Bernanbe

texts.es:
Celia inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar, inicio el negocio ya que le daba la posibilidad de generar un ingreso sin tener que estar con un horario establecido como seria en alguna empresa además así no descuidarla a sus hijos,  por eso trato de combinar el negocio con el hogar. 
Empezó a vender calzado por catalogo  a sus familiares y amigos y poco a poco fue haciendo mas clientes  y logro tener mejores ganancias.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4000 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir nueva mercancía para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Celia started her business because she needed to help cover family expenses. She began the business because it gave her the ability to generate income with having a set schedule as happens with some businesses. With a flexible schedule she does not have to leave her children, so she tries to combine work with home. She began catalog shoe sales to friends and family, and little by little she has gathered more clients. In turn, she has improved her earnings. Now she needs a loan of $325, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to supply new merchandise for the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Eufemia Nicolasa

texts.es: La Sr. Eufemia tiene 54 años de edad, casada y su esposo es albañil y cultiva frijoles y plátanos a 50 Km. al sur de la capital. La clienta habita en Healeah,  ella es ama de casa y recibe una pensión del seguro social por haber laborado como conserje en un colegio por más de 15 años. Todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y sus planes es la construcción de su casa y aumentar la cantidad de cultivo de frijoles. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograr sus planes podrán realizarlos, sus metas de salir adelante con sus cultivos y la construcción de su casa, de su baño y servicio higiénico para obtener mayor comodidad en su casa.
texts.en:
Eufemia is 54 years old, married, and her husband is a bricklayer and cultivates beans and bananas 50 Km south of the capitol. Eufemia lives in Healeah, she is the woman of the house and receives a pension from social security for having worked as an adviser at a college for more than 15 years. All of her children are grown and her plans are to to build onto her home and improve the quantity of beans they cultivate. Thanks to the loans of Afodenic, she can accomplish her goals of advancing cultivation and building a hygienic bathroom to be more comfortable in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia siempre ha tratado de salir adelante dedicándose a las ventas porque requiere dedicarle tiempo a sus 2 pequeños hijos de 6 y 3 años. Ella inició su negocio por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar, ya que en un lugar de trabajo perdería mucho tiempo que puede dedicar a su familia, con los ingresos que iba obteniendo de las ventas que hacia fue que logro poner su  estética a la cual ahora se dedica al 100% y le permite estar al pendiente de su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en meses para  comprar algunos artículos que requiere para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesenia has always tried to succeed in sales, as well as reserve time to spend with her two small children, ages 6 and 3. She began her business to help cover the family's expenses, and because her old job did not afford her much time to spend with her family. With the income she earned in her former job, she opened a beauty salon in her house. She is now 100% dedicated to her salon, and is able to work and watch over her children at the same time. Yesenia would like a loan of MXN $4,000, to purchase beauty products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes empezó con el negocio ya que es una mujer le gusta salir adelante y no estar solo con el ingreso  que le da su esposo. Es madre de tres hijos de  2, 8, y 11 años y su esposo trabaja como taxista. Ella se dedica  la venta de ropa , poco a poco junto dinero para comprar una paca de ropa y así fue que inicio su negocio con las ganancia que va obteniendo lo re-invierte para comprar mas mercancía. 

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir nueva mercancía.
texts.en:
Lourdes started her own business because she is an enterprising woman who does not want to rely solely on her husband as a source of income. She is the mother of three children, ages 2, 8 and 11. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells clothing and saves money little by little to buy another bundle of clothing. She was able to start her business through this process of reinvesting her earnings in the purchase of additional merchandise.

She needs a loan for MXN $4,000, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase new merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. Boateng is 22 years old; she is unmarried with no children. Veronica is a distributor and a supplier of phone credits at a very busy market in Teshie in Accra where she lives. She takes delivery from the telecommunication industries such as MTN, Onetouch, Tigo, and others who also provide the same services and supplies to retailers. Veronica has been in this business for the past year with valuable experience in the field.

Veronica A. Boateng requests a loan to buy a bigger supply of mobile phone credits/units. She also believes the loan would allow her to rent a store to sell mobile phones. Veronica would be grateful for the loan.

She belongs to the community group called ‘Abrabopa’ (meaning Good Life) Trust Group. Members in this group provide assistance to each other to access and repay loans. She does not sell on the days the group meets. Her picture was taken during one of the group meetings.

loans.use: Purchase bulk supply of phone credits

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Maria siempre le ha gustado tejer y decidió sacarle provecho a esta habilidad, así que en temporada de invierno principalmente se dedica a vender gorros tejidos, bufandas, guantes, etc. Inició el negocio ya que  es una persona mayor,  y no la contratan en alguna empresa tan fácilmente  por eso decidió dedicarse a las ventas tener un ingreso extra para completar con el gasto familiar.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material para apoyar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria has always enjoyed knitting and decided to take advantage of her ability. She sells knitted hats, scarves, gloves, etc., primarily during the winter season. She began her business because she is an older woman and cannot easily find work with a company. For this reason, she decided to sell her items and earn an extra income to aid with the family expenses.

She needs a loan of MXN $4,000, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy materials to support her business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for work

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen en un principio empezó con el negocio ya que tenia ropa que le habían pasado y por ello decidió venderla, ya que con esto obtendría un ingreso extra ya que tenia   la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar,  porque no completaba con el ingreso que le daba su esposo. Con los ingresos que obtuvo en la primera venta fue ahorrando y compro mas y mas pacas es así como ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 3 meses para comprara una paca de ropa que me están ofreciendo a muy buen precio.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen initially began her business selling second-hand clothing to earn some extra money by selling old clothing she already had. She had to help support her family financially because her husband's income was not enough to pay for the household expenses. With the profits that she received from her first sale, she began saving and purchased more and more bundles of clothing. Through this process, she has become successful in her business.

She needs a loan of MXN $4,000, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy a bundle of clothing that she was offered at a very good price.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bundle of clothing

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is 55 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Through her business, she supported all of her children while they attended and graduated from high school. Comfort enjoys selling from which she obtains her livelihood.

She is a small trader who sells cooking spices in the local market. Many customers buy from her stand because she takes good care of them. However, she buys her supplies on credit at relatively high prices due to lack of adequate working capital.

With this loan, Comfort A. wants to purchase bulk supplies of spices to sell to her customers. She belongs to the community group called “Abrabopa” (meaning Good Life) Trust Group. Members in this group serve as guarantees for one another to access and repay loans. Her picture was taken while attending one of the meetings.

loans.use: Purchase cooking spices in bulk

loans.name: Léonie

texts.en:
Léonie Z. was born on April 11, 1973 and has 2 children. She is a seamstress by training but she opted to start a business instead. She started selling food 5 years ago in a cafeteria, but after its closing, she began selling holistic pharmaceutical products. However, she went in search of a more profitable product and sold children's underwear. Léonie used her creative side to meld her underaear business with selling boiled corn (a traditional Beninese food). With her second loan, she could like to buy more tunics to make underwear and wheat flour to make her corn snack.

Dame Z. Léonie est née le 11/04/1973, et est couturière de formation mais elle a opté pour le commerce. En effet, il y a 05 ans qu'elle s'est lancée dans la vente de nourriture dans une buvette mais après la ferméture de celle-ci, elle a commencé par vendre des produits pharmaceutiques traditionnelles. Mais cette activité ne lui a pas été rentable et elle l'abandonna au profit de la vente de sous vêtements des enfants. A la recherche d'un mieux-être, dame Z. ne manque pas d'imagination; sa dernière trouvaille est la vente de pagne et de bouillie à base de maïs.C'est pour renforcer cette activité qu'elle sollicite ce 2eme prêt pour l'approvisionnement en pagne, en maïs et farine de blé . Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le dernier prêt a servi à l'approvisionnement en pagne, en farine de blé et en huile végétale.

loans.use: 10 half swatches of hitarget fabric, half bag of wheat flour, oil drum, a bag of corn, half bag of powdered sugar

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: La Sr. María de 28 años de edad habitante en Healeah un barrio de la capital de Managua. Casada tiene tres lindos hijos de 8, 10 y 13 años todos estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Trabaja en su negocio de venta de lácteos desde 8 años de experiencia laboral, y posee sus clientes en donde lo vende. Como planes tienen comprar una nueva unidad de taxi y la construcción de un  pequeño garaje para meter su vehiculo,  Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograra cumplir con sus planes  de comprar el auto para ser utilizado como taxi y así general mas ingreso, crecer como negocio y generar mayores ventas con sus nuevos productos y darle  seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and lives in the Healeah district in the capital city of Managua. She is married and has three beautiful children aged 8, 10 and 13, all studying at a Managua school. She has 8 years of experience running her business selling dairy products to local customers. She plans to buy a new taxi, and to construct a small garage for the vehicle. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans she will be able to achieve her goal to buy a car to use as a taxi, and in this way generate more income, grow her business, increase her sales with new products, and offer security to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for a garage

loans.name: Osbaldo

texts.en: Osbaldo is a laborer. He buys, fixes up, and re-sells motorcycles to provide additional funds for his home. He started about eight years ago when he sold his first motorcycle. He has continued the trade ever since. He would like this loan to purchase another motorcycle. Osbaldo has two children, ages 2 and 4. The additional income has been important to his young family.

loans.use: buying a used motorcycle to repair and sell

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Yamileth S. Ramírez tiene la edad de 73 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta señora tiene 7 hijos de los cuales solo una de 35 años esta con ella ya que ella le ayuda en la elaboración de la comida, sus deseos son prevalecer en le mercado de la comida ya que hay muchos comedores que proporcionan competencia para ella, en sus propósitos esta mejorar el servicio de comida ya la atención de sus clientes ya que ellos son los que proporcionan los ingresos para su negocio.


La actividad económica es la de venta de comida y también alquila cuartos a estudiantes, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 26 años, ella empieza este negocio por cuenta propia y se da por los mismos estudiantes que alquilan en su casa de habitación ya que ellos le hicieron la preposición de que encargara de la elaboración de la comida y es así como se hace cargo de este negocio y así es como lo obtiene ya que esta ha sido una de las experiencias que mas le ha gustado, el financiamiento es pata capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de productos que se utilizan para las comidas y debido a estas  festividades ya que tiene encargo de comida para estos días y necesita además la compra de granos básicos por que así le resultara mas factible Esta Señora esta muy agradecida con Fundación León 2000 y otras organizaciones que contribuyen para su causa.
texts.en:
Yamileth S. Ramírez is 73 years old. She is single and has 7 children. She lives with her 35-year-old daughter who helps her to prepare meals. Yamileth's dream is to triumph in the food service industry, now that there are many restaurants in competition with her. She wants to improve both her food service and attention for her customers because they provide the income for her business.

Her profits come from selling food and renting rooms to students. She has owned her business for 26 years. She began working on her own, renting rooms in her home to the students. When the students requested that she also prepare their meals, she started a formal business. This endeavor has turned out to be one of her most enjoyable experiences.

She will use the money from the loan to buy products that she uses to prepare meals. Because of the upcoming holidays, she will also be in charge of preparing food for those days and will need to buy basic grains. Yamileth is grateful to the Fundación León 2000 and the other organizations that contribute to her cause.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. A. is 35 years old. She is widowed and the mother of five children. Through her business, Patience supported two of her children through senior high school and continues to support the others who are still in school.

She is a food vendor who sells kenkey, as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and then taken with hot peppers and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch, and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

Patience O. A. belongs to the community group called "Abrabopa" (meaning Good Life) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She does not sell on the days the group meets. Her picture was taken during one of the group meetings.

loans.use: Buy ingredients like maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has a gift shop near her home where she sells costumes, paper goods, and gift items. She began over ten years ago making costumes for school events. She has expanded her goods to included stationery and other products.

While Ruth initially began the business to help her husband provide for the family, she is now a widow and the store is her primary source of income. Her three children are now aged 20, 22, and 24. With the loan she hopes to buy additional items to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.use: additional items to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Ascencion Felipe

texts.es:
El Señor Ascensión Felipe V. Dávila tiene la edad de 48 años su estado civil es soltero, este Señor tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de el su hijo mayor de18 años cursa el 5 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 16 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria y un niño de 11 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria, sus deseos son de darle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que no ha podido realizarlas debido a que los costos de  materiales para construcción están muy altos, en sus propósitos esta el brindarle a su hijos ayuda en los estudios para que estos puedan tener un futuro orientado en los estudios.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de sorbetes de los siguientes sabores: fresa, piña, chocolate, frambuesa, limón y naranja el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 11 años, Don Ascensión inicia este negocio por cuenta propia su esposa era la que sabia como se realizaba la elaboración por que ambos trabajaban donde un amigo Don Ascensión se encarga de la venta del sorbete mas tarde decide el mismo instalar su propio negocio su esposa le enseño la elaboración y consiguió y así como obtiene el negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que es para la reparación de sus refrigeradoras ya que son útiles para la elaboración y también es para la compra de saborisantes por lo que necesita ambas cosas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ascensión Felipe V. Dávila is 48 years old. He is single and has 5 children, 3 of whom are dependents. His oldest son, who is 18 years old, is in his fifth year of secondary school. His 16-year-old son is in his fourth year of secondary school and his 11-year-old son is in the fifth grade of primary school. His dream is to renovate his home. He has not been able to fulfill his wish because the prices of construction materials are very high. One of his goals is to help his sons in their education so they can have a future based upon their studies. His primary economic activity is selling and creating ice creams of the following flavors: strawberry, pineapple, chocolate, raspberry, lemon and orange. He has owned his business for 11 years. Don Ascensión began this business with his wife. She was the one who knew how to make the ice cream and both of them worked at a friend's place. Don Ascensión was in charge of sales. Later on, he decided to start his own business and his wife showed him how to make the ice cream. This is how he started his business. The money from the loan will be used to repair his refrigerators because they are useful in the ice cream-making process. He also wants to buy additional flavorings. He needs both the refrigerators and the flavorings to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su padre. Es el heredero de varios terrenos de su padre, quien es propietario de varios terrenos frutales, lo malo es que estos terrenos se han llenado de maleza  y arbustos que no son nada productivos en sus chacras, por ello, quiere contratar personas para que con machete saquen estas yerbas. Por lo menos le llevará una semana la limpieza de sus tierras, y quedarán listas para sembrar. Lo que cultivará serán frutas cítricas, sobre todo carambolas, futro que nunca ha dejado sembrar. Nos dice que es bueno sembrar en épocas diferentes para que constantemente pueda cosechar de una u otra chacra, la dificultad que tiene es que le falta mano de obra, él y su padre no se abastecen. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita va mandar a limpiar y preparar su chacra, además comprará plantas de cítricos.
texts.en:
Julián is 38 years old, single, and lives with his father. He is the heir of various plots of land from his father, who owns several fruit groves. Unfortunately these plots of land have filled with weeds and bushes that are not productive for his crops, therefore he wants to contract people to take out these invasive plants by machete. It will take at least a week to clean up his land to be ready to plant. He will grow citrus fruits, mainly star fruit, a fruit he has never stopped growing. He tells us that is it is good to plant in different seasons so that he can constantly harvest one or another crop. The difficulty that he has is the lack of laborers, as he and his father can’t do everything. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will hire help to clean and prepare his land and buy citrus plants.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire help to clean and prepare his land and buy citrus plants.

loans.name: Anselma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Anselma del Carmen M. García este señor tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos su hijos mayor tiene la edad de 26 años y todavía no trabaja y su otro hijo de 24 años que no trabaja, esta Señora tiene los deseos de mantener su negocio siempre activo a pesar de la difícil situación que el país enfrenta actualmente, en sus propósitos esta poseer una casa propia ya que actualmente donde reside es alquilada y no ha podido comprar una casa propia y es por eso que desea luchar para tener su propia casa.


Su actividad económica es la venta de comida que esta ubicado en el Mercado la Terminal que ofrece lo siguiente de: arroz, frijoles, bistec y carne tapada, pollo rostizado el tiempo que tiene Doña Anselma de tener este negocio es de 20 años, ella da inicio a este negocio por necesidad de mantener a sus hijos y empieza la venta de comida como: huevo tajada y refresco y a medida que pasaba el tiempo ella fue adquiriendo practica y mas tarde decide vender  mas productos y así obtener mas afluencias de clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y otros y tiene que recurrir a los diferentes distribuidoras para que esta le vendan de forma más factible.
texts.en:
Anselma del Carmen M. García is 58 years old. She is single and has 2 children. Her oldest son is 26 years old and does not work yet. Her other son is 24 and does not work either. Anselma dreams of keeping her business running in spite of the difficult situation her country currently faces. One of her goals is to own her own home. Her current residence is rented and she has not been able to buy her own home. She works hard to achieve this goal.

She sells food in the Terminal Market, where she offers the following: rice, beans, beef, beef stew and roasted chicken. She has owned her business for 20 years. She started her business because she needed to support her children and began selling food such as eggs, plantains and juice. As time passed, she gained experience and decided to sell more products to attract more customers.

The money from the loan will be used to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil and other products. She will purchase her products from distributors because it is more affordable.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 44 años de edad, es casada tiene dos hijos y hace poco acaba de construir su casa propia. Desde que era niña es  agricultora, apoyaba a sus padres en sus actividades, desde que se casó abrió una tienda donde útiles de oficina y verduras en general, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 7 años, y todo este tiempo le ha servido para incrementar su clientela, a Luz le agrada mucho conversar, procura que  sus clientes se vayan satisfechos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita será usado para incrementar la cantidad de productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Luz is 44 years old, married with two children and she just finished building her own home. She has been a farmer since she was a young girl, she used to support her parents in their work. When she married she opened a store selling office supplies and groceries, and has had this business for 7 years. During these years she has grown her clientele. Luz likes to talk, and she indicates that her customers are very satisfied. This is her third loan with MFP. The money will be used to increase the quantity of products in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the products in her store

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Senor Martinez first worked with his father in his gift shop. Eight years ago he decided to take a microloan to start his own business. This business is his main source of income to support his wife and two young children. He would like this loan to enable him to expand his stock of figures for the holiday season.

loans.use: additional materials for his pottery sales

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine T. is 28 years old and orginally from Guézin, a touristy lake village in southern Benin. She is married to Florentin Agonsanou, a building electrician, and has 3 children named Gladys, Floriane, and Mélaine. At 4 years old, she was placed and helped her to sell akassa (a Beninese snack made of corn flour and placed in a leaf) and fresh fish. Aferwards she went to beauty school for 3 years. Due to lack of funding she could not finish her schooling, and so she opened her own business after Glady's birth. She made little snacks of wheat flour and eggs; afterwards she accompanied her stepmother to Nigeria to buy wheat flour which she distributed at bakeries. For the last 3 years she has sold shoes to men and women that she buys from Chinese stores and resells in the Dantokpa Market. This is her third loan to buy more pairs of shoes.

Dame T. Christine est âgée de 28 ans et est originaire de Guézin un village lacustre du Bénin. Elle est mariée à AGONSANOU Florentin qui est électricien bâtiment de formation et est mère de 03 enfants ( Gladys, Floriane et Mélaine). Elle a été placée à l'âge de 4ans chez sa tante qu'elle aidait à vendre de l'akassa et des poissons fris. Ensuite, des sacs de juts, après elle alla en apprentissage de coiffure et ceci pendant 3 ans. Faute de soutien financier elle n'a pas pu obtenir le diplôme de fin d'apprentissage, elle s'est alors mise à son propre compte juste après la naissance de Gladys. Elle vendait des pasquettes faite à base de farine de blé et des oeufs; ensuite elle accompagnait sa marâtre au Nigéria pour l'achat de la farine de blé qu'elle distribue dans les boulangeries. Depuis 3 ans, elle s'est mise à vendre des chaussures dames et hommes qu'elle achète dans les magasins chinois et qu'elle revend dans le grand marché DANTOKPA. Elle sollicite ce 3eme prêt en vue de renforcer l'activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 6 boxes of different styles of shoes

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
Su nombre es Martha Azucena Q. C. su edad es de 35 años, su estado civil es acompañada, esta Joven tiene 3 hijos de los cuales su hija mayor tiene la edad de 15 años y cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria, su otro hijo tiene la edad de 7 años que cursa recientemente 3 grado de primaria y su niña de 3 años que todavía no estudia, su compañero de vida labora como guarda de seguridad, en sus deseos esta en  tener una casa propia ya que en la que habita actualmente es de su mama y también quiere proporcionarle mejoras a su casa de habitación ya que sus hijos necesitan un lugar donde vivir tranquilos.


El tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 27 años, su actividad económica es la de venta de comida donde ofrece sus diferentes comidas como: gallo pinto, tortas rellenas, enchiladas, maduro, queso y huevo cosido, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo pero quien empieza con el negocio es una tía de esta Joven Martha ya que esta le ayudaba en la elaboración de la comida y al pasar el tiempo su tía se enfermo y le dejo a cargo este negocio y fue entonces como empezó este negocio que tiene actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar las compras de granos básicos y tiene que viajar para realizar la compra de estos productos.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena Q. C. is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. Her older daughter is 15 years old and recently enrolled in her fourth year of secondary school, her son is 7 years old and recently started the thrid grade of primary school, and her younger daughter is 3 years old and has not started school yet. Her partner works as a security guard. They currently live with her mother and dream of having their own house, where they can make improvements and offer their children a peaceful place to live. Martha has run her own business since she was 27 years old, selling meals which include different dishes such as rice and beans, filled rolls, enchiladas, cheese and hard-boiled eggs. Martha's aunt founded the business, and Martha worked helping her aunt to prepare the food. When her aunt became sick she left Martha in charge of the business, and it was then that Martha founded the business that she now runs. The loan will be used for working capital, as she needs to purchase basic supplies and must travel to purchase these products.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres. Desde muy jovencita se ha dedicado a L. agricultura, siembra plátanos y cítricos en varias hectáreas de terreno que usa de forma alternada, cuando es tiempo de cosechar almacena el producto en su casa para ser encajonado y enviarlo al mercado de L. ciudad. También siembra café, esta temporadas le es rentable, en cambio el plátano, aunque cuesta barato nunca deja de producir buenos ingresos y le es muy rentable porque cada 15 días cosecha de una o de otra chacra, permitiéndole enviar semanalmente plátano al mercado, a elL. le agrada su actividad, le tiene mucho cariño a su chacra porque es L. fuente para generarse una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero piensa comprar insecticidas para sus plantas de plátanos de seda.
texts.en:
Magaly is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young, growing bananas and citrus fruits on a few hectares of land which she farms in rotation. When she harvests the fruit, she stores it in her house, packages it, and sends it to market in the city. She also grows coffee, which is seasonally very profitable. Bananas, on the other hand, are always inexpensive but never fail to provide good income. They are very profitable for her because every 15 days she can harvest from one farm or another, allowing her to send bananas to market each week. She enjoys her lifestyle and cares a great deal about her farm as it allows her to create a better life for herself. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she plans to buy insecticide for her banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de insecticidas para sus plátanos

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela tiene 49 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos, quienes siguen viviendo en su casa. Durante su niñez apoyaba a sus padres en su chacra, cuando se casó, junto a su esposo sembraban plátanos en las dos hectáreas de tierra que tenían, la que hasta ahora les produce, pero hace cinco años decidió abrir una bodeguita denominad “Bodega Mechi”, y ella le gusta el comercio y hace con agrado, hace un año incrementó sus ventas, adicionando carnes rojas y de pollo, este rubro le resulta más rentable, asimismo la venta de cerveza le es mucho más rentable. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP. Tiene planeado comprar una vitrina para exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Marcela is 49 years old, married, with three children who live at home. During her childhood she helped her parents on their farm and when she married, she and her husband planted bananas on their two hectares of land. This was their livelihood until five years ago when they decided to open a small grocery store called "Bodega Mechi". Marcela likes the store and works there happily. A year ago they increased their sales by adding chicken and red meat, which made their business much more profitable, as did the decision to sell beer. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to buy a display case to better show her products.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a display case for her shop

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with grown children. He runs a small business selling footwear in the local market of Kahovka. His business doesn’t face much competition as there are very few other businessmen with similar products. Alexander started this venture 12 years ago. However, he is already making about 2,500 Grivnas in profit each month.  

Alexander is seeking a loan of 4,000 Grivnas for 7 months. He is hoping to see his business grow further and expand even more. We believe his commitment to his venture and personal characteristics will help him repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: to generate additional profit from his shoe store

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Alba Maria V. tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo su hijo mayor tiene la edad 20 años que labora como comerciante y su otra hija tiene la edad de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo por lo que la situación esta muy difícil en sus deseos esta le gustaría obtener una casa propia ya que necesita dejarle a sus hijas su propia casa ya que para ella es muy importante, además quiere que sus hijas logren tener éxito en los estudios para que no tengan dificultades para el día de mañana.


Su actividad económica es una pulpería donde vende productos como: golosinas, colas, granos básicos y otras cosas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 6 años, ella inicia este negocio por la idea de una amiga quien le dijo que instalara una pulpería en su casa de habitación y empieza con los productos de pan y golosinas y mas tarde al notar que obtuvo afluencia de clientes decide incrementar mas en su negocio para obtener lo que actualmente tiene, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de juguetes debido a la temporada festiva y también en la compra de ropa para niños y caramelos por lo que se acerca la celebración de la purisima y sus clientes buscan los lugares mas favorables.
texts.en:
Alba Maria V. is 46 years old, is single and has two children. Her son is 20 years old and works as a salesman, and her daughter is 16 years old and recently enrolled in the second year of secondary school. Her goal is to overcome difficulties and keep her business active. She hopes to be able to obtain her own house which she will be able to leave to her children, which is very important to her. Additionally she hopes that her children will have success in their studies so that they don't encounter difficulties in the future. Alba runs a small store where she sells products such as snacks, candy, soda, basic supplies and other things. She started the business 6 years ago when a friend suggested that she open a store in her home. She started selling bread and snacks, and later as she built her customer base she expanded her business. The loan is for working capital to be used to buy toys, children's clothes and candy to sell during the holiday season, when her customers look for the most favourable places to buy gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 45 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que la apoyan y que son la razón de su esfuerzo. De niña ayudaba a los quehacer de la agricultura a sus padres, una vez que empezó a vivir con su esposo sembró varias hectáreas de cítricos, los que le generen bueno ingresos económicos. Hace dos años abrió un pequeño kiosco frente a su casa para vender gaseosas y galletas, y nota que la venta le deja ganancias, ya que por el calor las gaseosas son muy demandadas, y ahora también está preparando refresco con hielo. Adicionalmente cultiva café y frutos cítricos, pero solo para la temporada cuando los precios son altos y puede tener ganancias. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Una parte del dinero será invertido en la compra de las golosinas y gaseosas y la otra parte en la compra de insecticidas para su chacra de cítricos.
texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children whom she supports and who are the reason for her strength. As a child she helped her parents with their agricultural work, and once she moved in with her husband they planted a few hectares of citrus trees, which earn them a good income. Two years ago she opened a small kiosk in front of her house to sell soft drinks and cookies. The booth made a profit; soft drinks were in high demand because of the heat, so she began to sell them with ice. She also grows coffee and citrus fruits, but only for the season when prices are high and she can make a profit. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. One part of the money with be spent buying cookies and soft drinks and the rest on purchasing insecticides for her citrus farm.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products for sale

loans.name: Saadia Evangelina

texts.es:
La Señora Saadia Evangelina Pérez Caballero tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Evangelina tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella su hija mayor tiene la edad de 27 años y trabaja en Managua, su otro hijo de 20 años de edad cursa el 2 año de la carrera Ciencias Actuariales Financieras y un niño de 12 años que cursa el 6 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como técnico en la especialidad de maní, sus deseos son  de seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que ellos continúen adelante y sepan defenderse para el día de mañana  no tengan necesidades.


El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, la actividad económica a al que se dedica es la venta de sabanas, Doña Saadia inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza con media docenas de sabanas que decidió instalar un mostrador en la pulpería de su mama para que cuando los clientes llegaran a comprar pudieran apreciar su trabajo mas tarde una señora de somotillo llegaba a la pulpería y le pedía encargos de sabanas y es así como Ella va incrementando en su trabajo y al paso del tiempo se ofreció la distribución de sus productos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo  ya que necesita tener surtidos los colores de las sabanas y necesita realizar las compras en los departamentos de Chinandega y Managua por lo que necesita comparar las telas y texturas de la sabanas para dar mejor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Saadia Evangelina Pérez Caballero is 49 years old, is married and has three children who are dependent on her. Her daughter is 27 years old and works in Managua, her older son is 20 years old and studying his second year of an Actuarial Business Sciences degree, and her younger son is 12 years old and enrolled in the sixth grade of primary school. Her husband works as a technician in the peanut business. She hopes to continue helping her children so that they keep making progress and know how to look after themselves, and so that in the future all of their needs are met. Saadia has run her own business selling sheets for 10 years. She started the business on her own count, with half a dozen sheets that she put on display in the small grocery store run by her mother so that when customers came into the store they would see her merchandise. Later a woman from the town of Somotillo came into the store and placed an order for sheets, and in this way Saadia started growing her business and over time she increased the distribution of her products. The loan is for working capital, to purchase sheets in a selection of colours. She needs to go to Chinandega and Managua to compare the fabric and texture of sheets and offer the best quality product to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tocossone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ayant acquis une très grande expérience sur la transformation des produits locaux lors du premier prêt de Kiva et surtout ayant bien réussi à mener leurs activités, les membres du groupement TOCOSSONE 2 de l'écovillage keur Goumak reviennent auprès de Kiva solliciter un renouvellement de prêt. Avec ce prêt, elles vont pouvoir redynamiser leurs activités de :
- transformation des fruits (mangue, papaye, orange, banane) et légumes (carotte, choux, navet) 
- transformation de l'huile,
- transformation de céréales locales
texts.en:
Having acquired a great deal of experience in processing local products with the help of their first Kiva loan, and especially having successfully managed their small businesses, the members of the TOCOSSONE 2 group of the Keur Goumak ecovillage are returning to Kiva to request a renewal of their loan. With this loan they will be able to dynamize their businesses in: processing fruit (mangoes, papayas, oranges, and bananas) and vegetables (carrots, cabbages and turnips); processing oil; and processing local cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for processing fruit, vegetables, and cereals

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine A. was born on February 21, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and has 6 children, but the last one at home is Edwige. At 4 years old, she began to live with her father's aunt, whom she helped to sell igname (a hard potato-like vegetable) and bean pastries. She also sold cloth. She began her own business after the death of her aunt and the birth of her first son. She now sells akpan (milky corn soup), ice cream, fruit, and other food. She hasn not stuck with one type of business, but for the last 5 years she has sold charcoal, food, lettuce, fruit, and condiments.

Dame A. Valentine est née le21/02/1966 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin et originaire de Ouidah. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont seule la benjamine Edwige est à sa charge. A l'âge de 04 ans, elle a été placée chez sa tante parternelle, elle aidait celle-ci à vendre d'igname fris et des beignets fait à base d'haricot. Aussi elle vendait pour celle-ci du pagne. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte après la mort de sa tante et la naissance de son premier garçon, elle vendait en ce moment de akpan, de l'eau glacée, les fruits, la nourriture. Elle n'avait pas une activité stable. Depuis plus de 05 ans elle s'est lancée dans la vente de charbons , de nourriture, des laitues de salade et des fruits, elle est aussi gérante de deux moulins à condiments.

loans.use: 2 bags of rice, a half bag of rice, and a basket of lettuce with some vegetables

loans.name: Luz Maritza

texts.es:
