La señora Luz Maritza Pérez  señora tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 3 de sus hijos dependen de ella su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 27 años y trabaja por cuenta propia, su hija de 35 años trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo productos de la avon y su otra hija de 33 trabaja con ella en le mercado de la Estación, sus deseos son de tener su propio establecimiento ya que todavía no tiene un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos, en sus propósitos esta el proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda quiere acondicionarla de una forma sencilla pero que este sea a la ves un lugar sencillo  donde sus hijos y ella puedan permanecer tranquilos.


Su actividad económica es la de  mercadería en general en la que vende los productos como: pantalones, camisas, bolsos, gorras y lentes para el sol, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 35 años, su negocio da comienzo por que su mama ya tenia la experiencia de vender ropa y desde la edad de 15 años ella ayudaba a su mama en este negocio y al fallecer su mama es Doña Luz Marina quien se hace cargo de este negocio y así es como lo obtiene, el financiamiento es para  capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de sus productos ya que tiene que abastecerse para ofrecer los diferentes tipos de productos ya que se acercan los días festivos y así aprovechar la ocasión.
texts.en:
Luz Maritza P. is 53 years old, is single and has four children, three of whom live with her. Her older son is 27 years old and is self-employed, her 35 year old daughter works independently selling Avon products, and her 33 year old daughter works with Luz in the Estación market. Her goals include having her own store, as she still doesn't have a fixed location to offer her products. She also hopes to make simple improvements to her home so that it will be a place where she and her children can live peacefully. She works selling clothing including pants, blouses, bags, gloves and sunglasses. She has run this business for 35 years. The business was started by her mother who already had experience selling clothes, and Luz started helping her mother with the business when she was 15 years old. When her mother passed away Luz took charge of the business. The loan is for working capital that will be used to increase her stock of products as the festive season approaches.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.pt:
Ana Maria M. e natural de Maputo, tem 44 anos de idade, e casada maritalmente, tem 4 filhos, o primeiro tem 25 anos e trabalha na Africa do Sul com 8ª classe concluída, o segundo com 23 também trabalha na Africa do Sul com 9ª classe concluída, o terceiro tem 20 anos e frequenta 9ª classe, o quarto tem 16 anos e frequenta 9ª classe, o ultimo tem 7 anos e frequenta 3ª classe.

Ana estudou ate 4ª classe do antigo sistema e parou de estudar quando começou a fazer negocio a mais de 20 anos atrás, teve a sua infância em Boane e depois foi viver no Bairro do Jardim quando juntou-se maritalmente com o seu marido este que se encontra a trabalhar na Africa do Sul. Basicamente sustenta os seus filhos.

O negocio dela e venda de produtos alimentares o qual faz a mais de 20 anos, onde destaca os seguintes produtos: Amendoim que compra por 490 rands e vende por 1800,00mt e Feijão que compra por 450rands e vende por 1700,00mt, assim tem um rendimento mensal de 8000,00mt liquido e consegue poupar 3500,00mt.

Ana tem plano para um futuro breve de construir algumas dependências para aluguer de quartos de forma aumentar a sua renda familiar.
texts.en:
Ana Maria M. is a native of Maputo, is 44 years old, and is married with five children. Her oldest is 25, finished 8th grade, and works in South Africa. Her second child is 23, finished 9th grade, and also works in South Africa. Her third, 20 years old, attends 9th grade, her fourth, 16, also attends 9th grade, and her youngest, 7, is in 3rd grade. Ana studied until 4th grade (old system) and left her studies when she started her business over 20 years ago. She grew up in Boane, and later moved to Bairro do Jardim when she married her husband, who now works in South Africa. Essentially, she alone supports her children. Her grocery store has been in business for over 20 years, and specializes in these products: peanuts, which she buys for 490 Rands and sells for 1,800 MT, and beans, which she buys for 450 Rands and sells for 1,700 MT. She has a monthly income of 8,000 MT in cash, of which she is able to save 3,500 MT. In the near future, Ana plans to build and rent rooms to augment her family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products for resale

loans.name: Domingo Gonzalo

texts.es:
El Señor Domingo Gonzalo G. I. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltero, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de el su hijo mayor tiene la edad  de 13 años que cursa recientemente el 5 grado de primaria y un varón de 12 años que cursa el 1 grado de primaria, sus propósitos son de poner una venta y en sus sueños esta el acondicionar su vivienda ya que esta le quedaría a sus hijos para que estos no tengan necesidades para el día de mañana y también darle un futuro de estudios.


Su actividad económica es la de destace de cerdo y una pulpería, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, el da inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia y decide comenzar con 1 cerdo que seria destinado para el destace y mas tarde incrementa el destace con 5 cerdos y así obtuvo la afluencia de clientes, mas tarde realizar una inversión de una pulpería donde vendería unos cuantos productos como: refrescos y golosinas y así obtiene esta venta, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que desea incrementar su negocio en granos básicos y tiene que comprar las diferente productos donde le resulten mas factible.
texts.en:
Domingo Gonzalo G. I. is 44 years old, is single and has two dependent children. His older son is 13 years old and recently started the fifth grade of primary school, and his younger son is 12 years old and in the first grade of primary school. His goals are to have his own shop, and he dreams of making improvements to his home for the sake of his children, ensuring that their needs are met in the future and that they can continue with their studies. He works selling pork and running a small store, and has owned this business for 7 years. He started the business on his own count, starting with one pig to be cut up and sold, and later increased this to 5 pigs, and in this way he built up a customer base. Later he invested in the store, where he sells a variety of products such as soft drinks and snacks. The loan is for working capital in order to increase his stock of basic supplies and purchase different products.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano started as an apprentice in a butcher shop. About four years ago, he opened his own shop with the support of a micro loan. He plans to use this new loan to expand the range of meats he can offer in his shop.

Mariano uses the additional resources to support his parents and younger siblings. He wants to ensure that his siblings can continue to attend school.

loans.use: additional meat and other items for re-sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive su hijo y su madre que la acompaña y ayuda. Hace 10 años trabajaba en la ciudad de Lima, en un puesto de venta ropa, al tener su hijo ya le fue imposible seguir trabajando, por ello vio por conveniente volver a su tierra natal. Ahí estuvo trabajando en la chacra hasta juntar capital, ahora ha podido implementar una bodega, donde también vende ropa. La venta de estas prendas le es más rentable que la de comestibles, además no tiene competencia. Rita está muy feliz con su negocio. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP. El dinero es derivado a la compra de ropa para todas las edades, sobre todo para niños.
texts.en:
Rita is a 28 year old single mother. She lives with her son and her mother who helps her and keeps her company. 10 years ago she worked selling clothes in Lima, but after having her son it was impossible to continue working, so she thought it best to return to her hometown. She worked on the farm to save up money, and has now opened a small clothing store. Selling these garments is more profitable than selling food and in addition, she has no competition. Rita is very happy with her business. This is her fourth loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The money will be spent buying clothing for all ages, especially children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the amount of clothing for sale

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sr. Josefa  tiene 54 años de edad, casada, su marido tiene 74 años, el cual recibe una pensión de asegurado y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Habitante Healeah, los clientes tienen un bus que viaja de Managua a Juigalpa, lo trabajado  uno de sus hijos. Su casa es de zinc y tablas, no posee una seguridad. Sus planes son construir la casa de concreto. La Clienta cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el servicio de trasporte y como unas de su meta a futuro es cambiar la unidad de trasporte que poseen debido a que la actual tiene unas fallas y darle un mejor servicio a los pasajeros. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic encuentra una forma de realizar sus planes y proyectos de crecer con su negocio. Brindándole al publico en general una forma de viajar a sus puntos de trabajo y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is 54 years old and married. Her husband is 74 years old, receives retirement benefits and helps with the cost of living. They live in Healeah and own a bus that travels between Managua and Juigalpa, one of their sons also works on the bus. Her house is made of tin and planks and she does not have social security. They plan to build a house of concrete. Josefa has 6 years of experience in transportation services and one of her goals is changing the bus they have as it has some faults. Thus, she can offer a better service to her passengers. Owing to the loans of Afodenic she can achieve her plans and projects to grow her business and offer the public a way of travel to their workplaces and security to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material to build her house

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 77104

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Senora Cruz began to sell sodas to her neighbors out of her home. She noticed it was going well and decided to expand the variety of products she offered her customers. She has a cart that she often takes out in the community as well to improve her sales

Senora Cruz has two children, ages 4 and 6. One is sick so the extra income helps pay for his medicines.

loans.use: additional products to expand her little store

loans.name: Risca

texts.es: Risca tiene 60 años, tuvo siete hijos, pero ahora están viviendo con ella solo 3 de ellos. Al casarse, junto a su esposo comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, siembran varias hectáreas de cítricos. Se levanta a las 4.00 am para preparar el desayuno y luego el almuerzo, mientras tanto va atendiendo la bodeguita que tiene en su casa hace 5 años y le brinda ingresos adicionales a su hogar. Cuando culmina con el almuerzo cierra la bodega y se va a la chacra llevando la comida para su esposo y para ella. A las 5.00 pm regresa y abre nuevamente su bodega, porque a esa hora sus vecinos regresan a sus casas desde sus chacras y compran sus productos. Ella  está muy contenta con lo que hace, solo que le gustaría tener más capital para surtir su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero será invertido en la compra de insecticidas y en mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Risca is 60 years old and has seven children, though only three still live at home. When she married, she and her husband began farming, planting several hectares of citrus trees. She wakes up at 4 in the morning to make breakfast and later lunch, all the while tending the small store she has in her house. She opened the store 5 years ago to bring additional income into her home. When she finishes with lunch she closes the store and goes to the farm, bringing food for her husband and herself. At 5 pm she reopens the store, because this is when her neighbors return home from their farms and buy her products She is very happy with what she does, only she would like to have more funds in order to stock her store. This is her third loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The money will be spent to buy insecticides as well as merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying insecticides for her plants and merchandise for her store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 20 años, es casada y tiene un hijo, por el momento vive en la casa de su madre. Sus padres eran agricultores, y de niña Violeta les ayudaba, hace cuatro meses empezó a preparar anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res a la parrilla con papas sancochadas) por las tardes en la puerta de su casa, sin descuidar a su pequeña niña. A ella le agrada todo tipo de negocio, tratar con la gente le encanta, por ello que ha visto por conveniente empezar con este pequeño negocio, para mas adelante poder tener un restaurante en su casa, esta actividad no le es dificultosa, además le es muy rentable. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero podrá comprar utensilios para el preparado de los anticuchos, y otra parte la utilizará para ambientar un espacio en su casa para la atención de los clientes.
texts.en:
Violeta is 20 years old and married with one child, and at the moment she lives in her mother's house. Her parents were farmers, and as a child Violeta helped them out. Four months ago she began to sell anticuchos (skewers of grilled beef heart with boiled potatoes) in the afternoons from her home, so she could care for her young daughter. She enjoys all types of business and she loves dealing with people which is why she thought it wise to start this small shop, in order to later have a restaurant in her home. This has not been a difficult endeavor and moreover, it is very profitable. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money she will be able to buy utensils for preparing anticuchos, and to decorate a space in her house to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying utensils and decorating the area where she serves her customers

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: La Sr. Nidia tiene 34 años de edad, habita en Healeah, madre soltera con tres hijos de 3, 18 y 19 años de edad. Actualmente realiza un aumento de su casa para brindarle mayor comodidad a su núcleo familiar y espacio para su negocio en donde pueda alcanzar mayores cantidades y variedad de productos. E l negocio tiene catorce  años de existir y se inicio en compañía del padre de sus hijos, posteriormente consiguió financiamiento y ha venido creciendo aceleradamente pero los planes de doña Nidia es convertirlo en una pulpería con variedad en sus productos con calidad. Gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic le brinda, esta cumpliendo sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Nidia is 34 years old and lives in Healeah. She is a single mother with three children ages 3, 18, and 19. She is in the process of putting an addition onto her house so that her family can be more comfortable and so that her business has the space to carry a larger quantity and a wider variety of products. She started the business fourteen years ago with the father of her children. Later she obtained financing, and it has continued to grow quickly. Nidia’s plans are to convert it into a grocery store with a variety of quality products. Thanks to loans from AFODENIC she is achieving her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for an addition to her house

loans.name: Gannyedo

texts.en:
Jeanne G. was born around 1975 in Cotonou and is married and has 3 children who are all at home. Jeanne used to help her mother sell at her store, but after her marriage in 1988 she opened her own store and sells eggs, thermoses, and baby items. She makes her purchases in Missébo and is a mobile vendor. She will use this loan to buy more perfume, baby items, cologne, and infant clothes.

Dame G. Jeanne est née vers 1975 à Cotonou , elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants qui sont tous à la charge des parents. Elle aidait sa mère à vendre et après s'être mariée elle s'est mise à son propre compte depuis 1998 jusqu'à ce jour où elle elle vend des oeufs, des termoux, des articles pouvant compter pour le trouceau d'un bébé, elle fait ses achats à Missébo et fait une vente ambulante. C'est pour répondre à la demande de ses clients qu'elle a sollicité le prêt a servi à l'approvisionnement de ces articles.

loans.use: Purchase of perfume, baby items, cologne, and infant clothes

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Maria Elisa inició el negocio porque le gustan las ventas y así no descuida su casa porque trabajo solamente el tiempo necesario.
empezó vendiendo ropa porque una vecina le paso una paca de ropa a un muy buen precio, y decidió sacarle provecho vendiendo esa ropa afuera de su casa, obteniendo ganancias para pagarle lo de la paca y para invertir en mas material para que no dejar de surtir su negocio.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una paca de ropa y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Elisa started her business because she likes sales and she does not have to neglect her household because she only works the necessary hours. She started selling clothing because a neighbor gave her a packet of clothing for a very good price. She decided to take advantage by selling that clothing from her home, earning enough profit to pay for the clothing and to invest in more material so that her business would still have a supply.

Now she needs a loan for $325 that she will repay in 3 months. She will use it to buy another packet of clothing to keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a packet of clothing

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El Sr. Esteban tiene 32 años de edad, habita en Healeah, es casada su conyugue le ayuda en su negocio, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. El cliente tiene una pulpería la cual es administrada por el y su esposa, ocasionalmente realiza trabajos de mecánica automotriz y así obtiene otros ingresos adicionales para invertirlo en la pulpería. El negocio lo tiene desde hace siete años y lo inicio vendiendo granos básicos, por que el dinero que percibía de la mecánica no satisfacía las necesidades. Sus planes son crecer con su negocio y convertirlo en una distribuidora logrando mayores ganancias. Agracias al  préstamo en Afodenic sus planes serán realidad y le ofertara al cliente  variados productos y de calidad masiva.
texts.en:
Esteban is 32 years old and lives in Healeah. He is married, and his spouse helps him with the business. He has a 4-year-old son. Esteban has a grocery store that he and his wife run, and he occasionally takes on automechanic jobs to get more income to invest in the grocery store. He has had the business for seven years. He started by selling basic grains because the money he earned as an automechanic did not meet his needs. His plan is to increase the size of the business and turn it into a distributor to earn more profit. Thanks to AFODENIC’s loan his plans will become a reality and he will be able to offer his clients a variety of high-quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to sell in his grocery store

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sr. Auxiliadora tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio tierra prometida, madre soltera con dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad  ambos están estudiando.  Trabaja como dependienta de una distribuidora y comercializa ropa usada,  por cuenta propia desde hace cinco años tiene el negocio de ropa usada. Sus planes para la familia es brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor, construir su casa. Sus planes en vista de negocio es incrementar las ventas de ropa con nuevos productos y abrir su propia variedad en cual pueda obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora is 37 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of the Tierra Prometida. She is a single mother with two children: a 14-year-old and a 13-year-old, both of whom are studying. She works as a saleswoman for a distribution company and markets used clothing. She is self-employed and has been selling used clothing for five years. Her plans for her family are to offer her children a better future and to build a house. Her plans in regards to her business are to increase clothing sales with new products and to open her own store in which she will be able to bring in more income.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Cruz del Carmen se dedica a la actividad de crianza de cerdos en su propia casa de habitación donde les brinda las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo para luego proceder al destace o venta de estos animales.

Se ha caracterizado por vender carne de cerdo desde hace 16 años siendo este su único ingreso con el cual mantiene a sus dos pequeñas hijas las cuales están en edad escolar.
Debido a la necesidad de adquirir los cerdos para su actividad, la señora Cruz ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los cerdos para proceder con su comercialización en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In the Chichigalpa district in the city of Chinandega, Cruz del Carmen is dedicated to breeding pigs in her own house. Here she offers them the conditions necessary for their development, which later leads to the slaughter or sale of these animals. She has sold pork for 16 years, this being the only income with which she provides for her two young daughters who are in school. Due to the necessity of acquiring pigs for her activities, Cruz has looked for the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will permit her to buy the pigs to continue her business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Ermelinda Olívia

texts.pt:
Ermelinda T. e natural de Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, e casada maritalmente e mãe de 05 filhos, o primeiro tem 17 anos e frequenta 7ª classe, o segundo com13 anos frequenta 7ª classe, o terceiro com 9 anos frequenta 5ª classe, o quarto tem 6 anos e frequenta 2ª classe e o ultimo tem apenas 3 anos. Basicamente sustenta seu marido e seus filhos.

Ermelinda estudou ate 7ª classe, parou de estudar por falta de condições, casou-se quando tinha 20 anos de idade e o casamento dura ate hoje, vive na casa própria no bairro onde nasceu e passou toda a sua infância, o seu trabalho e de venda de frangos o qual faz com ajuda dos seus filhos, foi com a mãe que ela aprendeu a fazer o negocio a 7 anos atrás sendo esta também comerciante na mesma área. Adquire o frango por 85,00Mt e vende por 95,00 a 100,00Mt, consegue ter como lucro 5.000,00Mt e poupa 2.000,00Mt 

Para Ermelinda este e o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, conheceu a Hluvuku através da dona Elisa que também é nossa cliente. Com o empréstimo pretende aumentar os seus produtos para responder a procura e consequentemente os rendimentos, seu grande desafio e de mais postos de venda do seu produto e realizar o seu sonho de abrir uma boutique.
texts.en:
Ermelinda T., a native of Maputo, is 36 years old and is married with five children. Her oldest is 17 and attends seventh-grade. Her 13-year-old also attends seventh-grade, her nine-year-old attends fifth grade, her six-year-old attends second-grade, and her youngest is three. Essentially, she alone supports her husband and children. Ermelinda studied until seventh-grade, but conditions did not permit her to continue her education. She married at the age of 20 and her marriage continues until today. She owns her home, which is located in the neighborhood where she spent her childhood. Her business is selling live chickens, which she does with the help of her children. She learned the business at the age of seven from her mother, who is also a merchant in the same field. She purchases chickens for 85 MT and sells them for 95 to100 MT. She is able to earn 5000 MT, of which she saves 2000 MT. This is the first loan for Ermelinda from Hluvuku and Kiva. She learned about Hluvuku from dona Elisa, who is also a Hluvuku client. With the loan, she intends to increase her inventory to meet the demand, and thus her profits. Her great challenge is to sell her product in more locations and to realize her dream of opening a boutique.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing live chickens for resale

loans.name: Idalia Noemí

texts.es:
La señora Idalia F. es originaria del municipio de Chichigalpa en la ciudad de Chinandega donde se desempeña en su negocio de servicio de molino siendo visitada por varios clientes que llegan a moler maíz, cacao, entre otros.

El servicio de molino es atendido todos los días por la señora F. desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer. Es importante destacar de igual manera que ella es una dama muy esforzada y comprometida con el bienestar de su hijo debido a que es madre soltera y debe mantener los estudios del pequeño y también suplir las necesidades del hogar. Con el crédito que espera en Ceprodel logrará comprar herramientas para la maquinaria de molinos para brindar un mejora servicio.
texts.en:
Idalia F. is from the Chichigalpa district in the city of Chinandega where she works in the mill business. Various clients visit her that arrive to mill corn, cocoa, etc. Ms. F. offers the mill service every day from early hours in the morning until dusk. It is important to emphasize also that she is a very hard-working woman. She is committed to the well-being of her son since she is a single mother and has to support her young child's studies and also provide for the household necessities. With the loan that she hopes for from Ceprodel, she will be able to buy tools for the mill machinery in order to offer a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for the mill service for food

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: La Sr. Luisa de 43 años de edad, casada,  habita en reparto España un barrio de la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja vendiendo autos usado. Doña Luisa tiene 4 años de vender fritanga por la noche, alquila teléfono y ofrecer clases de danzas a niños y adultos. Siendo una forma más de generar ayuda económica para su casa y así cubrir las necesidades. Inicio su negocio con lo que ganaba como profesora de danza en su casa de habitación. Sus planes son aumentar sus ventas de fritangas con nueva variedad de comida para vender. Agracia a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra comprar en mayores cantidades y  eso le generar mayor ganancia. Dándole un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa is 43 years old, married, and lives in Reparto España, a neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband sells used cars. For four years, Luisa has sold fried snacks at night, rented telephones, and offered dance classes to children and adults. This has been a way to generate financial support for her household and cover the necessities. She started her business with the money she earned as a dance instructor in her home. Her plans are to increase her sales of fried snacks by selling a new type of food. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she will be able to buy in larger quantities, and this will generate greater profits for her, providing a better future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meats and products to sell

loans.name: Maria Félix

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es el negocio al que se dedica la señora María Felix C. desde hace 11 largos años en el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio lo ha venido desarrollando a través del tiempo y por este motivo ha logrado brindarle las condiciones necesarias a sus pequeños hijos.

La razón por la cual la señora María Felix solicita un crédito es para la compra de mercadería como ropa para caballeros, damas y niños de diferentes estilos para su respectiva comercialización. Es por esta razón que continúa esperando en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con dicho crédito para mejora de su negocio.
texts.en:
María Felix C. has been dedicated to the business of selling clothing for eleven long years in the district of Chichigalpa in the city of Chinandega. She has developed her business over time. For this reason, she has been able to offer the living conditions necessary to her young children. The reason for which María Felix is requesting a loan is to buy merchandise such as men's, women's and children's clothing of different styles to be sold. It is for this reason that she continues to have faith in Ceprodel, so that she will be the beneficiary of this loan to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora ALEJANDRINA pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS VIOLETAS II,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Rioja y distrito Nueva Cajamarca. Se dedica a la venta de frutas . Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de la misma localidad. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas frutas de la  región como naranjas, mandarinas, granadillas, taperiva, coconas en cientos, plátanos y guineos en racimos, paltas, papayas y huevos en  jabas, de esa manera podrá tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes. 

Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 04 hijos, uno de ellos ya es independiente y ahora vive con sus 03 hijos y su esposo que se dedica a trabajos eventuales de construcción. Su meta es poner otro negocio como la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Violetas II.” She lives in the San Martín region, Rioja province, Nueva Cajamarca district. She sells fruit. Her business is located in the market of her community. With this loan for S/. 1,500.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy diverse fruits of the region such as oranges, mandarin oranges, passion fruit, coconuts, bunches of bananas and plantains, avocados, papayas, eggs and in this way she will be able to supply her fruit stand and satisfy her customer’s demands. Alejandrina is 48 years old, mother of 4 children, one of whom is now independent and now she lives with her 3 children and spouse who is a temporary construction employee. Her goals is to open another business such as selling clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El caballero Roberto G. se desempeña en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde que tiene el negocio  ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y por este motivo se desempeña laborando arduamente en el negocio.


En estos momentos el negocio de venta de abarrotes del señor G. atraviesa la necesidad de ser suplido con mercadería para ofertarla y por esta razón él no duda en acudir a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los productos para su respectiva comercialización.
texts.en:
Roberto G. owns his own business selling groceries in the district of Chichigalpa in the city of Chinandega. Since he has had the business he has managed to earn a living, improving living conditions for his family. For this reason, he works hard at his business. Lately, Roberto's business of selling groceries faces the need to be supplied with merchandise to be sold. For this reason, he has no doubts in turning to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy the products that he will then sell.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic goods

loans.name: Amelida

texts.es:
La señora Amelida, socia del BC “Las Violetas II”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Rioja y distrito D. Nueva Cajamarca. Tiene 42 años D. edad, es madre D. 04 hijos, ya todos son independientes y vive con su esposo que es agricultor y motocarrista. Se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales D. la marca Natura. Sale constantemente a vender en lugares cercanos a su distrito.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos como uña D. gato, penca D. tuna, calcio, jabones y otros productos que son muy solicitados entre sus clientes, también quiere invertir en ropa para damas caballeros y niños. Quiere aprovechar que su hija vive en la capital para que le envíe desD. allá.  

Amelida es una mujer emprendedora. Está agradecida a Manuela Ramos por la confianza que le dio al brindarle un préstamo que la ayudara a crecer en su negocio. Más adelante desea surtir más su negocio, tanto D. ropa como D. productos naturales.
texts.en:
Amelida is a member of the Las Violetas II (the Violets II) Village Bank, and lives in the San Martín region, in the Nueva Cajamarca district of the Rioja province. She is 42-years-old and the mother of 4 children, all of whom are independent. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer and motorcycle-taxi driver. She earns her living by selling Natura-brand natural products, which she is constantly out selling in and around her district. With her loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, Amelida will buy products such as cat’s claw, Nopal (prickly pear cactus), calcium, soaps, and other products in high demand by her customers. She would also like to invest in clothing for women, men and children. She hopes to take advantage of the fact that her daughter lives in Lima, and receive some orders from there. Amelida is an enterprising woman. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in her and giving her a loan, which has helped her grow her business. In the future she would like to stock her business with as much clothing as natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cat's claw, nopal, calcium, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo y alegría todas las mañanas en el municipio de Chichigalpa la señora Urania se levanta para abrir su negocio de abarroterías atendiendo a sus fieles clientes que le visitan en su establecimiento. 

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias económicas que ella a lo largo de la historia de su negocio ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante apoyándose de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha sabido invertir sabiamente en la compra de mercadería para suplir sus estantes. Hoy en día el crédito solicitado será utilizado para compra de granos básicos para su venta.
texts.en:
Urania gets up every morning with a lot of enthusiasm and joy in the town of Chichigalpa to open up her grocery store where she serves the loyal clients who visit her shop. Despite the difficult economic situations she has had to pass through during the years spent in her business, she has managed to make headway with the help of the Ceprodel loans. She wisely invested the loans into the purchase of goods to replenish her stock. The loan she requests now will be used to purchase grains for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La señora CAROLINA es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas de Jorge Chavez II “, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y repuestos en general. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. vía de evitamiento C-14.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará aceite y otros lubricantes, filtro de freno, focos, pernos, y repuestos que son lo más pedidos entre sus clientes, etc, y con ello poder satisfacer sus necesidades.

Tiene 55 años de edad y vive con su esposo ya que sus hijos son independientes. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio, porque es quien dirige el negocio. Su meta es surtir más su negocio con otros tipos de repuestos.
texts.en:
Carolina is a member of the Las Estrellas de Jorge Chavez II (the Stars of Jorge Chavez II) Village Bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the Tarapoto district. She earns her living selling lubricants and spare parts. Her business is located in her home on Jr. Vía de Evitamiento C-14. With her loan of 800 Soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, Carolina will buy oils and other lubricants, brake filters, headlights, bolts, the most popular spare parts, and other items, so she can meet the needs of her customers. Carolina is 55-years-old and lives with her husband. Her children are independent. She considers herself an independent businesswoman, as she is the one who manages and makes the decisions for her business. Her goal is to stock her business with a wider variety of spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oils and other lubricants, brake filters, headlights, bolts, and spare parts.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: El Sr. Nicolasa  tiene 51 años de edad,  habita en Healeah un barrio de la capital de Managua, madre soltera de un hijo de 19 años de edad,    que está estudiando en la universidad y en su tiempo libre le ayuda a su madre. Trabaja de sol a sol en el molino, venta nacatamales, tortilla, cosa de horno y chicharrón desde hace quince años, iniciando con capital propio y con su trabajo ha logrado que su hijo haya llegado a la universidad. Sus planes son componer la estructura del molino y construir una chimenea par mejor confort en la elaboración de sus productos. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes de  un negocio grande y fuerte será culminado y tendrá para ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 51 years old, lives in the Healeah district of the capital Managua. She has a 19-year-old son who studies at the university and helps her mother in his free time. Nicolasa works at a mill day in, day out and has been selling nacatamals (stuffed corn dumplings), tortilla, baked goods and chicharrones (pork cracklings) for 15 years. She started her business with her own capital and has achieved with her work that her son can go to university. She plans to repair the structure of the mill and build a chimney to be able to prepare the dishes in a more comfortable way. Thanks to the loans of Afodenic she will be able to achieve her plans of a big and strong business and would be able to provide a better future to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material to improve the structure of her mill

loans.name: Dédé Nina

texts.en:
Dédé Nina K. was born around 1939 in Cotonou. She is a widowed mother of 7 educated children who have all left the home. She started out selling fabric in Dantokpa Market but afterwards she got her own boutique in her neighborhood where she sells food, bath products, and a little bit of everything. Her parents are deceased and her father was an architect and her mother a reseller. She has had her business for 30 years and she will use this loan to buy assorted products.

Dame K. Dédé Nina est vers 1939 à Cotonou elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants tous scolarisés et dans la vie active. Elle a commencé par la vente des pagnes dans le grand marché de tokpa mais après gère sa propre boutique en son domicile où ele vendait des divers, des vivres, des produits de toillettes bref un peu de tout. Ses parents sont deccédés et le père était un architecte et la mère de qui elle tenait était revendeuse. Elle exerce cette activité depuis une trentaine d'année et la demande de ses clients étant plus forte elle a sollicité son 4eme crédit pour s'approvisionner.

loans.use: 2 bags of Rice, 2 milkboxes, Preserves, Detergents, Bathroom products

loans.name: Catita Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Catita Alvina pertenece al BC. La Mujer Riojana y vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de jugos y extractos de frutas y verduras. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central  Pto. N° 129, lugar donde espera a sus clientes. También vende refrescos y chupetes por las tarden en su casa ubicado en el Jr. Julio C. Arana 219. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará frutas frescas como plátanos, piñas, papayas, azúcar en saco, leche y cerveza negra. Con estos productos quiere estar abastecida con lo necesario para atender bien a sus clientes, también implementará un nuevo puesto de venta que acaba de comprar en el mercado.
Catita tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 03 hijos y vive con 02 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catita Alvina belongs to the Mujer Riojana (Riojan Woman) Village Bank in the city of Rioja in San Martin, Peru. She sells juices and fruit and vegetable extracts from her stall in the Central Market where she awaits her customers every day. She also sells drinks and popsicles in the afternoons from her home on Julio C Arana Street. With this $975 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy fresh fruit like bananas, pineapples, papayas, sugar, milk, and beer. With these products, she will be well-stocked in order to properly attend to her customers; she will also set up a new stall that she recently purchased in the market. Catita is 51 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are still dependent on her and live with her. Her goal is to expand her business and help her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, pineapples, papayas, sugar, milk and beer

loans.name: Felizarda Virgínia

texts.pt:
Felizarda T. e natural de Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, e casada maritalmente, e mãe de 04 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 16 a 06 anos, o mais velho tem 16 anos e frequenta a 7ª classe, o segundo tem 12 anos e frequenta a 5ª classe, o terceiro tem 08 anos e frequenta a 4ª classe e o ultimo com 06 anos frequenta a 2ª classe. Basicamente sustenta os seus filhos e o seu marido.

Felizarda estudou ate 6ª classe interrompeu os estudos por falta de condições para continuar, o seu trabalho e de venda de frangos o qual faz pessoalmente com ajuda dos seus filhos. Aprendeu a fazer o negocio a 07 anos atrás com a sua mãe que também e comerciante na mesma área, tem como rendimento 3000,00 e consegue poupar 1500,00 ate ao final do mês.

Felizarda pede empréstimo na HLUVUKU e no KIVAS pela primeira vez, conheceu a HLUVUKU através a partir da dona Elisa que já e nossa cliente.Com o empréstimo pretende aumentar a quantidade de frangos para dar resposta a demanda e consequentemente aumentar os seus rendimentos.

Felizarda tem como desafios expandir o seu negócio colocando o seu produto em mais pontos estratégicos, e futuramente realizar o sonho de ter uma mercearia.
texts.en:
Felizarda T. is from Maputo, 36 years old, married and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 6 and 16. The oldest is 16 years old and is in the 7th grade, the second oldest is 12 and is in 5th grade, the third is 8 and in 4th grade and the youngest is 6 and in 2nd grade. She supports her children and her husband.

Felizarda was in school until the 6th grade when she interrupted her studies as she didn’t have the means to continue. Her work is to sell chickens, which she does herself with the help of her children. She learnt her trade 7 years ago from her mother who was also a trader in the same area. She has a monthly income of 3000,00 MZN and manager to save 1500,00 MZN.

This is Felizarda’s first loan from HLUVUKU and Kiva and she learnt about HLUVUKU from Dona Elisa who is already our client. With this loan, she intends to increase the number of chickens so she can meet demand and consequently increase her revenue.

Felizarda’s challenges are to expand her business, placing her product in more strategic locations and in the future to achieve her dream of owning a grocery store.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more chickens to be sold

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Celestina pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II” y vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la producción de Almidón (harina de yuca) al por mayor. Su  negocio está ubicado en la Carretera Fernando Belaúnde Terry (Marginal Sur) Km. 3.5, distrito de la banda de Shilcayo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará yuca en quintales en las chacras de sus proveedores, calaminas para el secado de su producto, envases (bandejas) para el proceso de este producto. Así mismo pagará mano de obra a las personas que la apoyan en el trabajo para así abastecer a toda su clientela.  

La señora Celestina tiene 39 años de edad y 6 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella. Está contenta con el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos que le permite crecer en su negocio y poder dar trabajo a otras mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celestina belongs to the Mariginal II (Outlying Area II) Village Bank in the city of La Banda de Shilcayo in San Martin, Peru. She makes yuca flour and sells it wholesale from her stall on the Ferando Belaunda Terry Highway near kilometer 3.5. With this $975 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy large quantities of yuca in the nearby farms from the farmers themselves, thin metal plates to dry the yuca, and containers for processing the yuca. She will also use the money to pay her day laborers who help her to produce and sell to all her clientele. Mrs. Celestina is 39 years old and has 6 children, 4 of whom live with her. She is happy with the support she has received from Manuela Ramos which helps her to grow her business and which gives work to other women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of large quantities of yuca, thin metal plates, containers, and paying day laborers

loans.name: Cidlia

texts.es:
La señora Cidlia es socia del BC “CORAZON DE JESUS” y vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de de útiles de oficina, adornos y pasamanería, complementa su negocio con la venta de cosméticos de la marca Esita. Su negocio está ubicado en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará   productos en oferta como colonias, talcos, desodorantes, esmaltes, cremas, cuadernos, gomas, cintas maskintape y otros útiles que necesita para surtir bien su negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Cidlia tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos que son estudiantes y quienes la ayudan a atender el negocio. Su meta es surtir más su negocio y contar con su propio local.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cidlia is a member of the Corazon de Jesus (Heart of Jesus) Village Bank in the city of Dorado in San Jose de Sisa, San Martin, Peru. She sells office supplies, decorations, and braids and tassels for drapes and upholstery. She complements her business by selling Esita brand cosmetics. Her business is located on one of the central city streets. With this $325 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy products that are on sale like colognes, powders, deodorant, nail polish, creams, notebooks, erasers, masking tape, and other supplies which she needs to stock her business and have what's necessary to satisfy the demands of her customers. Cidlia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Her children are still in school but help her to attend to clients at their business. Her goal is to better stock her business and eventually have her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cologne, powders, deodorant, nail polish, creams, notebooks, erasers, tape, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es: La Sr. Hilda tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, con cuatros hijos de 3, 12, 14 y 16 años de edad,  tres hijos los tiene estudiando en colegio del barrio. Habitantes de barrio memorial Sandino de la capital de Managua. Su esposo trabaja en acarreo ubicado en un mercado de la capital. Posee una pequeña pulpería en donde vende  granos básicos, golosina verduras, frutas, pollo entre otros productos con dos años de experiencia en ventas, inicio su negocio con capital propio. Sus planes son  tener solides en su negocio y retomar la comercialización de cacahuate vendiéndola en la pulpería y otros puntos de la capital siendo un distribuidor del producto. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes se lograran y le dará a sus hogar una mejor comodidad, la expansión de su negocio y la seguridad de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 34 years old and married with four children of 3, 12, 14 and 16 years of age. Three of her children study at the local school. They live in the Sandino district of the capital Managua. Her husband works in transportation at a market in the capital. Hilda owns a grocery store where she sells grains, candies, fruit, vegetables and chicken among others. She has two years’ experience in sales; started her business with her own capital. She plans to solidify her business and take on the sales of peanuts again, sell it in her shop and at various points of the city as a distributor. Owing to the Afodenic loans, she could achieve her plans, could make her home more comfortable, expand her business and improve the security of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Alejandro Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Alejandro tiene 32 años de edad, vive en linda vista un barrio de la capital de Managua, casado, con la profesión asistente de mantenimiento, su esposa trabaja para una empresa privada, tiene un hijo de 16 años y lo tiene actualmente estudiando. Don Alejandro tiene tres años de experiencia en soldaduras y todo tipo de trabajo de mantenimiento eléctricos y de construcción. Los planes de don Alejandro son: la remodelación de su casa, la culminación de su carrera universitaria de ingeniería civil, los estudio de su hijo y la compra de materiales para crear una microempresa de construcción para tener una mejor estabilidad económica y social. Además en su tiempo libre trabaja a domicilio para obtener un ingreso más. Inició como ayudante de la construcción y ahora su meta es ser un ingeniero abriendo su propia empresa. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic, lograra comprar un soldador para trabajar con mejor facilidad, que a su vez aumentara sus ingresos y así mejorando su futuro.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 32 years old and lives in the Linda Vista neighborhood in Managua, Nicaragua's capital city. He is married, and his wife works for a private company. They have a 16-year-old son who is currently in school. Alejandro is an assistant handyman and has three years experience working with welding and all kinds of electrical and construction jobs. His plans are: to remodel his home, complete his course work in civil engineering at the university, for his son to continue his studies, and to purchase the materials needed to build a small construction business so he can have more social and economic stability. In his free time, he works at home to earn extra income. He started as a construction worker and now his goal is to be an engineer opening up his own business. Thanks to the loans of Kiva partner Afodenic, he'll be able to purchase a welder so he can work more easily, which will help provide him with more income and a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a welder to provide new services to his customers

loans.name: Françoise

texts.en:
Françoise A. was born around 1959 in Porto-Novo and she is married to Léonard Ahouanye, a plumber. She is the mother of 6 children and 2 are still at home. Her father was a fisherman and her mother a food vendor. She learned to sew but she didn't like it much, so decided to start a business. She began by selling bouillie (nutritious soup) and afterwards she learned to sell bags of jute (plant fiber) and bags of rice. Today she sells rice, and is applying for her fourth loan to buy more supplies.

Dame A. Françoise est née vers 1959 à Porto-Novo, elle est mariée à AHOUANYE Léonard qui est un plombier de profession et est mère de 06 enfants dont deux à la charge des parents. Son père était un pêcheur et sa mère vendeuse de nourriture. Elle a été apprenti couturière mais cela ne lui répondait pas tellement et elle a entamé le commerce, au début elle a commencé par la vente de la bouillie et après elle essaye la vente des sacs de jut et du riz où elle est devenue une experte en cela et aujourd'hui vend les sacs du riz. La demande de ses clients étant devenue plus forte elle est venue nous voir, elle est à son 4eme crédit et c'est pour s'approvisionner en plusieurs sacs de riz et des sacs de jut.

loans.use: 5 bags or rice and a few dozen bags of juts (plant fiber)

loans.name: Ynes Altagracia  Mariano De Los Santos's Group
loans.use: To buy some crates of beers to add to her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of clothes and footwear for resale

loans.name: Pura's Group
loans.use: To open a small store of selling clothes, handbags and other items for women.

loans.name: Clara Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Clara Domitila es socia del BC “Las Violetas II”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Nueva Cajamarca. Tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 03 hijas, quienes están estudiando y son la razón de su lucha constante. Se dedica a la venta de verduras picadas y menestras sancochadas en su puesto del mercado de su distrito.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será  pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos verduras como repollo, zanahoria, ajíes, pepinos, coliflor, zapallo, apio, poro, y otras verduras que necesita para la preparación de los diferentes tipos de verduras picadas, ya sea para sopas, ensaladas, guisos, etc. así mismo comprará menestras como frijol canario, huasca, pinto entre otros para sancochar y venderlos al menudeo.  

Clara Domitila es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere crecer en su negocio Más adelante desea crecer en su negocio y llegar a ser una mayorista de verduras así como también anhela ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of The Violets II Communal Bank and lives in the San Martín region of Peru. She is a 41-year-old mother of three, and her children are all in school and her constant motivation. She makes a living selling vegetable dishes and stews at a post in her local market. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within six months, she will purchase vegetables such as cabbage, carrots, chilis, peppers, cauliflower, pumpkins, celery, leeks and other vegetables that she needs to to make her different vegetable dishes (soups, salads, casseroles, etc.). She will also purchase different types of beans. Clara is a very hard-working woman who wants to grow her business. In the future, she would like to become a vegetable wholesaler and see her children become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of vegetables and beans.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora Crecencia, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de chupetes, gelatinas y golosinas. Aprovecha el tipo de clima de la zona para ofertar sus productos. Cuenta con una congeladora que le permite almacenar buena cantidad de chupetes y tiene un personal que vende en las  escuelas de su distrito.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes como azúcar en saco, bolsitas y vasitos para chupetes, colorantes y frutas para la elaboración de sus chupetes, golosinas como caramelos, chocolates, chicles en bolsas, galletas de diferentes marcas y sabores para surtir más su negocio.

Crecencia tiene 59 años de edad y 07 hijos, todos independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo y 02 de sus nietas a quienes cría como sus hijas. Su meta es arreglar su casa para poner una bodega.
texts.en:
Crecencia is a member of the Doradinas in Action Community Bank and lives in the San Martín region of Peru. She makes a living selling popsicles, ice creams and snacks, taking advantage of her area's climate with the products she offers. She has a freezer that allows her to store a good amount of treats and she has an employee who sells items at the local schools. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase ingredients to make and serve her treats, such as sugar, little bags and glasses, food dyes and fruits. She plans to make popsicles and snacks like carmels, chocolates, gums and various types of cookies to better supply her business. Crecencia is 59 years old and has seven children, all of whom are grown up and independent. She now lives with her husband and two granddaughters, whom she cares for as if they were her own children. Her goal is to fix up her home so she can put in a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make and serve her treats, such as sugar, little bags and glasses, food dyes and fruits.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Donatila

texts.es:
La señora Donatila, socia del Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a  la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa y de manera  ambulatoria visita a sus amigas y pueblos cercanos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños y niñas, para poder atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes quienes son la razón de su negocio. Quiere aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

Donatila tiene  36 años de edad, vive con su hija y su esposo quien la apoya en sus proyectos. Su meta es contar con un local en el centro de la ciudad para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Donatila is a member of the La Mujer Riojana (the Riojan Woman) Village Bank, and lives in the Rioja district of the San Martín province. She makes her living selling clothing for women, men, and children. Her business is located in her home, and she takes her cart to friends in nearby villages. With her loan of 1,500 Soles, which she will repay in 6 months, Donatila will buy clothing for women, including polo shirts, blouses, and pants, and clothing for boys and girls, so she can meet the demands of her customers, who are the reason she is in business. She hopes to take advantage of the Christmas season. Donatila is 36-years-old and lives with her daughter and with her husband, who supports her in her projects. Her goal is to have a shop downtown where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of polo shirts, blouses, pants, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Edmith

texts.es:
La señora Edmith, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, bebidas gasificadas y chicha de maíz. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y demás productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Edmith  tiene 33 años de edad,  vive con su hijo y su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Edmith is a member of the Doradinas en Acción (Dorado Women in Action) Village Bank, and lives in the San Martín region, in the San José de Sisa district of the Dorado province. She earns her living selling groceries, soft drinks, and chicha de maíz (a local drink made from corn). Her business is in her home, where her customers shop daily. With the loan of 1,000 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, Edmith will buy basic grocery products such as rice, sugar, detergents, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, and other products she needs to stock her business and satisfy her customers’ needs. Edmith is 33-years-old, and lives with her son and her husband, who is a farmer. She is very appreciative of the support she receives, as it allows her to grow her business. Her goal is to grow her business and buy her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, etc..

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La señora Emerita, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, zapatos, medicinas y bebidas gasificadas. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,100, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y otras productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Emerita tiene 41 años de edad, vive con 02 de sus 03 hijos y su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Emerita is a member of the Doradinas en Acción (Dorado Women in Action) Village Bank and lives in the San Martín region, in the San José de Sisa district of the Dorado province. She earns her living selling groceries, shoes, medicines, and soft drinks. Her business is located in her home, where her customers shop daily. With the loan of 1,100 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, Emerita will buy basic grocery products such as rice, sugar, detergents, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, and other products required to stock her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. Emerita is 41-years-old, and lives with 2 of her 3 children and her husband, who is a farmer. She is very appreciative of the support she receives, as it allows her to grow her business. Her goal is to grow her business and sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, etc.
